94i8hoyzmaJVhSJEUevM1w.text: Had the pad see ew and chicken panang. Everything came out fast, great service and very tasty. Highly recommend! The chicken panang was more peanut-y than I'm used to and I liked it!

QF4bfFC9xufoUbf8cD7d5A.text: play it safe and stick with some tom yum soup and pad see ew.   tom yum soup was delicious, i like that they bring the hot pot thing out to your table so you can help yourself.  my friend had the pad see ew w/shrimp and i ate more of her food than my own. they give you a generous amount of large shrimp and it goes well with the thick flat noodles, egg, and garlic-y sauce.   i had this rice dish...rice with spicy deep fried cat fish fillets . it was a mess of unidentifiable pieces of fish smothered in brown sauce on top of rice. NO BUENO. and they mean BUSINESs when they ask you how spicy you want your food on a scale from 1-10. i LOVE spicy, so i asked for an 8 and it was borderline that i-cant-enjoy-my-food stage for me.   service was great, my friend ordered this garlic chili beef dish and asked for it to be spicy level 8. she was dying, and i must admit, though delicious, i don't think i can enjoy eating an entire meal like that. she told the server it was way too spicy and couldn't eat it, and they happily made her another order, less spicy. i thought that was super nice of them because i'd probably tell the person "too bad," since they should know to order at their own risk!   Moral of the story: even if you love some kick to your food and (think) you can handle really spicy food, order a lower level...you can always add them to add more spice if it's not suitable!

4thOjwAfDiUIN7AG1JgZUQ.text: I'm from Fresno so majority of my reviews are compared to the food in my hometown. I would have to say the food was good but it's not great. The quantity was pretty small for the price. I felt like the place is a bit small? Since my neighbor's back is only about half a foot away from mine. Maybe a little rearranging of tables might help with rooms. Our server was nice but from my experience I don't recall him checking up on us. I think we waved and called him to us. Cups of water were small and we never had a refill. My gf had to drink my grandma's cup of ice water since they never refilled our cups for us. I would honestly give it a 2.5 stars but I can't so I'll round up that half star. Little improvement with service, you'll get there.

K5_U4v2VZkxRvO8JUU51SA.text: Food is always good but service was poor at best today. 23 muni yes to take our lunch order..... On another visit service was back to normal. I revised my review and will keep you posted.

Ebwt7N04FE9_kHuTAsivsw.text: Food was good but not happy with their service.  20%  Service charge for table of 5? Feel it was dishonest on their part because it was all written in their native language.  We almost give them tips until we asked them to about the extra charge.  Always read over the orders and don't be in a hurry to get out.

2loP6xT8CYGzkfP-1CI7NQ.text: I love this place. The food is amazing. I think this is my third review in two years and I only put one up if a place really impresses or is horrible. I live literally all the way across town nd would drive the 30 to 40 min to eat at this place anyday

UlN6Ji_Lyjmy1j-9LEhjMA.text: Kung Fu has one of the best lunch specials in Vegas. For $5.95 you get soup, an entree with steamed or fried rice, an egg roll and a fried chicken wing from 11-3pm.  The rest of the menu is very exhaustive including Thai and Chinese dishes. The hot pots of soup are intense and delicious, better for parties of 3 or more.  The food is rich and flavorful and none of the staff speaks much English*, which means the cook are Thai and know what they're doing.  *In an effort to not sound offensive, if you want people to speak perfect English get some generic food from Panda Express.

UVvm2Lc4kwoox41_p74s_w.text: The food itself is good (or at least what I ate, the pad see eaw), but I've got to say that the service here is one of the most terrible out of everywhere I've ever been...and that's saying something! The food would get a four star, service would get one star..and I'm ALL about service. Anyway the attitude of the waitstaff is "I don't care"..they're the type that are only attentive if they feel like it, and if they're not they don't care about apologizing. Kinda like when you're in the checkout line at a store and you tell the cashier you've been waiting for a long time and she ignores your statement completely, rings you up, and sends you on your way. Thats the attitude here. Maybe its because they know they're in a good location, so business will come regardless of a few unhappy people. If you tell them they have horrible service they'll literally respond "I don't care, we don't want you back anyway"...then when YOU start to have an attitude one of them will follow you out the restaurant and scream "Don't come back okay!!"......thats right, I definitely won't!

lU-4h0LuXPtCeUYpomDsMg.text: Today we tried the tom kha gai (chicken), the panang with beef, and the Rad Na with pork.  I have to say that the consistently good Thai dishes are enough for me to say that this is now my second favorite Thai restaurant!  Oh, and the Thai iced tea here is really, really good.  Perhaps the best I have had!  Very original taste, and just the right level of sweetness.  The tom kha chicken was excellent.  I think it beats even the versions at Komol and Prommares, and gets close to Thai Grill.  Thai Grill's broth is fuller and more sour, but what is great about the tom kha gai at Kung Fu is the super tender chicken chunks.  They must slow cook the chicken somehow, because it simply melts in your mouth.  It was amazing.  If only I could have this chicken in the Thai Grill broth!    The panang with beef was good too.  There was a definite peanut flavor in the first bite or two, but that flavor quickly blended away as I kept eating.  I added chili powder to the curry to balance the slight sweetness.  The pairing of the chili powder taste and the curry was simply perfection.  I wouldn't say that the panang is especially unique in style, but for the style that it is, it is nearly as good as the panang at Komol (which is the best dish I have had at Komol).  The beef was also very well prepared and tender.  As you read on you will see that meat is one of the things that Kung Fu does exceptionally well.  On to the Rad Na! The Rad Na here was one of the few versions that I actually would order alone, and when you can order Rad Na by itself, it must be damn good!  Prommares still makes the best Rad Na in town, but this is a close tie for me with Thai Grill for second.  The noodles were fresh, and the sauce was lightly sweet, and flavorful.  There was lots of bright green, thick Chinese broccoli stems and leaves.  Very fresh and very good.  The pork, again, was incredibly tender.  Very high quality meats here at Kung Fu.   Kung Fu's Thai food is very strong, and authentic.  Every time I come here, there are large families/groups of Thai people eating.  People who don't know Thai food might not realize what they are eating, and I believe that the negative reviews here are a reflection of this.  I can tell you though, if you are a Thai food lover like I am, this place makes some fine Thai food.    On the other hand, the food here is a bit heavier than the food at Thai Grill (and probably TSNH), and not as original as the recipes at my favorite Thai restaurant.  I think Thai Grill is uniquely healthy compared to Kung Fu (and most other Thai restaurants).  Between these two restaurants though, I can thoroughly satisfy my craving for Thai food.  I can't wait to try more Thai dishes at Kung Fu Thai and Chinese, especially the desserts.    Update: Losing a star for a couple of reasons.  I like the curry here, however it still doesn't have the unique flavor that I am looking for.  It is well done, but a little bit generic in style.  Secondly, the Thai menu is dwarfed by the Chinese menu.  I understand that this is where Kung Fu probably gets most of its business, but this means that Kung Fu can't offer as many Thai dishes as it should.  I find myself not wanting to go back because there is nothing new to try.    Disclaimer: this review and the prior one are for the Thai food only.

MDBlWs7EHvuXfd7bUOuB5A.text: Stopped for a light lunch while picking up my truck from the shop.  Had tom kha kai and eggrolls.  Really nice to have a place where you can get good fresh-made eggrolls. I ordered the soup with "medium" heat, and the heat level was fine.  Good amount of chicken meat, and the herbs and vegetables were all fresh.

CYYZVyZtKHrtMTYmrwGcIg.text: Staying at the LV Hilton Grand, there isn't much here...albeit a Deli with "Deli Prices".  You get the idea....  After having Italian delivered for the past 2 nights, I was ready for a change.  Kung Fu offers Chinese and Thai.  Their menu is very  substantial.  Their service is quick and efficient (including delivery / driver and phone).  I ordered Penang Beef and Spring Rolls.  Penang Beef comes with Jasmine steamed rice, lovely.    I was really surprised to see so much Zucchini in my Penang Beef though.  My first serving, I had 2 small strips of beef, and the rest Zucchini.  Second serving yielded more beef, but not much.  I think the dish SHOULD have been called, "Zucchini Penang with Beef".  I very much enjoyed the dish, and the Spring Rolls though.  I do love Thai and have enjoyed many Penang dishes in the Bay Area.  The spices were perfect (although I was questioned when I said I wanted a "7" on a scale of 1-10 for spice).  It is spicy, but not too spicy.    Kudos to Kung Fu for their service.  I would rather have excellent customer service than amazing, knock-me-down food with crappy service.  Their food was good...and service excellent.  In this city, that's great!

VmiAAQ2x2DziDjnC4CAc3Q.text: On a budget [lost all of your money or planning on losing it?] but still want to eat good?  This place is freaking AWESOME.  A DEFINITE must-have in your Vegas trip's arsenal of contingency plans for when you are too hung over to leave the hotel for food, too broke or sick of the room service food, and you want variety.  They have an extensive menu, and they DELIVER?!?    I expected the Mr. Chau/Panda Express equivalent of Chinese fast food, so I was not excited whatsoever.  When the boyfriend read off the menu options and said they had an extensive Thai menu as well, I already knew what I wanted: Their green coconut curry w/ chicken.  I don't remember what the hell else everyone ordered, but it was all in my belly quick, and the coconut curry was the BEST I've had, hands down.  The chicken was tender and moist, the veggies were crisp, and the curry itself was a sweet and spicy blend of perfection.  Not too salty, and not too bland.  I was surprised the price we paid, and bitter we wasted almost double that on 3/4 less food from room service the night prior.  We also waited JUST AS LONG for our food, too!    Definitely put this place on your speed-dial when you're there.  It was nice to have a break from the traditional American food fare at all the buffets, and even better: it saved us $$$ when feeding a grip of hungry and broke people chillin' in our hotel room.    Convenience, price, speed, service, good Asian food = 5 stars.

p5jR1_bbYoqVjLXLFrJ2Dg.text: I love this place! My dad and I used to eat here every week when we lived on that side of town. We'd get the Kung Pao Shrimp and pork pot stickers, they are absolutely delicious. The wait staff is very knowledgeable and friendly as well. I also recommend their soups. Whenever I get a bad cold in the winter I always go here and get a big bowl of their soup, it always hits the spot. If you love Chinese food in a friendly environment, come here!

UoiWgIZfusOjd_ptmWvUXg.text: I was tired of the pages and pages of pizzeria and sub fliers when a talk with the front desk lead me to carouse the menu of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese. Relieved to get something that's a little closer to home, we ordered extra to keep in the fridge for leftovers in our hotel room.  Combo pad thai was good, on the average side, medium or so portion. I would've liked to have the option of making it spicy when ordering over the phone.  Combo chop suey: The sauce and amount was great. If the ingredients marinated in the sauce a bit more, it would've been better, but with a little hot sauce it was awesome.  Mongolian beef was also good with a darker sauce and fried wonton chips sauteed with bell peppers and onions.  Wor Wonton Soup: Probably one of the best won ton soups I've had that wasn't home made. Light, and chock full of veggies and pork and mushrooms. Yum!  One other thing...  Jumbo Thai Iced Tea: Picture a Big Gulp sized Iced Tea. @_@  Overall, good quality food at awesome quantity for an amazing price.

bOS2iAyaWnwSvkEzJ9lDUQ.text: Love their chopped chicken with mint and pineapple fried rice.  I used to live fairly close and this was the go to Thai restaurant for my roommate and me.  Delivery was always super quick, orders were always correct and everything we ever orderd was delicious!

20SwboKWi6sOYUiruJVOPQ.text: Holy shit. I would rate this a 0 star if i had an option. Brought my family of 5 here, and holy cow, theres honestly NO FLAVOR in their food. Not to mention their short of staff, which occurred bad service. They also forced us to tip them. What kind of restaurant force us to tip them? So my mom gave in and did so. Smh. This place needs to be shut down, my sister got a stomach ache from eatting raw chicken of theirs

A191WpIrNq2PYASnqgNTbg.text: This review is long overdue, but I really need to give this restaurant a superb rating, because it without a doubt was delicious.  I went to Las Vegas for the summer and ate at a restaurant every day for a week, but Kung Fu Thai and Chinese Restaurant was definitely my favorite. My uncle kept saying that Thai food is good, but I've never tried it and pushed to eat at other restaurants.  On our last night there, we tried this place. I was just FLOORED by how scrumptious each and everyone one of my bites of food were. The waiters provided EXCELLENT service and they were so kind! We went at night, so it was just our huge family of around 30 and another small family at a table near us.  Foods I ate: -Tom Yum soup -Seasoned fish (forgot what it was called, but I hate fish and this was one of the only times I enjoyed eating it!) -MONGOLIAN BEEF *YES YES YES*  I forgot all of the other dishes, but I'm sure that they all had just the right seasoning, texture, and taste.  Definitely give this place a try if you're ever in the area!

Sc86-w2R3THnKa8pAM3ZTQ.text: This restaurant is from the 70's and you can tell. There's an odd smell that hits you as soon as you walk in it's a smell that is obviously rising from the old carpet that needs to be replaced! I ordered the Tom Kai Gai with chicken and when I received my food I noticed the chicken was undercooked. I let my server know and he   told me the food is fine. I told him I wouldn't eat uncooked chicken so he let me know I didn't have to but I couldn't order anything else off the menu because he wasn't going to pay for my meal. I was very disappointed in how I was treated and I'll never go back to this place. If they have a no return policy for nasty undercooked food then they should post that somewhere!

wqSNxsOXDPUQzXYFXnGrWg.text: OMG.... awesome food and cheap prices. Worth the trip from the Strip. We ate there three times in a row for dinner, yup, three on our honeymoon. We had different food every night, and everything that we had was delicious. The tofu appetizer was the only thing that we ordered twice. The people there were friendly and the service was fast even when they were busy, and it has a really homey feel to it that makes you comfortable. If I were a local, I would eat there again and again.

IbZo1C3OUQT8N_RQqlz2lw.text: Tom Yum was amazing, everything else seemed to be a little too sweet. Other then it's a really quite place to go eat.

4TY7cptdrb3hQXf6-c6IhQ.text: I have to come here every time I visit Vegas. It's off the strip, so if you're feeling lazy, they deliver right to your hotel! (with a $5 charge which is so worth it if you're hungover/tired/etc). They take about 45 minutes to an hour.  I always get the Tom Yum Shrimp. NO MATTER WHAT. and you can get the level of spice. I am a huge spicy food fan so I always get 7/10.   The restaurant has many different dishes to choose from- thai and chinese. So you will get your fix if you're craving something savory.   And of course you can't forget the fortune cookies they generously pack :)

nTmwotBQM24SitCLpOWpXA.text: By far the best Thai food I have EVER had.   My girlfriend and I came in one day wanting to try something different. We love Thai food and either dine at Archi's restaurants or order in from Weera Thai, but ever since we came here last month, I prefer this place over anywhere else.   We ordered the chicken larb, which I can only describe as a Mexican shrimp ceviche except with chicken and a bit more spice. Granted, you can order your food based on a "hot" scale and we got the 7. Needless to say I absolutely love ceviche and am now in love with the chicken larb.  In addition to the larb, we also ordered chicken pad thai noodles. We ordered the noodles without any spice and the dish actually had a hint of sweet to it but in the most amazing, warm way. It was the perfect balance between spicy and sweet. All of this comes with a side of white steamed rice but we also ordered two side orders of sticky rice. I've recently discovered sticky rice when Weera Thai mistakenly placed some in my take-out bag and I haven't gone back to anything else since. Im Hispanic so I eat a lot of my foods with tortillas and that's what sticky rice reminds me of. Roll it in a ball, flatten it and grab! I also like to soak it in the larb juice. So amazing!! Also, the best Thai Tea ever and I am not a huge fan of Thai tea.  This is literally the first time I have ever had to tell someone to take a plate away from me or I was going to make myself sick from eating so much.   And, finally, the most important part: the staff.   The staff was so nice! So, so nice! I am a firm believer that you can have the most amazing food but if your staff sucks, the entire experience sucks. I will admit that I don't know much about other cultures or what they believe so I am hesitant when going into restaurants like these because we are lesbians and I've had a bad experience before. But the waitress could not have been nicer. She was so sweet! So, so sweet! Admittedly, I loved this place so much that we went back the next night and brought along my mom and younger brother and hoped we had the same waitress.  Do try this place. Seriously. I have no complaints.

7hFQYH_oFzvFsct1IkfgRQ.text: TL;DR: Food was great, wait time was pretty long.  Review: So me and my family decided to go here while visiting Las Vegas. We looked on yelp and other websites and it seemed to look quite decent. When we got there however, it took over a half an hour to get seated. It was quite busy however, so I would not recommend going on a busy night. They apologized refusely, and honestly, that was the worst part of the meal.  The food and service was overall quite adequate. They were quite friendly with all of my family, and the food honestly tasted great to me.

xNipBz3iMYUeg6bN-mdXGw.text: Kung Fu is great. They seem so disorganized but they're not. It's a lot of fun to go there because it looks like they're in the middle of moving in or moving out. Hahaha. The bar is sort buried on one side. But you get your food and drinks with no problems. I live for their tom yum, spicy soup with lemongrass. It's awesome. Their dumplings are awesome, their bok choy is awesome, and the prices are good. I don't think i would go there for a nice quiet evening, so I won't. But the food gets 5 stars from me. No question.

AZ48cjL9H3V3rKtYI_23AQ.text: Me and my friends call this our last stop before leaving Vegas. The orange chicken and Mongolian beef are my absolute favorites. Best hangover food other than steak and eggs.

iv5CPY5-sFBk6lvaDCwtyA.text: This place is awesome!! The food is amazing and the wait was very short! I highly recommend the Combination Appetizer and the Egg Flower Soup:)

WNm6Hlj-DYBcD4L3b8eJRA.text: Omg!! Pad see ew with deep fried pork belly(moo grob)....a must order Not on the menu but ask for it 5 stars!! everything else is ok

QIWI4zTtFcyQtkFY8phvTg.text: We came here after the Thai restaurant we were planning to go to didn't open for a half hour beyond their published time.  That's what's so good about living in a city where there are hundreds of choices.  I ordered the Green curry with pork--spice level 7 out of 10--and my wife got the Garlic pepper chicken.  We have to remember to tell Asian and Mexican restaurants to leave off the cilantro.  She's one of those strange creatures who doesn't like cilantro.  Both dishes were very good and the spice level of 7 was great!  Perhaps I could have pushed it higher, but this had a good zing and only a few small tears showed themselves.  We ended the meal each having a scoop of ice cream.  I had the mango and Andrea had the coconut.  Mine was very creamy and tasty and hers was, too--I finished hers.  Win- win!  Service was just wonderful.  A couple of people took our order, delivered food, brought iced tea refills.  It was a team effort.  That earned them the 4th star.

2kodCvkUWNQPYFzORVaF7Q.text: I would rate this as a solid 3 1/2 Stars. The food is good, I just expected better (considering it is located in Chinatown). We ordered the barbecued pork as an appetizer, and shrimp with lobster sauce, General Tso's chicken, and Mongolian beef, as the entree's. Barbecued pork was tender and tasty. General Tso's chicken was cooked properly (crisp on the outside, tender on the inside), but tasted more like sweet and sour chicken (as it did not have the usually red hot peppers, so it was not spicy at all). The shrimp and lobster sauce was good, although the shrimp could have been a little larger and the removal of the tails would have been better. The Mongolian beef was also good, but many places in Vegas/Henderson make Mongolian beef as good (or better). I have eaten in some geat Chinese restaurants in New York, and China, so take that into consideration in reading my review (as my expectations are high). I think overall, most people will enjoy their meal at Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant.

c4qAfb7Z_e7xAU--AygZ3Q.text: Love Kung Fu!  Such good food. I've only ordered for delivery but this is my go to spot when I didn't get around to cooking dinner. Open late for delivery.  Also big portions and fast delivery. Yum!

B_MbBpccCahG0OhCVxvSfA.text: On 10/10/17 at about 7:30 p.m. me and my husband went to this restaurant and we've been there before because it's the only place in town I like their tomyum chicken soup and so we went that day and everything was fine but we found it odd that there were 3-4 servers attending us and when I paid I paid with my card and I always write a zero for the tip because I like to tip with cash and when the guy saw that I wrote 0 for the tip he told me I couldn't leave without leaving a tip and said I HAD to leave a tip and personally I thought that was very disrespectful and my husband bit his tongue because he didn't want to cause a scene and to top it off we didn't even get good service that day for us to leave a tip and I didn't even know who I was tipping  so I will never eat at this restaurant again ! I left them $1.50 in quarters which they didn't even deserve . Personally i work hard for my money and if I don't think you deserved at tip I don't have to give you one !! Very rude , disrespectful , and unprofessional

I had no idea if I was supposed to seat myself or wait to be seated b/c there's no signs and none of the staff  ever acknowledged my party and me. Not to mention, in my opinion, this place is over priced for what u get.   At least the Sake was good! Will not be returning.

Qc0cjTRip7k6rMr_cMGSQA.text: Ok so I went with a Thai girl and had no idea what I was eating. She was kind and ordered a creamy chicken soup that was excellent. A ground beef thing over rice that was spicy but really good, Also had something that looked like beef jerky that was soft in the middle and very good. A full Chinese menu is also offered,   Thai tea is recommended.

0BUqsGfPgUXt8fM_CQr5gw.text: Service was fast, prices reasonable, but the entrees in general weren't anything fabulous or worth coming back for.

4zOXwcPgbH0LhUKKTAMgQA.text: I was surprised to see all the negative reviews here! My husband and I dined here after we discovered Lotus of Siam was closed between 2:30 and 5:30pm. We ordered Crab Rangoon/Wontons, Mongolian Beef and Shrimp Pad Thai between the two of us. They also serve a small selection of alcoholic beverages.  Our food was amazing! And the service was fast. I did have to point out to our waiter which white wine I wanted on the menu so maybe communicating your food order over the phone could be tricky. But the fact that they offer online ordering should resolve this problem. AND, do you want authentic or not?! The hostess and our waiter were very pleasant and professional.   Lastly, we saved a lot of money getting off the strip. We will definitely return!

3bs5yS7O7262QcARGfGU8Q.text: This was my first time here, we went to china town to celebrate Chinese New Year.  I ordered the fried calamari which was lightly fried , was just perfect. My main course was chicken panang with white rice, the spice level 2, not too spicy. The papaya salad is my favourite dish , it was fresh and a must to compliment any dish. To complete I had the Thai ice tea. The portion size was enough for 2 people. The food overall was delicious but the waiters made us wait like 20 minutes for our bill.

88wpSz51TwNHNSeCFWL0SQ.text: We just arrived in Las Vegas and wanted to get some Asian food away from the a strip and found this place. We came in and waited to be seated per posted sign - it was not busy at all - maybe two or three other tables. No one was in the front..we waited...no one came out...we still waited...saw a waiter eating lunch. We waited some more...the waiter finished eating and went to the back let people in the back know we were waiting...but still no one came...we left. What kind of an establishment doesn't have a host in the front to seat their patrons????? Why did we wait so long?? Horrible....horrible...horrible service....!

j4KubBiARVe9yN4xMrw-Nw.text: Bad service ...I placed a order they gave it to a bigger party ....the manager said sorry ....I order once more from them so it happen again .....

YizMKNY-38W3geZhMp76eg.text: I am a fan of Pad Thai so every Thai restaurant that I go to, I get this. While I wasn't impressed with the tom yum soup, Kung Fu has a delicious Pad Thai that can beat Lotus of Siam's Pad Thai any day of the week. Get this item here if you love pad thai!!!

jjCJibJ0rFGCIrnF5xW9kA.text: The food here is excellent.  Both dine-in and delivery.  We always go with the Mongolian beef, cashew chicken, jumbo shrimp fried rice, and tom ka soup.  I've had a couple issues with online orders getting lost (so make sure to call and confirm after placing an online order).  The small Asian knick knacks in the interior of the restaurant could use a good dusting/cleaning.  Once you notice, it gets really distracting.

8mgLLxzSasKU8KAjASNyQQ.text: Food is inconsistent. Staff is rude on the phone. Food comes cold so we called to speak with the manager and the lady talks back to us. And we get put on hold for another 20 min. Then the manager actually asks if we want another one. Really?? Um, yes that would help. Then we wait another 30 min. Rediculous!!

5fPTI-ctgE__sR41AWhcxA.text: It took awhile for the server to show up. Ordered the tom yum jumbo shrimp soup which was not bad. The Mongolian beef was not that good. It lacked flavor and just simply wasn't tasty. The orange chicken was fairly decent. Will likely not return to this place, given the dozens of better options around town for this type of food.

KjNB7hokcRkGqk9W_CcsFA.text: Came here for lunch because of all the great reviews.... Had the lunch special sweet and sour chicken.  This is something that's pretty easy and I figured it would be a safe bet my first time here. The sweet and sour sauce is orange not pink or red and tasted terrible. It was like honey. The breading on the chicken was super thick and hard crunchy.  The only thing that was good was the spring roll but even then it was mired by the gross sauce... So was ok no  veggies at all in it but it was OK.  I wanted to ask them to bring something else but had a feeling it would have been like pulling teeth so i sucked it up and worked on my plate as i was really hungry... Not a great first experience.

cBmIfqa_QoUcOMcU0iAwhQ.text: The best Thai and Chinese food in las vegas. I recommend to all ages and good pricing.

vNIC0GF6RpPxeQ3l7ruK0Q.text: I have been here a few times with my family and love their food! The cashew chicken and Mongolian beef are a must try.

NhsQ9r2_FF53F-xlBw34MA.text: Huge menu selection of Thai and Chinese food. This place was busy for 9p and continued to be busy until we left around 10:15p. The staff was extremely friendly and polite! I had their Chicken Satay. This was very filling and came with a small cucumber  salad. They had vegetation options for my friends. These dishes were excellent! I wanted dessert but it was getting late for the kids in our party! This place is super easy to find: on the corner of Spring Mountain and Valley View!

QqwR2G8dTS59qAhn6HpxNw.text: don't go here, go to Pin Kow.   parking is terrible.  service is even worse. the guy who seated us, also took our order and cleared the table. they are understaffed and very un-accommodating. (no, you can't substitute shrimp for chicken) it took us forever to get our food, and even longer to get the check. not to mention the food came out staggered, my husband got his entree, then they brought out the appetizers, then another entree... food quality was not good; very bland and not fresh. no condiments on the table, and not even enough for each table. they also didn't have enough menus for everybody.  over all appearance and quality of the restaurant was poor.

PoOv86ss4P5r1U2m8oGrcQ.text: Met a co-worker here for dinner one night to grab some grub. My first time coming here to this place even though its been here for years (20+?). I don't know why they have like over 500+ items on the menu but if it works for them. We stuck with some basic Thai items and avoided the Chinese side of the menu. For starters we got a chicken larrb salad, then Beef pad sieew (Beef Chow Fun) and chili mint beef. Everything was very flavorful and delicious. I also happen to see a guy I went to high school with who is now a drummer in a famous band, but that's another story. Another tasty place for Thai food.

m8EM1nq6kogDj_LFPLcmHQ.text: The service was incredibly slow. 3 tables around us had to ask for someone to take their order. The soup was lukewarm and not much in it the food was tasteless. Had to repeatedly ask for things to be brought to our table not worth the money we will never go there again

TAwb6XwdmZA8SdPsleUatg.text: Ordered take out/delivery to our accounting office -- ordered 5 lunch specials @ $6.25 each.  Although cheap we were all disappointed with flavor and portion serving.  Most on plate was rice...3 of 5 plates were pad Thai and the serving was so small and not much of flavor.  Came with a small egg roll and chicken wing.  Deliv charge was $3...def not worth it and we won't be ordering anytime soon...very disappointed.

Might I add we had about 10 ppls at our table & they kept giving us ONLY a few napkins at a time knowing we have a lot of people's at our table including Childrens  Never again !

FUil69GF9RkFokVvMwawGQ.text: BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE......Ok so this place is my favorite place to go for good Chinese food fix. vCInqcVhSnikNRuuzkZ56g.text: We love Thai Food and are just in town from Phoenix for a few days and decided to stop in China Town. The food was great and the service was happy. My companions meals came out way after mine but they apologized and made amends . Definitely excellent Curry dishes and my Laad Na was great. We  have found our place to eat in Vegas.

YVqbo34M5dMaE7g06hyUjQ.text: I'm accustomed and miss my N.Y. Chinese food. Please don't suggest PF Chang's, that's a glorified chili's for a Chinese food.  A friend dines here and suggested we go before heading to Golden Tiki.  Perfecto! Same shopping center, plus for that! They don't use MSG, huge plus for that.  Always a warm greeting when entering and seated immediately. They do have a bar area with seating, however the tables are flushed against the seats- don't expect to sit at the bar anytime soon.  Portions are to be shared, or not if one is hungry and then you can surely have it all for yourself.  I have!  The three times I've been here the food comes out quickly after ordering and steaming hot!  They are also very accommodating when switching something for your tastebuds. Three stars, since it's not my 'N.Y. Chinese' food.   That being said, I've more than likely made an attempt at most of the Chinese places in town.  This is the only one I enjoy.

tTM153Eplw-NxU9oEZ-65g.text: One of the best Thai restaurants in the valley. The pad Thai is amazing! The Tom yum seafood soup is delicious! The staff are super friendly. The prices are great! I highly recommend!

2mQXpD7_fgUJe3m3ehzLDQ.text: If I could give a zero I would. Our family has been coming here for the last 12 years for the quality food. This time service was terrible, the woman who waited on us decided she was going to change the spice level on an entry to no spice at all because she felt he couldn't handle it (we were well aware of the spice levels since we've been coming so long). She just kept saying it was too spicy for him and didn't offer to get him a new one or anything. She kept arguing it. On top of that, our dishes weren't any good either. Very disappointing in how much the food quality has dropped since the last time we came and we don't anticipate ever coming back again.

PvCD0mtQPTmPhaTpUPrcPQ.text: The thai iced coffee, green curry and chicken fried rice were all delicious and the curry came with a cup of white rice. The tom kha soup was also relatively good, and the service was excellent. Everyone was very nice and helpful.

AxdMBtmBQrRperXxVIz94g.text: By FAR my favorite Thai restaurant.  If you love beef, I suggest ordering and trying out the Mongolian Beef.

A0uR2tu4__MMZg1d7rROxA.text: Before I talk bad I'll tell the good stuff. I'm from Denver and my wife is from Vegas and she has been bragging about their glass noodle salad (not on menu) for three years. We finally went there and she said it was as good as she remembered. Spice level 7. Too hot for me. The food was actually pretty good... now for the bad. HORRIBLE service. How does a Chinese restuarant run out of egg rolls before lunch. I ordered a seafood noodle bowl and they forgot the shrimp. And last but not least, the waiter instead of walking around the table to serve a plate to someone seated across from him he leaned over someone else's plate.  She told the waiter three times to walk around but he ignored her. I also believed his shirt fell into her food. This plus super slow service, I'm NOT going back. I left the server a nickel tip just to make my point.

h35xOnWcxUwhfmB9PSRm9A.text: Very nice waitress. Very nice atmosphere. Tasty flavors. Good portion size. Many entree options. A few dollars per entree more than their competition. I will come back .....this will be in my top 4 Thai restaurants on the westside of las Vegas.

vI7nAB9xyB5vZMGhiIWkOg.text: Came here with four people initially, and that number rotated from 5-6 people at a time. Honestly have never been served so quickly and efficiently especially for a large party. Our group was expecting the portions to be divided into really small bits but actually the food here is quite amazing and the staff is really quick without making anyone feel like they were being rushed at all. Friendly staff that even if they aren't able to greet you directly at the door, even when occupied they'll still greet you and be super attentive. I loved the Vegetable Pad Thai here but the real hero of the night was the egg drop soup as I've been feeling under the weather.

6CssZPZn27X5MxYKibbc8Q.text: Great food, fast delivery, good prices, even with the delivery fee.  And since I don't have to drive in Vegas, I'm all for that!  Ordered the mixed fried rice - and I have NEVER seen so many shrimp in fried rice!  Hubby feeds them to me - I think I got full on just the shrimp.  Orange chicken has a great flavour.  Ginger chicken is my new favourite - it was so good.  Egg rolls and crab wontons were hot and tasted great, too.  I don't suppose I can afford a delivery fee to Northern California, huh?  (PS - Circus Circus, your food sucks, and is over priced.  You need to re-think prices and preparation...)

HuTrTGfS-YDWJNqefBn9wA.text: Have always enjoyed the takeout here and finally decided to visit with the fam.  Very pleasant visit with good service and great food.  BBQ pork fried rice was amazing might be in my top 3 of all time. Older location that shows some age but overall a great option for Thai or Chinese!

hvCNTUKl384SMK5aQDDB9g.text: I don't live in proximity to Kung Fu but I had an appointment in the area and it was recommended to me. I was told I have to try the duck. Since I'm always game to try things that people seem to be so passionate about, I thought why not?  First I will say that the parking was a bit confusing. Kung Fu is located in a strip mall on Spring Mountain but the actual restaurant faces Valley View. You can't actually see it from the parking so you really have to know that it's there or you would totally miss it.  After looking through the pretty extensive menu we decided on the Crab Rangoon for an appetizer, the half duck and the chicken Pad Thai. Well one of my pet peeves is when the appetizer arrives the same time as the entree which is what happened here. I still can't figure out why anyone would rave about the duck. It was super rubbery and none of the fat was rendered. The Pad Thai was solid however but not enough of a reason to come back. And lastly, the service was not very attentive. We even had to wave someone down to get our check.  China Town has so many great restaurants in the area but this one is not going to be on my radar in the future unfortunately.

gaZwImLJg0OQZu2Cgugykg.text: Best Chinese food I've had in vegas ! The sweet and sour chicken is good quality chicken, best I've ever had!

8dDJAQ-DlYSRgjTiX9MskQ.text: Great food, good size helping, great service and it arrives quickly even with a full restaurant . My wife and I came around 6pm on a Sunday. Place was full of people but food came fast. They walk by and check to make sure you are good . Also the prices aren't that bad. If you have a date a cool $50-$60 would handle both your meals plus tip. There is also an ice cream shop in the same plaza so you can walk 20 feet and get dessert.

8-wM-6zO5eZKJzTq_TvEVg.text: Kung Fu Thai & Chinese is a Thai and Chinese restaurant located on Spring Mountain Rd. I went with my party of four to this restaurant on Sunday, January 3 around 11am. The style of service here is family style, but there are entrees for one serving available as well.  Atmosphere: Vibrant, Organized The decor of the restaurant seems to be based around Thai decor. Upon entering the restaurant, the decor is vermillion-colored. Nothing too flashy, but there are pictures and statues that seem to be Thai-themed. Nothing too obnoxious or flashy, but there is just enough decor around the restaurant to catch your eye.  Service: Good!  Upon entering the restaurant, we were seated immediately at a booth. When were seated, however, instead of the waiter asking us for what we wanted to drink, he just gave us all ice water. We were able to ask for hot tea (which one of us wanted) later upon request. The table where we were seated had plenty of space for us to sit. We took our time finishing our dishes, and when they needed to be cleared, they were cleared with efficiency. The only thing I did not enjoy would be the busser stacking dishes at the table. He should have brought a cart or a tray in case something might have splashed on us.  Food: Well prepared, delicious, and memorable We ordered the crab ragoons as our only appetizer. They were crispy on the outside with a creamy filling. Six were served to us on a bed of shredded cabbage with a side of horseradish sauce and sweet and sour sauce, both of which complimented the ragoons very well. What I liked about the service when we ordered the ragoons would be when the waiter told us that if we order wontons they would be plain and if we order the ragoons they would have filling. This was very considerate of him.  The two soups we order were the wonton soup and the tom yom with "big" rice noodles. The wonton soup came with shrimp, pork, carrots, baby bok choy, scallions, and pork wontons. The wonton soup was decent, but needed some salt and pepper. The tom yum we order was medium spiciness and came with fish balls, imitation crab, some ground pork, bean sprouts, scallions, and a fried wonton on top for garnish. The tom yum was incredible: full of flavor, a little savory with a complimentary kick of spiciness.  The dishes that we order were the chicken pad thai, Hon Sui Tofu, and beef and broccoli in oyster sauce. Chicken pad thai came with purple cabbage and parsley on the side. The pad thai had a good amount of chicken and seasoning. The Hon Sui had great juiciness in the tofu and great flavor in the meat: totally delicious and savory. The Beef and Broccoli was probably my favorite dish; the beef's smokiness and seasoning was absoutely amazing. The Beef and Broccoli in oyster sauce is a must try!  Overall: Good experience, would go again! Although the service was not great, the food we were served was some great Asian cuisine. The food was probably some of the best I've had in a while. Visit this place for some great Thai and Chinese food!

Took the rest home to my boyfriend. He ate it. Long story short all 3 of us are sick today. If you wanna avoid a sour stomach avoid this place.

moG6YP3kTaWD9Mujeo3nXg.text: I enjoyed the presentation of the soup and the dishes were well portioned. The aesthetic is really authentic and the servers are attentive. I think i have a new favorite Thai place in town.

d2hvs4dWga1r6v50H9Jptw.text: Food is great but VERY POOR customer services. [smh] Unfortunately I won't be coming here again.

TPVz4g0HZbe8tbcBz9abLA.text: Love all the different spots in China Town!  Cesar Q and I have been craving some authentic Thai food and decided to stop by.  First off they have an awesome lunch menu with multiple options for under $7 and it includes soup of the day and some killer little appetizers.    Of course we can't be as simple as their lunch menu we opt for the bigger is better option and order directly off the menu.  I ordered the chicken pad Thai and my man had the combination pad Thai.  We split a bbq pork fried rice.  Needless to say we had a ton of left overs as we could have split one meal and been full.  Everything we ordered was great!  Loved the delicate sauce on the pad Thai.    Can't beat the location as it's just off spring mountain and valley view.  Just west of I-15 on the Spring Mountain exit.  The service was great.  The guys who assisted us were happy and friendly.  Great Thai find in Vegas!

I've never dined in, but each time that I've ordered takeout it's been nothing less than outstanding  enjoy!

After waiting for a human being to acknowledge us, We were then seated at a filthy table.  The top was sticky, and there was food all over the seat cushions...  We flagged someone down, and they wiped it down.... Half @$$ed, that is.  I say this because half of the booth still had food on it, I love my husband, but we were sitting uncomfortably close to avoid sitting in someone else's dinner. The staff used to be better but still decent customer service(when it's not super busy, otherwise it's not great) The orange chicken is the best around. Prices are decent for the portion sizes. z_xSHcuRXotrJrnXgW2kXg.text: Never got the food.   Ordered it, waited, and then got a phone call, the driver went to Westin and not the Westgate hotel.  According to the driver,  Westgate doesn't allow deliveries.  I explained I was in for the night and did not want to go down to lobby. 10 minutes later an Asian woman called upset an accused me of saying goes Westin and I needed to go downstairs and get my food.  I repeated my explanation...I'm in for the night.  She hung up on me.  This hotel is open, no one checking for a room key like at the Venetian.   I think they just did not want to deliver up to the room...

7GGXa2biCozCv6815aLraw.text: A great treat to find such fantastic Chinese AND Thai cuisine in Las Vegas. We stayed at The Hard Rock and they have Chinese food there but its expensive and nowhere as good as Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant !! We had both Thai and Chinese. The fried rice was light and not heavy with oils as many seem to make.It was so flavorful. When we first walked in the smells wafted in the air and we knew right away that we found the best! Worth the drive from the overpriced strip and an Uber ride is cheap and with the money you save by not paying over inflated LV strip prices the Uber ride ends up almost free. We will always stop here each trip we make. This was our Thanksgiving mealand one I will always remember. Thank you to the cooks and all the nice people we met there!!

hJhdqQqcf5s6JYRLL1VdNQ.text: First time eating here and will definitely order again. Fast delivery and the sweet and sour jumbo shrimp was very delicious! 5 stars!

ceRdc38bBfPfQroeNT8OVA.text: I would love to give 5 stars, and if it was based off strictly food and price it would be. Very affordable and very good food. Some of my favorite fried rice in Vegas and hard to put down once you start eating. I haven't sat down to eat here yet but ordered take out a few times.  If they are not busy, take out is fairly easy as someone usually sees you walk in and comes to help you. However on busy nights such as this past Monday, I went in to pick up my food and waited about 10 minutes before someone acknowledged me being there. I then waited close to 10 minutes for them to ring me up in the back along with another guy who was there before me while our food sat there bagged up on the table. Food was still very hot when i got home so no issues there, just think they should have a dedicated "host/ess" when you walk in. If you walk in now, it's like whoever is available will come over and seat you or take your order.  Seemed like many of the people sitting at the restaurant were frustrated with wait times for food or service as well. Saw one guy get up and go grab the water jug from the server stand since nobody was coming to his table to refill and one table had to grab a server so that they would take the order for the table.  Minus the obvious service issues on busy nights, I highly recommend this place for the food! We have enjoyed all dishes we have had and I absolutely love the fried rice.

tW55uCrbvJMN61tZgUJ0Pw.text: Service was horrible. No one took our drink orders, the waitress took our food order, but didn't ask about drinks until we had to ask someone about it.   5 people at our table and they brought out each dish one at a time with several minutes in between. Who does that?   Waitress disappeared when it was time for the check, the manager finally brought it over and finished for her. While we were eating we saw another party waiting at the door for their check.   Food was great if you don't mind bad service.

G8n9E4mrT4NgffkZ5hDzNQ.text: Kung Fu on Spring Mountain China Town Vegas has consistently offered excellent Thai and Chinese food ... Fresh and savory and served with courtesy and professionalism each and every time. Thumbs way up!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I have always liked this restaurant. The food (Thai and Chinese) is always solid and the service is always excellent!

LH7k-ECJMrgCz-owFak2lg.text: Finding parking is a freaken pain in the ass in this plaza, but its worth it cause the food here is great! Kung fu has been around in vegas for decades and decades LITERALLY. The service here is great, they alwayse take the time to see if your enjoying your food and filling your glass of water without being ask. The seating is actually pretty quick depending on the time of the day you show up.        We alwayse order yum moo yang( grill pork sald) it is sooooo delicious :) a good blend of sweet and heat. There soy sauce duck is also yummy, especially over hot steamy rice. Every thing that we order here has been delicious so far the only downside I have is parking but what do you expect its CHINATOWN haha.

0zgGBEajo7thYSDgqQr76Q.text: I call myself an expert in Thai food.  I grew up with rice and fish sauce.  This place is authentic.  We come here for lunch quick dish, not entree style.  Pad See Ewe was good, Rad na was the delicious.    The decor is a bit outdated.  The restaurant is a clutter of tables.  Half of the restaurant is dark and dingy.    Aside from lack pleasant ambience, the food is great.

fEcY9MpRZreCW0wFHq6ljw.text: After the high  reviews, we decided to eat at this restaurant. We were seated pretty quickly and the atmosphere seemed nice, which led us up to high expectations. After waiting for ten minutes to get our drink order taken, we were greeted by the rudest server ever. He kept getting our order wrong and had to repeat several times. Two of our plates  came out in a timely fashion, but we waited for all plates to come out so we could all eat together. Not an unreasonable request. 30 minutes of waiting for the rest of our order and our waiter hadnt even come to check on us. There had been 3 parties seated and served in the time that we were waiting. After 45 minutes of waiting for the other 4 plates, we asked the  waiter if we could just pay for our drinks because we weren't  going to pay for food we hadnt receieved. Somehow they magically had two more of our plates ready as we were standing up to walk out.  The waiter first tried to ignore our request, then hid in the kitchen. We were very calm in out request and just kept getting blown off. A lady came out of the kitchen and shook her hand at us as to dismiss us. Thats when our waiter came out with our checks for our drinks.   We paid for our drinks and left.   As you can imagine, we wont be returning. What a disappointment!

gDx7-PyKdeC3toScbof3nA.text: Authentic Thai food. Delicious and great customer service. The place is large but get very crowded during normal lunch and dinner hour. Prepare to wait for a table but it's worth the wait.

bijBAsxe-iX_4Q1u9kEaYw.text: Hungry, fresh from the pool party, CRAAAAAVING?..It time for some Kung Fuuuuuuuuuuu Thai baby!  The Tom Yum soup...Yes indeed, its the bomb! The Beef soup is...Yes, thats the bomb too...Hold on...The Pad Thai...THE BOMB!  The food is awesome at this place. That's hard to find around this area.

gQau35o0gOyI6xWV09FAcw.text: After being dissatisfied with buffet asia we decided to finally try this place, best decision ! Very clean and attentive and also very quick. The food was amazing definitely going back !

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea food chow mein , calimari, shrimp chow mein and steamed rice ! Amazing

oey3K33WzRv8CjwQlOgAGg.text: I ordered a meal to be delivered at 7:00pm. At 8:00 I called to check on the status of my meal. They said a driver was heading out with it. At 9:00 I called to check on the status of my meal, they said a driver was out with it. At 9:45 I called to check on the status of my meal, they said a driver was out with my food.   On pressing them, they asked the driver (Who was actually at the restaurant), and then insisted several times I had signed for the food. When I sternly pressed that I had not received the meal, they had put the driver on the phone. The driver immediately described the wrong house and gave me my neighbors' address (The store owner had the right address, which was not my neighbor.)  The driver then suggested, an hour after he had delivered it, that I should go to my neighbor's house and ask for my food.      After having ordered here for at least five years, I would have at least hoped for a discount or a free appetizer. They charged me full price for the meal and offered to remake it and redeliver.  I think most people would have declined the charge outright.    I hope they manage to sort out their drivers. Almost four hours for a meal is insane. Furthermore, they did not deliver the correct drink. Whatever they brought was orange and sincerely undrinkable, at least to me.  The food itself is excellent, Garlic Pepper Beef is an absolute favorite of mine and the Crab Rangoon is delicious.

-urELSNenHS0ixajEher3A.text: If I could give them -10 stars I would. We arrived at 2:35pm order from the happy hour(it's until 3pm) menu on 2:40, at 3:05 the server came back says that he can't serve lunch spacial anymore-AFTER 30 min that we are waiting!!!!!!thats their new trick!  So we order from the regular menu,the food came dry and I found 2 hairs in my Mongolian beef+it was so chewy like a rubber. I used to come here a lot and that was my first time after 9 months. This place change and become with tricky services,low quality of food and not clean at all.  Better for the health dep to test this place soon as they can!!

Cr8p6HU8--Cyo345akdZ1w.text: Saayywhaaa???!!!  I have been in Vegas all my life and am so MAD I didn't discover this one sooner.  GREAT food GREAT service.

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Panang and Spring Rolls. Chicken something.

XhiKR9j9VyNb88mRBhjhTw.text: I love this place. You know why? The BEST service and the most friendly and attentive staff- period.  Genuine, kind individuals working here and I adore them all. Food always comes out quick, so you're never waiting a year for your food to come and never will you have an empty glass. Just doesn't happen here.  I will admit that I generically order the same 4 things (with other new dishes) every time I come to Kung Fu:  1. Mongolian Beef - NOTHING...and I mean NOTHING- tops their MB. 2. Tom Yum Soup with Tofu - I cry because San Francisco doesn't know how to make it like Vegas does. I have tried numerous Thai restaurants in SF and gave up because they all use some kind of tomato tasting broth that totally turns my taste buds off. It was heartbreaking when I moved away from LV. Kung Fu knows exactly how to make my spicy and sour broth!! (Try Komals if you want the very best Tom Yum in LV) 3. Orange Chicken - Very strong flavored orange glaze over crispy chicken. YUM!!! 4. Thai Vegetable Fried Rice with egg - love it!  While visually its not the greatest looking restaurant, don't mind that because what's looks got to do with it?!?  Service always weighs heavily on my mind when forming opinions about restaurants, business etc. that I go to, and I can't emphasize enough that the staff here just gets is right- 100% of the time...for me anyways, but maybe the just like me ;)

l0pJJMmxpRLhXC54YkoqoQ.text: This place was packed on a Monday night.  Service was mediocre.  They didn't come and check on us very often.  My sprite (which I got with a Yelp check in) was pure carbonation and with very little to no "sprite" syrup.  You can order most items with our without "spicy"  Chicken Wings:  Very good crispy but tender.  The sweet chili sauce had no heat to it but it was delightful.  Pad Sew Ew:  Pretty solid as far as this traditional Thai dish goes.  Nice flavor, not too much overpowering sauce.  Shrimp Salad:  Refreshing and light.  Shrimp with a light sauce on a bed of lettuce.  The salad was crisp and the shrimp were cooked well.  Shrimp Fried Rice:  Really no flavor at all.  I give them item a 1 star at best.  I've had fried rice at a lot of Thai restaurants and this dish had no flavor whatsoever.  Chicken with Basil:  A little greasy but very flavorful.  The basil flavor really pops out.  Just sop up some of the grease with your steam rice to balance it out.

yi4sjP21aJ6qzgOenun4Eg.text: A TERRIBLE SERVICE from a woman server named , Jen today @ this restaurant. Thanks to her cuz will never come back no more to spend my money in this rude server Thai restaurant.I spent too much money and the lady is so rude. She's not supposedly in this kind of business cuz all she got is her mad face all the time.  We're not spending money juz to be treated bad. I hope the management can do something  about this it's ruining the image of this good restaurant

Dvd8_e-MIMYgnw59AMQi_w.text: I have been here 2x in the last year. When I come to Vegas, I ALWAYS need to eat noodle soup a few times. You will find me in China town once a day during my visits. MY favorite is the beef ball noodle soup. I got this both times visiting here, and i'm always shocked to see the tiny bowl of soup that comes out. This little bowl is nothing like what you see in the Bay area in California. But for Las Vegas, I suppose this will do.  The first time I was still hungry when we left, but this time, We all ordered the crab papaya salad as well. With this and my noodle soup, I left happy and content. The soup was a little on the sweet side which I am not accustomed to or favor.  I ordered my soup without bean sprouts, and it came with bean sprouts , I also asked for extra cilantro and they didn't give me any..  If you are not sure what you are craving.. you will definitely get lost in this menu. This thing is like 10 pages long, ranging from Thai curries, to soups to Chinese fried rices and more dishes!  Come prepared with an idea of what you want..  I'll probably try some more Thai places in the area next time I'm in town before coming back.

Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya salad with crab

wG2zFgDrsLtww_T6o_XYvA.text: The food was bland it has no taste.  At least it was hot. The place was very clean. The waiters took the order and then delivered it to the table. Then never saw them again. Had to flag down another waiter to get the check.  I do not think I'll go back there. Better Chinese restaurants in Henderson or even Panda express has better flavor.

NM3-ZIWmcouZ0mSWJ4tMow.text: Unmistakably Kung Fu Thai is a hidden gem amidst the easily overpriced Asian cuisine in Las Vegas. Step one to finding delicious and affordable food in Vegas is to get off the strip. So, that's what my family and I did by coming to this restaurant, located in Vegas' "chinatown" or along Spring Mountain Road.   Come here a little before the usual dinner rush on weekends about 6 o clock to avoid waiting. Right after we arrived, multiple parties came and had to wait for a table because the whole place filled up so quickly.   You must try the garlic beef, pad thai, and papaya salad. Each dish was executed well and the food was brought out fairly quickly.   My family ordered 5 dishes for 5 of us and there was still some left over. The total came out to be under $60 which is really not bad at all.   This place is now on my list for some good Thai home cooking if I'm ever sick of the buffets and sky high prices on the strip.   P.S. Check in for a free drink, +$1 if the drink is Thai iced tea!

FnZwZ1ODmDdUhQia9fXlMw.text: Food is yummy. Coconut soup is my go to. Great portions. Decent prices. I LOVE their Thai tea. Cool place to eat with friends or a date :)

m6ZNZlR4rC1aMPyy21wW_A.text: I'm visiting Vegas for a convention. Unfortunately, my hotel is off the strip and with 104 degree temperatures the last thing I wanted to do was go back out in the heat for food. Did an Internet search for places that deliver. A million pizza joints, but I wanted something different. Came across some good reviews for Kung Fu so I placed an online order.  About two minutes after the order was placed, a gentleman called from Kung Fu to verify some of the things on my order. Whhaaaaat? A restaurant that doesn't just guess but actually follows up with the customer? Amazing! He told me the food would be delivered in an hour but it was more like 30-45 minutes.  And it was sooooo good. I was craving egg drop soup and theirs didn't disappoint. I had also ordered the chicken with chili and mint over rice and received a HUGE portion for the price. Got a large drink too. Cost for everything plus delivery and tip was only about $22, making it more than worth it. Not to mention the awesomeness of having it delivered to my hotel.  Definitely will be keeping this one on my list for future trips to the area. It's easy to understand why they've been open so long!

QemHqPQlcDX2Kpu2D3cqMA.text: Food looks nothing like the pictures online. My zucchini was watery, and the breading was terrible. I asked for marinara with it. I didn't get that. The general tso chicken is not saucy and tastes like plain chicken. Again, these two dishes look absolutely nothing like the website photos. See my photos for comparison. The white rice and lo mien were good. Delivery was on time. Overall, I didn't get my marinara sauce, extra soy, or extra duck sauce that I asked for. The duck sauce is very very sweet and dark in color. I wouldn't order again.

jsucON3sEjIwVhA29sNm3A.text: This place was highly recommended and I was super excited to try it ! When I got there friendly greeting by the host but than when it came to the server; he got to our table gave us waters and didn't even ask if we wanted anything else to drink but automatically asked if we were ready to order our food . Excuse me first thank you for the water but shouldn't you ask if I want something else and than out of that time getting our drinks give us time to look at the menu. Than when we actually placed our order I understand that there specialty is tom yum soup so I understand they have a big batch ready to go; what i had ordered was tom yum, Mongolian beef and shrimp fried rice . So I understood the soup was coming out ahead of the rest but 20 mins ahead come one I didn't order much and I don't only want soup . Thru out those 20 mins of just having soup he did not once come once to ask if we were ok or if needed anything else and I observed around there was a big party 8-12 people who look to be enjoying there food and I seen when they brought there feast in and so I was ready for mine . Than when I finally became annoyed of just having soup 20 mins I finally decided to cancel the rest of my order. Than when the server asked why I stated that I didn't just want soup than he tried and justify by saying the soup always comes first which I told him yes the soup maybe ready before because you have a big batch but it's common curtesy you bring all food together just like they brought the huge party the soup with the rest of there food . My mom wasn't a big fan of the soup so when I said " ok wait for the rest of the food" and 20 mins passed and I was eating the soup by myself believe that ; that was not the lunch I wanted to have with my mom on our day off . Point being soup was a 2 1/2 out of 5 . & I will not be coming again and will not recommend.

xylKaqN8Cf7QAW5uN_Bz8w.text: This place was recommended to me by a great friend. I am not one to choose Asian food for a meal.  I've tried different Chinese & Thai food restaurants, but I leave un satisfied and not very impressed!  Kung Ku has yet to disappointment me! The food is very flavorful and I have yet to not like something I've ordered.    The food is served family style and the prices are reasonable!  You won't find yourself waiting long either because the food comes out fast!    If you're in the area, give it try!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Thai food feast

SRxHkHsFqXmlZH0YiFqlZg.text: Ive gone here multiple times on Vegas and it hits the spot every time! I went a few weeks ago though and found the waitress a leetle on the rude side, but everything else was fine.  This place has a large menu and has thai dishes, but also some chinese ones as well! I guess that makes sense since the place is called kung fu? Lol.  Ive tried multiple items and liked everything. I am boring and almost always get a pad thai though. Found the noodles to be a little sog this last visit, but flavor was good.

Yu6lQmCKNuohwC7hHu-bgA.text: Best Tai food in vegas. A little pricey but we'll worth it! Excellent selection of food and beverages. Staff is professional and friendly. Atmosphere is clean and appropriately decorated.

BcZYSU90y-Ogc7Bc5R6SBQ.text: Very good menu selection with many many items that will please anyone's appetite. I always get the Thai tea and it's not too much tea and not too much cream so it's perfect. The egg foo young is great with lots of toppings and the Tom yum shrimp soup is flavorful and filled with a good amount of shrimp. Definitely visiting again. Docked one star because when they're busy service is slow.

4oel7g9rUx-ySkJnbbJgAQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  Been coming here for more than 15 years.  Love the duck noodles!! Best long island ice tea in Vegas!

x4ZY6_9s63fC0m8LNzFmbg.text: Easy to find and clean. It's prob 5 min off the Strip. I ordered Chicken Satay and Pad See Ew which is a staple. It wasn't very busy when I arrived but by time I left had a line. Definitely a place I would visit again. I gave them 4 Chicken Satays...

CS6vn8e3HBzQ5wOkb9jgpA.text: Omg...Thai being one of my utmost FAVE cuisines, I talked myself into letting my travel friends pick this place.  I knew what the outcome was going to be when I looked up the Yelp reviews for them. I wasn't going to have a great lunch is what I predicted.  Our Lunch Order as follows: 01.  Tom Yum Soup w/ Soup - 2 Stars - Probably the worst Tom Yum soup I've ever had. Watery in taste and only had mushrooms. I think we ordered the Shrimp one but do you see any floating or drowned shrimps. Neither did we. No heat, no flavor, the flattest soup ever  02.  Water Spinach - 2.5 Stars - One of my FAVE Asian Veggies if not my FAVE Thai veggie dish. It was limp and watery. No flavor that seemed to come to our taste but just bland. It tasted like steamed Water Spinach.   03.  Pad See Ew (Beef) - 3 Stars - Probably the best dish of our lunch. At least it tasted more like what Pad See Ew should taste like but theirs was more on the sweet side.  04.  Beef Salad - 2 Stars - CHEWY Beef and not even spicy. It kinda like a non-Thai dish to me. Just horrible in taste. We didn't finish it.  05. Chicken Basil - 3 Stars - 2nd best of our meal. It was really sweet and not spicy as most Chicken Basil is. The hint of Basil wasn't enough to give it a fragrant smell. Was hoping this dish was better than the rest.   06.  Sweet & Sour Chicken - 2 Stars - This took 30 minutes to come out and when it finally did, it was such a disappointment. SOGGY, SWEET, and STICKY. 3 "S" is not ever good. The kids didn't even like it. Another one we tossed away.  07.  Some SWEET Fish they recommended - 1 Star - Couldn't even tell it was fish, it had some weird sweet sticky sauce that was just too hard to eat through. The fish had a lot of bones. This was the 2nd WORST dish of our lunch.   08.  Thai Ice Tea - 3 Stars - The only thing that tasted authentic today.   CUSTOMER SERVICE - HORRIBLE and they were so slow.  FOOD - Nothing there was authentic. I get it, it's a touristy area and loads of buses come through here. Anywhere that is a combo of 2 countries, usually isn't good. In this case, it was absolutely True...NOT GOOD.  VERDICT - Never coming back and Never listening to my friends that recommended this place to us. I cut them some slack, they are not Yelpers so failures like this could happen. Won't happen again, though. Thanks but NO thanks!

Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad See Ew
Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Yum Soup

M7pby7PNzLxPRa4YoVzjVQ.text: This review is based mostly on the online ordering. Until they fix it, the review will stay. I've ordered almost $1000 worth of food from this company and now the website is either glitched or forced to add a 15% gratuity to all online orders when you are supposed to be able to select the option. I like to tip drivers but not 15% on top of the $5 fee.

h8QH9WIaqleaE1mvR2G9fw.text: After trying a couple of disappointing Chinese delivery options I stumbled upon Kung Fu Thai and Chinese restaurant. I saw a menu laying around and decided to check it out. After see6that they had fried calamari, I knew I wanted to try them out. But it wasn't only the calamari that caut my interest. They had an assortment of really delicious looking dishes and a wide variety of seemingly authentic Thai dishes. For my first order though I decided to stick with two things I was familiar with: almond chicken, and of course the fried calamari that piqued my interest in the first place. They delivered the order in a timely manner. I was going to order a soda with my food, but the nice lady who took my order over the phone suggested Thai tea. So I went with that instead. Well, finally I got a meal worth my money. When the delivery guy came with my food, I asked him if the iced tea was good. He laughed and answered "yeah" as if it was the most ridiculous question anyone has ever asked him. The iced tea was four dollars and change and didn't disappoint. It was sooo good That I drank it down before I thought to take a picture of it. It was a two-toned color. I think it was mixed with milk. So creamy and delicious. I should have got the jumbo sized one instead of the large.  Worth every penny. The fried calamari was fried to a golden brown, succulent, and came with a sweet chili dipping sauce, as well as a great hot mustard sauce and a couple of other sauces. The almond chicken was great with plenty of vegetabluit next time. I fully enjoyed this meal and can't wait to try some of their more authentic Thai dishes in the future. Your Kung Fu is very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You kung fun is very good...

gTMHMBFpjRwnClGTKGvsVg.text: One of the best Thai and Chinese restaurants in Las Vegas. The staff is amazing and we have been regulars for awhile now. Sonny, our usual waiter, always guarantees us  amazing and fast service. Food usually arrives about 8-10 minutes after an order is placed and they are constantly refilling drinks and making sure that the customers are satisfied and There has never been an issue with our order. Kitsna is also an awesome server here. Prices are reasonable for the quality they provide although a bit pricey. 10/10. Would definitely recommend.

tc4fT55ds2D4dpa96tKXhg.text: 3 and a 1/2 stars for this place? This place deserves a -5 .  They took forever literally forever to serve us. Literally took an hour almost to even get an order.  They were not even that busy they were just being fucken lazy.   They gave us the wrong order and still charged us $40. We were waiting for the pork belly and mango dessert,  but said it would take another 29 mins!? Only thing we got was plain sticky rice and salad. Took another 20 mins for them to give us our change too.  Seriously I never seen so many lazy ass people in a restaurant before in my life until I came here, I would never come back obviously. They were rude and the food taste like horseshit. I was in a big hurry otherwise I would of fought my case.

yuM4Enzmc34P8_h1RuJhCw.text: Poor customer service. My boyfriend and I came to this restaurant on a Thursday night, they weren't to busy. We walk in and no one greets "Hello" or "Hi" we're standing there for at least 5 mins, a server walks by without even acknowledging us. So we had to actually end up getting her attention. She doesn't apologize....Then when we are finally seated, we sat for 10-15 mins NO INTERACTION whatsoever. We finally decide to ask a server for water, he responds in a rush....."ya." SO CRAPPY SO TACKY. Very disappointed...

sRq_3pevoDT2lEq6OUYb5A.text: Delicious! We choose then restaurant again and again. The staff is so friendly! The food is so fresh!

vwW4sO1L4DgqiQ6ViHtyfg.text: Noting much just felt like i was in Thailand .. taste great like how my parents cooked me   Love it and will definitely return

glaG40x1gDC2IdlCLOhaLg.text: This is my second time at this restaurant.everything From decor to sitting is awesome. Food taste great.every-time when I go to Vegas this is going to be my place.

Eb-hfiR2CXDkzADMG80FVQ.text: We order from work all the time, the delivery is always on time. The food arrives hot and it is consistently delicious. The employees are always attentive and nice. We love this place.

Pkbs0ns60umtgJMfbnRjQw.text: This is an Asian restaurant that offers a Thai and Chinese menu. The restaurant looks old and outdated, however, the food is very good. I was also surprised with the portion sizes as they were pretty generous at a reasonable price point.   We ordered the Tom Yum Kha which had a very traditional Thai flavor. We also ordered beef and broccoli, pat see ew and the Thai beef salad which were all good choices. The best dish was the combination fried rice which was very tasty. We also had the sweet green chicken curry which was somewhat of a disappointment and I would not recommend it. I guess the part that I did not enjoy was the fact that they used cucumbers for this dish.   Other than the curry, the flavors were great with mainly all of their dishes. So whenever you cannot decide between Chinese or Thai food, you can come to this restaurant and have the best of both worlds! Again, not a fancy place but this is a good and reasonable priced restaurant.

Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0xxrgXbKgrzr8viigwbh5A.text: I come here every time I visit Las Vegas, about 6 times in recent years.  Their weekday lunch special is a great deal, but it's still cheaper than most food places on the strip.  If you can handle spice, get the minced chicken basil with white rice.  It's really yummy. I also like getting their pad se ew and egg flower soup.  Not every visit was a hit for me, one time the Tom Yum soup pot they gave us was cold/lukewarm when it came out.  It was unusual and I wasn't sure if it was supposed to be like that.  When I finally decided to ask, the staff only offered to heat up whatever was left in the pot.  That ruined our meal experience a bit.

gQKxLooWXn5NuqIJER2xrA.text: Yelp reviews raved about this place so we came. I was hoping for more. We were sat at a table too large for two people in the middle of the room. When a booth became available I asked to move and was told no. That pretty much ended my liking this place, but wait- maybe the food will save it?  We ordered a sampler appetizer plate. It was good and I really liked the shrimp. I grew up eating at a Chinese restaurant that was a family favorite and they were very much like my favorite place. What I ordered for dinner was not as satisfying in fact I was going to give the leftovers to the crazy homeless guy outside on the street but I didn't. It didn't get eaten at all.  No one that works there is very friendly unless you are a regular.  overall we will not return. (luckily, my husband liked what he ordered and ate it all)

uXpPu1oISONvlKHxHGUV7Q.text: I came from LA to visit my family and they were raving about how good this food was well let me tell you it doesn't compare to LA Thai restaurants the shrimp fried rice has no egg in it and they give you the option of jumbo shrimp or small shrimp and we got both so the jumbo shrimp order has flavor to it compared to the small shrimp which you can tell were previously frozen and have no flavor I guess for Vegas it's ok

taAie7bLRMd-MkwWXda0DA.text: Great food , great service , very affordable prices . try the bbq pork, combination chow-mein, Mongolian beef and kung poa chicken !

OFiFS30qzmNcg3y78ORycA.text: The discrimination is real! We sat down and it legit took 15 minutes just to get water. The multiple groups of people that came in and sat down after us all got their orders and drinks immediately and before we did. With us being the only people of color in the place, and seeing everyone else treated promptly, it's hard to not feel like it was because of us being black. My boyfriend ordered the simple thai chicken and it took them forever just to come back and say that they didn't have the chicken for it, so he had to order something else and wait longer. And when we did get our food it was not good. I asked for the check and it took another 15 minutes. What was a 30 minute meal for every other customer, it took us 1 hour and 20 minutes for a simple meal. Ugh this place... never again!

PrPTsNujmzxP1dSs0qMInQ.text: The food was absolutely delicious.  Even the option to have either shrimp fried rice or jumbo shrimp fried rice was a nice touch. The seafood soup with calamari, fish balls, shrimp and crab was amazing! Their fried shrimp and fried calamari wasn't the average... it truly was amazing. But the part was the customer service... I am truly one who is big on great customer service... and this place truly knows how to treat their customers.
