orlSt5UQkMYr4J32w-McmA.text: The food is delicious, specially their " Shrimp Tom Yum Soup" . The service we received today was great! as always. Despite of it being busy, she kept our glasses full and frequently checking up on us. I appreciate that kind of service. I can eat this everyday. You must go and try their soup

6aqOrHj9OFAgnglo-w7Xzg.text: been coming to kungfu since 2006!!and still the best thai in town!!Jane the waitress is always nice...Sonny as well.great food.their fried rice is so flavorful you can taste the "wok flame!!"..their chicken chowmein so moist and not soggy.their tomkha gai is da bomb!!pad see eww and chinese brocoli with salted fish are the bomb as well.do not forget to order their fried calamari n beef salad!!the best thai restaurant in las vegas

hbuWLPceKELN-okF6skANw.text: Excellent food, big menu, average price.  We are glad to have visited this restaurant.  Prominently located at the corner unit, the restaurant can easily be spotted at night.

HqcQaeyWq-tex1Oah8s_bg.text: Delicious chinese and thai dishes at Kung Fu! And cheap!   Came here for dinner with my girlfriend's and ordered pad-see-ew with beef, kung pao chicken, chicken curry, and combination fried rice. Everything was oh so yummay!!! Portion servings was just enough for us 6. Customer service was top-notch! And wait time for our food was not long at all! I didn't even get a chance to take pictures of the food because the girls were starving and dove in right away lol! Very impressed with the overall experience, definitely recommend! (:

f16YudI7HOY9cXGVtW8mew.text: Since I discovered the restaurant (2 years now)  I ate there or ordered to-go at least once a week. Most of the guys basically know me by my name already.   If you like soups, you should try the Tom-Yum Soup, though I never go higher than number 3-4, I guess at 8 it should be really spicy!  For delivery, our whole office loves the Mongolian Beef or Chicken, and also the Chopped Chicken Ya Kee Mao is one of my fav's.  The prices are really good, their lunch special comes for $6.50 with one egg roll and one chicken piece.  I would recommend it to most of Thai lovers...

x-AlO0O3mGDf_PR3qmJWXw.text: Sooo good. I ordered delivery and they were at my room within 35mins. I ordered orange chicken and vegetable fried rice. Both were excellent. I will eat here every time I am in Vegas!

tMJQlxQqQ898ZgTIjYWBtw.text: Kung Fu offers a lunch special daily that is delicious and reasonably priced. I had the Pad Thai Shrimp every time I'm in the vicinity. It was wonderful each time. I recommend it! The staff says they are non-msg which is a plus too!

i5BX6O1g2UGFwYatdlHQwA.text: This is a staple lunch place. They have Thai and Chinese on the menus, though I've never had the Thai. The lunch specials are good, quick, and very price worthy.

uohDTRHB8cscGtXLA8Y0hw.text: So glad that our first choice of places to try was busy that we came across this place last minute.  The name and outside appearance is not very appealing, but my gosh, the service, friendliness, and delicious food over compensated the exterior, which was immediately forgotten.  This place will be placed on my regular go to list.

M4OvfvGZg2Rk_-Aw0kAUjw.text: Besides the fact they take awhile to bring your food, I love this place. Me and friends come here all the time when we're craving Chinese food. Delicious !!

PqbAQ2CVuLTKVgesQFbKJw.text: Just tried their food, it was amazing! Very tasty. I loved the beef and garlic sauce, and the chicken chowmein. It's kind of pricey, but overall it was good.

8-XzrA1EIi4HsV8sa1WC8A.text: If you want delicious food with quick service and don't care so much about decor this is your place. Very affordable and every bite was fresh hot and delicious.

vu59C4tuMr-bzNXYP4Uffg.text: Love love love this place!! I have been coming here for over 20 years. Always satisfied, great authentic Thai food, great customer service. Just the decor is dark and dated.

8rbOfgH9OYHs3IXfpmeRIQ.text: The service is very slow. I had to wave a waitress down after waiting 10 minutes. We ordered fried catfish, orange chicken, poah taek soup. I give it 4 stars for no flavor. The staff is very inattentive and they ran out of most of the appetizers like the fish cakes and sate and jerky at only 630pm. I'm used to flavorful food in SoCal but this place just had no flavor. Such a disappointment!

4E6-0iYQPAIxowvldNLw9g.text: The food was extremely decent for the price.   We ordered numerous dishes and everyone seemed to enjoy them.

D3X01TDZ2CXa3LtyKAFulg.text: Always quick to serve good, tasting affordable lunches !

4wTblcrWVzk6r7bnXqrOIQ.text: we tried their chicken pad thai to-go for 8.60.  - fast service. we order right when we got there and it took about 10m for us to get the food. - good to-go portion. nice to-go plates and utensils.  - taste like "fast-food" pad-thai. i'm not thai, but the noodles are wrong. ruins the essence of pad thai. thin, short, viet style noodle in pho? horrible.

-Cr8r49YtQbmA6QWcfx38Q.text: Pad see ew was good. Pad thai was not that good, but the mango sticky rice was good, but small. Price is decent. Probbaly woild not come back

EYwlz8dEHoK89bOUjap6jQ.text: My husband isn't the type who likes to try new places, but he has been a lot more open to the idea lately. I have been coming to Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant for years and love it, so I convinced my husband to try it out. He is a fan now!! Their Mongolian Beef is the best in town and their service is great. The prices are affordable and the food gets to the table within minutes of ordering.

rWU_lIFKjYPQMhOPCGnAyA.text: I love the pad thai it's so yummy and their thai iced tea is too bomb  the best thai food I ever tasted

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad thai

9xVwHUcy-r0SqQJy5tf0jg.text: Definitly enjoy the pad-thai, very delicious food.

zb1GS40MfhwWbHG0OaXC1w.text: Fast delivery and great food!   If you try nothing else get the crispy pork,  beef jerky and the fried shrimp!   Delish!

ia1PdzPhN_NuiPmIZMM2KA.text: Very decent Chinese buffet.  Kung Fu gets praise as a decent and affordable Chinese food buffet offering.  There really isn't anything that was truly amazing here but in this place's defense, everything was consistently good.  Not amazing, just good.  A lot of solid expected sightings like lo mein noodles, sweet and sour pork, kung pao chicken, & eggrolls.  Again, nothing that I had was amazing but I was very pleased with the more than acceptable quality of the items available.  Nothing seemed to be sitting for long periods of time and all of the foods were being served at the appropriate temperature.  Overall: Decent offering of Chinese buffet food at affordable prices.  Great place to stuff your face full of okay food.  Thumbs up for not making me feel like puking afterwards as most low end Chinese buffets do.

AehHTyaAscYVoafRbTG4LQ.text: Family style ordering and a vast menu of Chinese, Thai, and vegetarian dishes - great for families/bigger groups!  Though I did notice that the restaurant was packed with a diverse crowd of non-Asians.  Therefore, I have mixed feelings about this place because food is good, but being in the heart of Chinatown; I'm certain there are better options/hidden gems around the same price range.   We didn't love the broth of the vegetarian Tom Yum Kha soup bc it lacked coconut milk. From the reviews, it seems like the non-vegetarian version is the way to go.  Our main dishes were much better, getting usuals like Pad Thai, Chinese Cabbage, and Beef & Broccoli.  Spice levels range from 1-10.  Ps. bathroom lines can get as bad as a theme park wait because there is only one bathroom per gender.

HHPQWLfigY2o8PKUgDDrYA.text: Very good food and very good service. For a moment I thought I was back in China in Thailand. If you have flown 15,000 miles from Asia to get to Las Vegas you definitely need to come here and pretend you are still in Asia. Enjoy!

NnKXZsJWLkGK9W_47RCYjw.text: I noticed that a lot of negative reviews are about service, but I have never had that issue here. They refill our waters quite frequently, a lot better than most other restaurants. Everything that I have ever had at this restaurant has been really good. My top picks are the pad thai, pad si ew, tom yum, and the panang. I have also recently tried the Mongolian beef and that was also delicious! Kung Fu will always be one of my favorite thai and chinese go to. Most people are wary of restaurants that have three stars, but I highly recommend trying this place out. They have been open for decades, they are still here for a reason.

Oqgc9zdbcKhiIjPKbveOtg.text: We were very happy with our take-out from Kung Fu: Chicken with cashews, Pad Thai Chicken and Chicken Rice Soup.  This is convenient to the Rio Casino and there is parking so you can run in and pick up carry out.  I would go back.

o2xu6x2sf9qoY9rxqPIu_A.text: Just had the lunch special good price, nice portion but zero flavor,  the moo goo just tastes like nothing really.  Fried rice zero flavor , everything was cooked but seems like the salt was forgotten.  Not sure why this is a go to spot for a lot of people. Will give it another try but right now food has like blah.

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch special

T__66UiiZ0Epmtitk853lA.text: Since my family and I moved to Las Vegas this has actually been one of our top favorite spots to go to on weekend dinners as a family. The environment is pretty awesome and not to mention the food taste like Original Thai Chinese mix the portions are fairly large so it's big enough to share for up to 4 people and you get it timely depending how busy they are but still they do a good job I love it here

zJdS4UziDqS8xSc01e2GYw.text: Traveling all day and wanted a good meal to end our night. The service was great and on time. The food was delish. A bit pricey but hey I'm from Texas where Asian food is not king. Definitely will call on them again when I'm in Vegas and need food delivered.

fqGcJ0CukNuW0F9s6VnBJw.text: I've finally had the chance to dine in here, and I'm really pleased with my experience.   We came in yesterday, Christmas Day, for brunch.   The place was packed, but they found a small table for the two of us towards the back. They offer a free soft drink with a Yelp check in, and I was able to "upgrade" to a Thai iced tea for $1 instead of the normal $2.85.  Deal!  Today we ordered a cup of egg flower soup, egg rolls, shrimp Pad Thai, and Mongolian beef.    I thought the egg flower soup was gross, but I'm not a fan of that style of soup anyway.  My fella LOVED it.  He said it was some of the best egg flower soup he's had in town.   The egg rolls were amazing, and let me tell you about the hot mustard sauce...wowza, THAT cleared my sinuses after one bite.  It was absolutely amazing, and I usually don't care too much for hot/spicy things.    The Mongolian beef was delicious:  tender beef with great flavor and a little kick to it, with peppers and onions and carrots.    The Shrimp Pad Thai was good too...the noodles were perfect.  My only complaint and the reason for the docked star was that the shrimp were REALLY over cooked.    Service was extremely polite, and quick.    I absolutely plan to continue to order in from here, and I would definitely dine in again.

3MxfPsLPkcEzXxh0LVnevQ.text: Kung Fu Thai was a little hard for me to find because it's tucked on the side of a shopping center. I thought there would be parking on the side . It is best to just park in the front of the shopping center and walk to the restaurant. We were seated right away which was nice.   I ordered Drunken Noodles it's called something else here. I just can't remember what they called it! I'm glad the waiter knew what I was talking about! It was delicious!   My brother had the Sweet and Sour Pork ($8.75). You could tell that this was made fresh because it wasn't Chewy and soft. It was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. We also ordered a side of egg rolls for ($6.95) . I liked that the rolls had clear noodles in it because I don't see that often.   The service was also prompt and friendly. We didn't have to look for anyone because they constantly checked on us. This was an awesome eating experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls
Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles

ddYo8j4GLYnoZDz5Ad5hUA.text: KUNG FU KICKED TO 2 STARS     Kung Fu Restaurant broke an important rule. That rule is to NEVER EVER force your customers to leave a minute after giving them the check. Breaking this rule has consequences such as A ONE STAR REDUCTION IN A REVIEW RATING. As a result of their unprofessional action a 3.4 rating is dropped to 2.4 stars that is rounded off to 2 stars. Yikes! kind of how my brother and I also felt. In all honesty this a gentle response considering that many talented Yelper's would reward this experience with a one star rating.     Kung Fu Restaurant is located in the Las Vegas Chinatown District at the southwest corner of Valley View and Spring Mountain Boulevard. After a day in Springs Preserve suffering with a hurt left foot my brother and I decided to drive a few traffic lights South on Valley View Boulevard to Chinatown. This would be a convenient choice. Actually not really. Regardless that Kung Fu is at a major crossroads, the parking situation is atrocious. The diminutive parking spaces are more ideal for a golf cart than today's modern vehicles. I'd sacrifice my car if I left it there. So, we parked across Valley View Boulevard near Starbuck's with the intention of a post dinner coffee after. So I'd sacrifice my legs and limbs crossing a busy Valley View Boulevard.    The service started out allright. Immediately after walking inside there was a booth available (I wonder why). The waiter presented my brother and I with glasses of cold water and the menus.     Regardless that there was a large assortment of dishes to choose from, only the entree page dishes included jasmine rice. Nothing about brown or fried rice. I ordered the shrimp chop suey which was around $9.50. My taste buds say that the shrimp chop suey is 3.4 stars. In comparison to the Chinese restaurants that I have reviewed (my Chinese Restaurants list is the home of these reviews) the size of the shrimps trailed in comparison. Generally speaking, or tasting the quality from the vegetables to the sauce tasted fine. The soy sauce gave some taste to the jasmine rice.  With the shrimp chop suey and jasmine rice, I ordered hot tea. In my opinion it is nearly impossible to mess up the delicious hot tea that Chinese restaurants serve. After a few cups of the delicious green tea, I stand by my opinion. Thanks to the Yelp checkin offer, the tea was complimentary. I would of enjoyed a bowl of my beloved wonton soup,  one of my favorite foods in the world going back to my toddlerhood. But Kung Fu doesn't give any breaks with the soup. The war won ton soup is around $9. they ought to include personal portions of soup on the menu. Then again, they ought to include chopsticks on the table.     The food was good. I ate everything down to the plate including the sauce. My brother and I were talking at the time the waiter presented us with the check. Around a minute later the waiter tells us to pay because people were waiting for the booth. He wasn't giving us the stink eye and handed us our fortune cookies. Without a nasty demeanor he just rushing us out of the booth barely giving my brother and I time to split the bill.     I didn't read the fortune cookie. An appropriate fortune cookie would say something like, "The average person tells nine other people when they are unhappy with a business where the average Yelper tells a couple thousand people when they are unhappy with a business." Or the fortune cookie might of said, "You have a World of restaurants to choose from in your city." Or the fortune cookie could of said, "There is nothing like competition." To close off this review, what I am saying is that Kung Fu rushed us out the door of their restaurant and it is a door I don't intend to open in a long time.

MyCtdRb-T8I_A5uo7HLWhw.text: We used to go here almost 20 years ago.  We came back to have a meal with the family.  It was absolutely delicious.  We ordered the Wor wonton soup, Mongolian beef, General Tso's chicken, and shrimp lo mein.  The flavors of the dishes were great and the plates were not heavily sauced (a personal complaint I have of most Chinese dishes).  It was pretty busy for a Sunday late dinner crowd, but we were served quickly and the staff was very friendly.  My only complaint was the barbeque pork in the wonton soup has the orange rind and it maid the soup look pinkish (it made it look unappetizing).  Besides that one complaint we loved coming here again after a long absence and will come here again for Chinese/Thai food!!!

Y3zjtpvIbJNIJNUAgap4hQ.text: This place was pretty good. Nice big portions and good customizability. We came with a big group and they let us split the check. They include graditutity for parties 6 or more. The Pad Thai had great flavor and if you want, you can add the spices on the side. I was a little drunk at the time of eating, so take that as you will.

LOtjB8ACyHHtszr2MopTzQ.text: You gotta love the Asian place that has a duel menu, Thai and Chinese. We're here today for Chinese.  The place isn't very busy, almost a bit concerning, perhaps a warning?  We came in anyway.  After looking over the menu, we picked out a soup, a noodle dish and a few more Chinese dishes.  The food took some time, which was kinda weird since they weren't very busy!  When the food started coming out, it was one at a time, we generally enjoy family style, with a little bit of each on our plates, but the food was so slow, we had time to eat one at a time.   The food as good, very good flavor and we weren't disappointed, but the service wasn't what we're used too!

2eowoz1SYnwLHpRRBm6vEQ.text: After a crazy night of drinking and partying my girlfriends and I were craving noodle soup.  Luckily, my friend has been here before so we all decided to have lunch.  I was craving tom yum soup and while going through their extensive detailed menu, I noticed they had tom yum NOODLE soup......never had it before so I decided to give it a try.    We started off with papaya salad (medium spicy) with salted crabs.  I kept thinking the sliced green veggie was peas and wondered why the hell the salad was so damn spicy, turns out they were chilli peppers and NOT peas. ....oops.  the salad overall was tasty, fresh, and delicious.  Moving on to the best noodle soup I've ever had in my whole entire life: TOM YUM NOODLE SOUP.  Words cannot express just how amazed I was.  It was extremely flavorful with the right amount of spices and the noodles were perfectly cooked.  I'm constantly looking for cheap flights so I can fly out there just for this.    Service - You're average asian restaurant.   Poor guy had to go back and forth with our orders since we kept asking him for extra stuff.   But my experience here was pleasant.  I will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

87FOM0aATmTni5zznIkSEw.text: Great find! We were visiting Vegas and my Hubby was in the mood for Chinese so we took a chance and stopped here. We were very pleased to have found such an authentic Thai and Chinese restaurant. Clean, friendly and prompt.

nBdGvv1b8rogbM_fV8ZxNA.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. I rarely ever write reviews for any businesses but this restaurant stole my money and the money of two of my co-workers as well.  We decided to order three lunch specials online on their website and paid for it no problem via Paypal. We receive a phone call shortly after from a woman who refused to name herself and she stated that "Oh sorry we don't serve lunch specials on the weekends." We ask if she can make an exception and deliver our food because we already paid for it.   "No, we can't make food for you. We don't serve lunch specials on the weekends."    Then why is it available on your website? Why were we able to pay for it? Granted, we did not see the disclaimer on their website that said "Lunch Specials are only available M-F 11:00-3:00PM" --but then why is it available as an option to purchase on the website at all times?   I also ask if there is any way we can just go pick up the food or if they can refund us our money. The woman says "No we can't make food for you." She then says "You'll get your money back when the manager comes back...but I don't know when he'll be back." Um? Excuse me?  I ask her when the manager will be back and she says that she doesn't know. I then ask her if there's anyone else we can speak to. She says no and that she is the only one in the restaurant.   How is this poor disgrace of customer service the only one at this restaurant? There are no chefs to cook our food? Seriously? Maybe that's why we can't get our food.  We even offered to pay extra to get the regular entree portions of the food but she again repeats: "No food for you." She then states "Don't worry, don't worry! You'll get your refund. I'll let my manager know. Not sure how long refund take." How very reassuring.   Shortly after speaking with me she hangs up after stating that "There is nothing I can do for you."    Well, if there's nothing you can do, there's definitely things that I can do. The business is being reported to the Better Business Bureau and a dispute was also opened on Paypal for our refund. All we wanted was some damn food.

casx1tretuenL1BcdjRSIg.text: Please note this review is only for delivery - I've never eaten at the actual restaurant.  Tough to review this place on just a * rating, so let me explain:  1) Chinese dishes are Thai-style, so extremely sweet. 2) Thai food is decent enough to satisfy my fix, but not a lot of variety. 3) Ingredients (esp. vegetables) seem fresh / good quality. Seafood combo dishes mostly imitation, however. 4) Portion size varies anywhere from meh to very good; meat ratios vary even more wildly. 5) Online ordering system is fantastic for convenience. 6) They deliver fast and have never gotten the order wrong, and reliable delivery is a rarity in Vegas.  Ya, probably averages out somewhere a bit above a 3*, but I think rounding up to 4* is a bit too generous especially since I avoid the Chinese food. Despite any negatives, the Thai food is flavored right and that's what counts. With the convenient ordering and reliable delivery, still good enough to make the rotation for our office's lunch delivery.

cijaiIdvERI2UGWNrAXVDw.text: Food definitely not worth the crappy service you get here. Better places for Thai food out here.

YJaMp8Odumg0VYog3k6fhg.text: They have pretty long vegetarian menu. I lie them, very good service and food :) Ami is very nice server. The restaurant look expensive but is very good prices. Thank you...

6eVc5nPIdve0yQ-A7alQ1A.text: It's surprisingly difficult to find places that deliver in Vegas. Everyone in the office is completely sick of Jason's Deli 3 days in a row, so we tried something different and so glad we did. I've only had the Thai food from Kung Fu, but it's one of the few places in Chinatown that delivers, and figured we'd give their food a try.  We did the order by phone since it was catering, but I was really surprised that their website allows you to do the order online for delivery or pick up. Helps a lot with the language barrier - I don't speak Chinese or Thai, but my coworker made me order (in English!) because she had trouble understanding them.   We were able to feed 12-14 people for about $160 which is really good. Delivery was on time and there was no minimum or delivery fee. I wasn't blown away by the Chinese food, but it was above average with generous servings at a really reasonable price. I think each half pan was around $40.   It's not my personal go-to for Chinese or Thai, but the fact that they're cheap, so close to the strip and have delivery makes this place 5-star if you're visiting. Beats paying $25 for sweet & sour chicken from a casino restaurant.

jv_etCtBdmN87rvU8pBhjQ.text: My husband and I were really were looking forward to a good meal in Chinatown.  We came upon Kung Fu Thai & Chinese and checked it's rating in Yelp.  We entered the establishment, 2 of us, and there was a party of 3 behind us.  The waiter said to us, "Take that table there."  He pointed to a table by the wall, and I asked if that was the table he meant.  Yes!  He proceeded to seat the party of 3 while we seated ourselves, and he then brought us menus and took our drink order.  The menu is quite extensive, but we decided on appetizers of crab rangoon, bbq pork egg foo young, and Thai beef w/vegetables.  The table had been previously set with lunch size plates.  The waiter brought the appetizer, set it down and left.  We mixed the sweet & sour sauce with the mustard sauce on our plates and ate the crab rangoon.  It was just ok, but my husband removed half of the filling because it really was way too much in the won ton.  This extra filling he put on his plate.  We now have lunch plates with sauce and filling sitting in front of us.  The waiter returned with our food and just sat it on the table and left.  Not a word, no eye contact.  We looked at each other and said, OK, and proceeded to place our food and rice on the dirty plates.  Every wait staff in the place refused to give us any type of eye contact or acknowledge us.  My husband finally said, "Do you get the feeling we are not wanted here?"  "OMG, Yes!" I said.  It was so uncomfortable in there.  No one ever came over to see if we needed anything or to refill our tea.  To say the least, this was the worst Chinese and Thai food we have EVER had!  The egg foo young was so bland and almost had a water taste to it.  The brown gravy on was in was tasteless.  I actually added table salt to my beef and veggies in order to try and liven it up a bit.  We wanted some soy sauce, but do you think any person would even look at us?  NO!  BUT, when it came time for us to leave all of a sudden we had all the smiles and help we needed.  Someone actually refilled our tea!  And, everybody was trying to wish a good evening, etc.  Guess the thought of a tip was overpowering to them.  Surprise!  The tip was $3, which was way too much!  My thoughts?  Stay away from this place as I am sure there are some fabulous places in Las Vegas for Thai and Chinese food!

KtTtIuTd-vKfm8MWFQ3EPA.text: Went with a big group from out of town- all of us were able to get a different dish and share, and all of us were very happy with so many good dishes!  Great selection and great customer service, (especially for the large party of 12) and all at a good price.

WJpHFtsjEUDFXBHYvKxxOw.text: I have eaten here twice when I have been visiting Vegas.  Both times I've had the panang curry.  It was very good both times.  My service has always been good and I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas and looking for Thai.

6FbT4HGx-ppG1v0Q774Hpg.text: Great food and good service.  The dinning room could use a little TLC. It seems cluttered and disorganized.  If your looking for good food  please give hem a chance. You will not be disappointed at the quality and quantity of food serviced here.

t1O6vQ1j_EYFBF4RQx7wHA.text: Pretty good Thai food here.  I love Tofu but probably not order the tofu satay again, very little flavor.  The other things that we ordered were pretty good.  It felt pretty authentic.  The wait staff was not very friendly but the food arrived hot and fresh and that is good enough for me.

7IEDl9Ilz_GHUtvTDQKTkQ.text: Great service.  Food was excellent.  The price was very reasonable for a soup, three plates, steam rice and a couple of beer.  Did I say there were only two of us.  The bill came out a out $50.  Awesome.  We will be back.

2_3EoXOcSWjzt3LS4f1JRQ.text: Place wasn't really busy when we arrived on Christmas day in late afternoon so we didn't have to wait long. Food was good as ever and our server was nice and helpful as we wanted to try something we haven't had before. Was hectic when we were going to leave so took a bit to get our check and to go boxes.  Overall as good as it's always been

z1uNjKvw9MKI5DGp1y_YcA.text: I've lived in the Bay Area for 10 years before I moved here in 1999. While living there I worked for a small Chinese Restuarant  called Jade Palace of Newark. They have great food! Living here nearly 15 years, I have been trying to find good Chinese food. It became a mission. Then one day I walk into this establishment because my business is in the same plaza, I tried with the beef salad. Yes, I know that is Thai but, I loved that they gave more meat, and it was delicious. Then the BBQ pork won ton soup. Yum! Then the egg foo young! A must try. I just wished they would serve POTSTICKERS the Jade Palace served them. I'm still on the hunt for them. Good job Kung Fu Thai  but, that is my to go from here on out.

9MqsImk1TB8l0E54j-QfCg.text: It was a long evening and a few of us were starving! We were very glad that this place has late hours and there were SO MANY items to choose from on the menu. The best part was that the tom ka soup came flaming so it was kept warm while we were eating. Service was fast, portions were huge - the deliciousness went on for another meal!

_CpcwB79Z14Bltn_PBcKEg.text: Ive been eating at Kung Fu for years. Anyone Ive ever taken there or ordered with loves it. They deliver! I have not found crab rangoon anywhere that compares to theirs. You order the spice of a dish on a hotness level 1-10. They could be a little more consistent with that but I think it depends on the cook. I dont like too hot so I order a 1 or 2 which sometimes can feel more like a 4 or 5.. but overall, the best Chinese & Thai cuisine.

ROOQs-GWgg4c-vKG1VKWrA.text: This place is located right in the heart of Chinatown.  They offer both eat in and delivery.  I don't live in their delivery area anymore, and I'll still drive down to get their food about once every other month.  I would have rated them higher than a 3 b/c the food is great, but I only like to order a few things off of their menu...and they have a lot of options.  B/c of some of the meals I've had and not enjoyed, I marked them only a 3 star place.  Also, the restaurant isn't the cleanest and the decor is old.  I will say though that their Beef and Broccoli is very good, as well as their Chopped Chix Soup and their Hot N Sour Soup.  They offer a Thai and Chinese menu there, and we always tend to order from the Chinese side of the menu.  They have a really good hot sauce there so make sure to ask for that.  It's fantastic in the Chopped Chicken Soup!

HxCNaKbElkWrSwXD72uNdw.text: Went here because Krung Siam across street was closed. Should have kept driving... bad bad bad.

oLHaoHITNUK3d4N302i8CA.text: Not impressed. I had the wor won ton soup and shrimp fried rice. Both had way too many onions.  Besides the taste of onion, the fried rice didn't really have much flavor. This was my first time here. I heard a lot of good things. And, most of the comments on Yelp were positive. The place was crowded with both people sitting and eating as well as people getting takeout. Service was good.  I'll try it again and see what happens.

k6Y1ftyPqkNww4p1tOfFew.text: This is a great place to have your quick fix of Thai and Chinese food! It's in Chinatown off of Valley View facing the 4 way stoplights. I went with my good gf and we had a quick lunch break to chat and enjoy good cheap eats! This was the lunch time and considering it being the peak time where people from office or casinos have their lunch break most restaurants were not open? It was odd so we knew that Kung Fu had never let us down and was great to eat. We had the lunch specials where you can have a soup, egg roll and chicken wing with steam or fried rice and an entree of your choice. The entree was either Chinese or Thai to choose from. And the order was quick and fast. There were several patrons there on their lunch break too and looked like they were having the lunch special too?! It's only $7.25 and anything other than the lunch special depending on the entree should be around $7 and up. They also deliver! That's an added Plus when you can't get out of the office and or job. Super recommend!

DJW7jWcjgQi9BbpuWgGtkA.text: I am going straight neutral on Kung Fu, but I have to erase from my memory the unswept, noodle-laden floor. When we arrived on a Sunday evening, the floor was a disaster. My husband said, "Don't look down." Good advice.  Moving beyond the floor, which I am sure at times is immaculate, we came in to try some Thai. When I go for Thai, I go for curry. I ordered the panang tofu, as that was the curry listed under their vegetarian selections. I forgot to ask if they were able to do soft tofu instead of fried, and the dish came with fried. I thought the tofu was perhaps over-fried, as the texture was a bit chewy, and the flavor a little greasy. As for the curry itself, it had a very heavy peanut flavor. Based on what I know, the inclusion of peanuts in curry is sometimes a personal preference of the chef, and some people may enjoy the flavor. However, for me, it was overly sweet and the curry was incredibly thick. I kept telling my husband that it tasted like peanut butter and tofu, which wasn't pleasing to my taste buds. This is not a dish I would order again.  The service was efficient.  One bad dish and some lackluster floors creates a less than ideal first impression. Still, there is a whole menu of potential, so as I said in the beginning, I'll stay neutral.

q8sIcnk4lTQA5qPa9sT-Cg.text: Been to Kung Fu a few times. LOVE IT. Its always pretty full when we go so it makes it a better experience to people watch. I always the Tom Yum soup with shrimp. Love the spyciness. I also recommend the walnut shrimp if you like sweet food. Place seems clean and waitress is always sweet.

3RJZBRyA8fZp9o8vgQCigQ.text: After waiting more than TWO HOURS for a delivery, I was shocked to see such a small amount of food for the $60 spent.  STONE COLD food I should mention.  The Thai wings and fried shrimp were just huge blots of fried  cold batter.... lots of dried out boiled rice and two very small containers of tasteless, limp cold food.  THEN they hit me up for a $4 delivery charge............  GO TO WEERA - HEARD EXCELLENT THINGS AND WILL TRY IT NEXT TIME.  KUNG FU THAI - YOU SUCK!!!

98nIMU3AiX3JPVtDAsr1qw.text: Our very asian looking dealer at the Rio Casino told us to come here for good thai food. I thought, GREAT! A local recommending a good thai restaurant - it MUST be good. she also recommended the stuffed fried chicken wings which also sounded bomb.  GPSed this place and went with 4 other people. I first looked for the chicken wings under appetizer and found it: Stuffed fried chicken wings (2). WHAT THE HELL. 8.95 for 2 wings? Whatever, we ordered it anyway since the dealer recommended it. I ordered the laad na with beef (flat noodles topped with gravy sauce with beef), my bf ordered the pad thai with chicken, my other 2 friends ordered pad see ew with chicken, and the other ordered roast duck over fried rice.  First of all, let me just say, it took almost half an hr just for the waitress to come to our table to get our order. Second, it took another 45 min for the food to come. The thai ice tea came out pretty quick though and was pretty tasty.  The stuffed fried chicken wings came out first. Man, that was a small portion. We all took 1/5 of the wing and it was mediocre.  30 min later,  My laad na was finally came and was DISGUSTING. I dont think ive ever had nastier laad na than this place. It was bland, the noodles were not pan fried at all, and the beef was dry and overcooked. My bf's pad thai was soso. The pad see ews came with 90% noodles, 5% veg, and 5% chicken. The duck fried rice looked disgusting also. I think the only tasty item in this restaurant is their thai ice tea.  -2 for food, - 2 for service, and +1 for thai ice tea.

YzDjdKktIvqo6K66TmF4gw.text: I love asian food especially Thai. I work so much, never have time to eat out, quick delivery is important to me. Great food, friendly service and they understand english when I call to order food. Well as along as you take your time when you talk.  I also like the fact that they have a good vegetarian menu.   LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT!

qHNFodezBODPCVZd7b2c3g.text: ok...this is my second time trying this place because i had to give it the benefit of the doubt....I only proved my point the second time around....the food is overcooked and extremely dry.Both times I had the mongolian beef lunch special....now i'm no master chef but believe me i had to drink about a gallon and a half of water just to swallow this food....very very dry meat that obviously was overcooked.even my co workers said the same about their dishes...definitely will not eat from there again....i know we live in the desert here but at least make the food moist.

This was the only place I could find on the book that deliver Chinese food where we are so I took my chances.  I ordered satay chicken, shrimp pad thai, mongolian beef, shrimp Thai fried rice, whole deep fried catfish, chicken panang, papaya salad and steamed rice ( I know it sounds a lot, but I also have the parents w/us), bill came up to $72. RCSQ2MJsvCAnZwTM8dTBbA.text: As I walked into a surprisingly full dining room of a Thai restaurant in a town well-known for Thai food, I built up expectations of a great meal. I didn't get one.  Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant was actually an impromptu plan B. We wanted to go to another Thai restaurant on the other end of this extremely long and narrow strip mall on Spring Mountain. However, this came with a personal recommendation, so it seemed viable at least. Entering the Valley View-facing front door of this business and seeing the packed house, it was natural to hope for something special.  It took around 10 minutes to be seated during this dinner rush - and a manager or employee claimed that this was actually a slow night. Speaking of slow, they took a while to get around to taking our order. That wasn't so bad for a first-timer trying to decide on what to choose from the vast menu of at least a hundred items. Thankfully, they did get our food out in a reasonable amount of time.  Papaya Salad ($8.95): julienned papaya, sweet coconut sauce, ground peanuts, ground dried shrimp, tomato, and evidently some chilis. All of the ingredients were fresh, especially the crunchy papaya. The spiciness was quite problematic, though. I called for a 3 out of 10 but variance was huge. I took several bites with no lingering heat at the start, but some later bites incinerated my mouth. It averaged out to at least a 5.  Pad Thai w/ "Certified Angus Beef" ($10.25): the beef is at best a little above average, but I don't have any beef with the marketing ploy. The problem is that the Pad Thai tasted like a Chinese bastardization of this fundamental, foundational noodle dish. I didn't taste such key nuances as fish sauce and tamarind. The end result was on the sweet side and was enjoyable enough, but it wasn't Pad Thai.  Green Curry w/ pork ($9.95): I didn't have as much of an issue here as my dining companion did. It was a solid curry with bamboo shoots and zucchini, and a side of white rice. The only noticeable downside is perhaps the unremarkable pork. I was also curious as to the lack of yellow and red curries on the menu, and considering the inauthentic dish above, I'd wager that they just don't have that depth of recipe knowledge in their kitchen.  I don't see what draws the crowds to Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant. They simply don't hold to candle to other local Thai restaurants both inexpensive and extravagant. Maybe it's their close-to-Strip location, along with their sign perfectly positioned to catch the eye of those driving down Spring Mountain. Maybe it's their decades of presence and the loyal if misguided long-time patrons - surely, fewer options were available way back when. As for me, one try was enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya Salad ($8.95)

QUFaMFGStWISFSIaIye4Hg.text: A buddy who lives in Vegas took us here...and we enjoyed.  We tried several dishes and each one was really good...quick and easy.  They even put the game on for us to view...no problem.  Hope to be back soon and enjoy some more good food.  I will be back.

1_2GtwaBwv2hDkPDOjbqmw.text: Been here half dozen times and always the same. Food is okay but nothing spectacular. Problem is service is lacking and management could improve several things.   Usually quick to seat you but ordering is awkward. They are not flexible on a few things I've requested even when I said I'd pay extra the server didn't even try and just said no.   Decor and seating is nice compared to other places nearby.   Location is the worst to find parking though, just don't be in a hurry.   They block calls from people that hide their numbers. As a BUSINESS they should respect my wish to not have my number tracked. The owner could not give me a reason why they block the calls but did say he won't change it. So if you call several times and it's busy that's likely why.  I tried them again today and I had to ask for my hot tea after waiting 6-7 minutes after ordering. Never came back to see if I was good. Had to ask for the check.   Better choices in Vegas for sure.

My mom is super plain jane and I can eat something tasty here while she can also play it safe with more traditional foods.  The Mongolian Beef is not to be missed as you can't go wrong with it. Egg drop soup for the table is great. I personally enjoy their Thai food immensely, particularly their curries. The Mint chicken is also great. There are just so many options, I could go on forever. yCgb5VQlyzrdPPkzOAgHoA.text: Because from the outside this place says Thai and Chinese I automatically assumed it wasn't going to be good. To my surprise all the flavor were there. Just to show you can't judge a book by its cover. The service was pleasant and quick. I went there for lunch with a party of 17, ordered a whole bunch of dishes and everything was great and in a timely matter.  The decor is not my style but I would be going back for the food not the decor.

40AYqowyOE6fpCV2RLJ5Fg.text: We went to our favorite restaurant in China town in honor of the Chinese New Year celebrations going on downtown over the weekend. I have to admit, I was disappointed that there wasn't a special offered or some type of unique meal for the occasion. But none the less, we all decided to try something different than our "norm" on this trip and it was Tom Yum Soup with Shrimp - we've always seen and admired it at other people's tables, so decided to give it a try. On the scale of spice, we asked for medium. I'm not much of a spicy person - medium turned out to be way too much for both my mother and I. In fact, my sister, who loves spice, tried it and it was way too much for her. It ended up ruining our dinner this night. My lips were numb from my small sampling of it and I couldn't taste anything more the rest of the night.  We were surprised that it wasn't crowded when we arrived, however, by the time we left almost every table was filled. Although I've given the restaurant four stars, this night didn't really deserve a one star. It took 30 minutes for someone to take our order. Others arrived after us, received their food before us and were on their way out the door as we were finally being served our main course. For me - this is an automatic negative review for me unless circumstances occurred causing the delay. But this was before the place got really busy. It took another 30 minutes after we were done to have our table cleared and ask for the bill. And another 15-20 minutes after receiving the bill to flag someone down to take our payment. I think we only saw our waiter once the entire night. The rest of the servers were people we had to flag down for one reason or another.   Although the soup ended up ruining the rest of the meal, I can tell you the food there has always been wonderful! Appetizers of Crab Rangoon, Calamari, Wings (really good), Satay and combo platters have always been tasty. We make it a must to have at least one appetizer each time we go. The Pad Thai is really good - they even give you a choice of the type of noodles to have with it. Mongolian Beef is awesome! So is the Ginger and Pepper Pork/Chicken or Beef (we've had one of each). Egg Fu Young (whichever type you have) is moist, delicious and so flavorful. Overall - we really love the restaurant. Just wasn't at its best this past Saturday evening.

7ZR5AJueBCdHBsOSxF628g.text: What a great find on Las Vegas! The Pad See Ew with Angus beef was divine. Can't wait to come back and try every single dish!

UraAU84eBhVEFT-KwHg1TA.text: This place is amazing! The food is great snd reasonably priced and the portions are hefty. They have great thai tea here which is a must have. 4J8p3fB1g8ChkurzeyCSqQ.text: One day, my wife and I were out, and she told me we should go to this place. She said she had been there seven years ago, and it was very good.   I told her that " a lot can change in seven years", and I was right.   We both agreed that this was one of the worst Chinese meals we ever had.  The staff did try to please, but they just could not over come the bad food that came out of the kitchen. We ordered a curry dish, kung pao chicken, and a shrimp dish.  My wife took one look at the curry dish and said, "When I saw it, I knew we were in trouble."  She was right. Poor quality ingredients, and no taste to it.  The Kung Pao Chicken, a standard which I use to compare Chinese places, was awful. My dogs turned down the left over chicken; The peanuts were few, and tasted like they were purchased from a ball park, six months after the season ended, and the dish tasted liked it was cooked in Motor oil.  Remember those terrible shrimp that are in those 99 cent cocktails in Downtown Casinos? Ever wonder where the ones they reject go? This is the place!!  Top off the food with booths where the fabric is torn apart and needs replacement, and you risk sitting with a spring up your butt, and you have a perfect picture of  Kung Fu Thai and Chinese.   Go across the Street to Krung Thai. Better food, nicer place, better prices, and much easier to park.  Trust me, I wanted to give this a Zero, but I am required to give one star. Generous.

bs47sV3MobSGFpNmRC2i8w.text: GREAT lunch specials $6.50 i think it is. Pretty Tasty. Good Portions. Friendly Staff. and always QUICK!!!

bLKPbp2IYFGMnr_MCZJZww.text: At my little hotel on the Strip (no longer Cosmopolitan, btw) we have an Employee Dining Room. It's... well... it would get zero stars on Yelp. So sometimes we just can't hack it, and call in for some more-edible options. One of those places is Kung Fu. It had some good reviews and a full menu online, so we gave it a try.  It's exceptionally pleasing! Of course, I had to go with Pineapple Fried Rice (my favorite!) and theirs comes in huge portions with chicken, pork, shrimp, and crab! What a catch! (You see what I did there?) My coworker went with the pad thai and she liked it.  The best part is that delivery is in pretty reasonable time, and they deliver anywhere to the strip. It's a pretty good option, especially if you just want to chill in your hotel room before going out.

0_MlNKOUjA9_5wGYroDJuQ.text: First time and last experience here. We ordered Thai fried rice and Pad Thai. The fried rice was oily and lacking flavor. Pad Thai was nothing but peppers and bland. I've had better Thai food on my side of town, I.e. Pin Kaow and Thai House. Even Panda fried rice than this place. Sorry Panda.  Poor customer service as well.  Just because it's a great location with guaranteed traffic doesn't give you the right to produce mediocre food.

fqBzGEZmRASt4SCgcutmWQ.text: My Fiance and I were looking for a Christmas Story style Chinese Restaurant for our Christmas dinner. Kung Fu delivered with Truely authentic Asian delicacies and personnel.  If we had asked them to sing a Christmas Carol or chop the head off of a duck at our table I bet they would have.   We knew we were at a great Asian restaurant when we looked around and noticed we were the only two non Asian people in the place. A few others came in later but knowing their own culture embraces the restaurant got us excited.  We weren't disappointed. All four dishes had wonderful flavors and aromas. They tasted very fresh and flavorful. The portion sizes were considerable so trust me you will be taking some home.  Parking did stink but if you can find a spot you won't be disappointed having to park down the block and walking a block or two.

GlskSP0LbvMykPh0YP2P7Q.text: Atmosphere is ok, Tom yum gong is ok, everything else is so so. Food came really fast which is great, but it's a pity that the food was too salty. Most likely won't return.

GlOfGCN-yMQNM0atVKGOMw.text: Delicious food, great service and would definitely recommend the Mongolian Beef and Egg Fu Beef! Got pick-up and everything was project!!

rxVKGhgP6XtK_5wbdPWHiw.text: We were a party of 6 and having just been to Chinatown in SF, I was disappointed.  The service was just about as bad as it gets - with items coming out and varied times and some of the dishes were downright skimpy.  It wasn't bad or great - was just okay.

zDVFvdoZQ8zlhAHp-PWTaA.text: This place is great! We always take out-of-towners here, and we get nothing but rave reviews from them as well. It is often requested that we return the next time they are in town. The service is friendly and usually prompt. The food comes out as it is prepared, so sometimes it's a little weird to get a dish every few minutes. But it always comes out fresh, hot and delicious. We haven't delved into the Thai side of the menu, but we can vouch for a number of dishes on the Chinese portion of the menu. The General Tso's Chicken is our favorite, as well as the Sesame Chicken, Mongolian Beef and the Combo Chow Mein. Parking is a pain, but worth the hassle!

PHDyHDTyFT1qqhOr-W1HRw.text: Unbelievably fantastic thai food at a very reasonable price! I had the Mongollian Beef at the heat level of five (they ask you what heat level you want your food from 1-10) and it was simply PERFECT! Great service too.  Suggestion on how to get there if you're staying on the strip: Take the free shuttle from either Harrahs or Ballys to Rio and then walk about a quarter of a mile up valley view rd. to Kung Fu. Believe me, its worth the walk. Delish!

2FDrr4jkR31v2-_ZDPKdaw.text: The food here is really great... if you like authentic Thai food!!!  Suggestions include... Mint Chicken (Chopped Chicken Chili Mint), Shrimp Pad Thai, Tom Kha Ghai Soup, Beef Satay.

L4tLwuuXkqDHtvhycU_QmQ.text: I wish yelp had option of zero stars...or negative score.This is literally the worst Chinese restaurant we have ever been in. We ordered 2 plates of fried rice, 1 plate of kung pao chicken, 1 plate of spicy cat fish. We then added an order of shrimp. After waiting for close to 45 minutes!!!!!, and watching other people getting served who came way after us, and multiple enquiries, we got only the shrimp dish. Again after multiple queries, we got the full order, but only one serving of rice. The catfish was burnt beyond imagination. The shrimp tasted like a reheated plate...very leathery and burnt crispy. An old lady (may be owner or management ) asked us "how was it"...we said we are really disappointed.  Her response.." you still finished your food, didn't you"...!!!!!!

PNz_nyhkucXlqIKeZmHoWQ.text: Horrible service. Mismanaged, unapologetic and unprofessional. Do not expect a nice time.

-vpIE3TnAQBEECaPyJHAxA.text: Great place. Thai/Chinese cuisine. We stopped going to buffets in Vegas. We do Kung Fu everytime we visit. Fried calamari, Chinese broccoli in oyster sauce, pad thai, fried chicken wings are a must. Still haven't gone through the whole menu.

DEJwMTHjJJ7wt9kdOcbuYg.text: This is a review of their take-out service; I'm sure the experience is different in the restaurant itself. Also, I'm not entirely sure if the take-out menu has all the items that are in the in-house menu. I have never been to the restaurant itself. Decided to try the take-out menu because one of us was feeling sick and was not up to going to the casinos for a meal. We were staying at a timeshare near the strip that did not have room service. First, I tried ordering online because they have a convenient online ordering system through their website at kungfuplaza.com. The ordering system was very well organized, with pictures of the food you're ordering. However, after putting in my order, the final page indicated that the delivery address was my credit card's billing address which is in another state and not the hotel that I was staying in. I cancelled the order and called in the order instead. The woman who took the order had a strong accent, but she got my order right. The woman asked for spiciness level on a scale of 1 to 10, with one being really spicy. I was quite tickled by this method. Food arrived exactly an hour later as promised. There is a charge for delivery; I think it was six dollars or thereabouts. If paying by credit card over the phone, the delivery person will ask to see the credit card that you paid with along with a picture id. The dishes were good; nothing spectacular, but sufficient for a take-out. The seafood tom yum had very little seafood but quite tasty. The roast pork noodle was okay. Pad Thai was quite good, and so was the beef larb. Portions were good, neither too little nor too much. Thai iced-tea was delicious. The restaurant included Styrofoam bowls and plates, and plastic forks, knives, and spoons. They also did not skimp on the paper napkins, fortune cookies, and hot pepper sauce. All in all, a good take-out experience and I would definitely order take out from them again. For the four dishes, drinks, a side-order of steamed rice, and delivery charge, dinner was about fifty dollars.

8vWB-1Z97YFqkOr5UzDmig.text: I went to Kung Fu because I, and two friends, were in the mood for Thai Food around 10 pm, and that was the first restaurant we saw when we arrived in Chinatown.   We shared chicken satay and fried won ton as appetizers, and shared three entrees:  chicken with spicy garlic, sweet and sour pork and seafood pad thai.    Our waiter was new to the job and had to be urged to check with someone to give us information about the drinks at the bar (rather than just saying "I don't know" and leaving us with that) but he redeemed himself by returning with the owner, who explained the ingredients of the pina colada, and told us that the pina coladas and mai tais are the most popular bar drinks requested.  As far as cleanliness, the nasty-looking carpeting was a problem. I believe the furnishings were rather worn-looking as well, but the space is brightly lit and relatively spacious.  The decor was nothing to write home about; the place is basically a white box with decorative Thai art and dusty-looking travel posters on the walls.  But we came for the food, and I must say that everything was delicious.   For all of the above orders, a beer and a Pepsi, the bill came only to about $50, which isn't bad.  We all said we'd come back.

cOD4Ge5NDG3PtFt3Y54Wzw.text: One of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to.  Every time we're in town, we make sure to eat here at least once.  We've even ordered to go on our ride back to Cali a couple of times. This is what we usually order and have never been disappointed:  Papaya salad w/ salted crab - THE BEST Tom Yum Goong Pad Se Ew seafood Beef noodle soup House fried rice  Can't wait to go back in April!

qx0YBsunzLTA9fbYmQDLWg.text: yummm... we initially discovered this place randomly because we were sick of filling our tummies with buffet food - and what a wonderful surprise! cute LA-style asian food... spicy food (they have the usual 1-5? 1-10? scale and they don't mess around at the higher numbers!), decent portions (especially for thai restaurants) and extensive menu (can please just about everyone - including vegetarians!).   service is not that great, especially when they're busy (think 7pm on) and be wary of to go orders. we placed a to go order (albeit for 12 hungry girls), were told to stop by in half an hour, and we waited and waited... seemed like they don't cook it until you get there to pay.   our favorite dish - fried spicy cat fish... this is now part of our usual las vegas to-go spot (and my parents' too)!

fjX84HNWTUviNcJ6uZJdoA.text: SO and i hit for late lunch - we've eaten here ...at least 5 times - we focus on the thai food - they also have a nice lunch plate $5.55 - includes egg flower soup ( a little too thick ) a chicken wing, an egg roll ( ehhhh ) white or fried rice ...ok...and about 6 or so main entrees - i had the minced chicken w/ mint...tasty - overall a great deal at $5.   SO had a spicy noodle soup ( rice noodles ) - it had some bite !!  spicy bbq pork salad....we always get this dish - decent chunks of pork, a lime/cilantro dressing, red onions, greens - a little spice but very refreshing !!  we like this place

ljoo__iLhkE_Z9Hr_PoAQQ.text: I dunno, maybe I didn't order the right thing. The vegetarian selection had the standard dishes but the dish that caught my eye was the Mongolian tofu. We also ordered the fried spring rolls, papaya salad and a glass noodle soup.  The Mongolian tofu dish was deep friend tofu cubes which I normally LOVE, but it was soggy and oily. The 'mixed veggies'  with it were very sparse. The sauce was so-so.  The spring rolls and papaya salad were decent... no better than other places.  The veggie glass noddle soup was a load of noodles in a tasteless broth with lacking veggies.  P.S. I thought about a return visit to try other dishes but I would much rather go to Komols, Ping Pong, Hue Thai or Veggie Delight. Always good.

FBv_PEAINr2MgC8-q_HG4g.text: Have some late night in Las Vegas yesterday.  Just a wonderful staff and excellent tasty dishes.  I ordered Beef fried rice, chow fun, tom yum, and other side dishes.  Would definitely come back here.

syNlwTSx63wcR_UekzDWHw.text: I love this place, when I use to live in Vegas... every visitors I had, I would take them here to eat.  It's nothing fancy and since I use to be such a regular here, always good service.  The food is very delicous and I always leave this place satisfied.    Away from the strip and into china-town, this place is a little gem hidden at the corner of the street...... the portion size is great, and a family dining oriented restuarant that's able to seat large parties.  In general, the food is GOOD.

hLPEyoINMBpr7p31HRvCtQ.text: Wanted to try a restaurant in Chinatown while we were in Vegas.  This was our favorite - we love Thai food and this place is great.  The dishes are authentic. The Tom Ga Ghi Chicken/coconut soup was the best I have ever had.  The Garlic pork is fantastic.  The Panag Beef was so good we had to order a second plate.  Everything can be shared family style and everyone loved the dishes.  Will definitely come back when we are in Vegas again.

6s128qtt9JYR_Kywa_Y-rg.text: Kung Fu Plaza Restaurant is one of the first restaurants you see as you enter Las Vegas Chinatown from the strip. I can't stand the name of the restaurant, but the food is not too shabby. A few years ago, I thought this place was the bomb, but I think because of the combination of food we ordered, I left feeling underwhelmed. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't so spectacular either. This restaurant offers both Thai and Chinese cuisine.  Gotta have Tom Yum. We ordered the seafood. For 13 bucks, they didn't give us much soup, and the seafood was sparse, but it tasted alright.   The Pad Thai was decent. Kind of hard to mess up pad thai.  My sister ordered the Cashew Chicken. This was just an average dish.   The Pan-fried Catfish was everyone's favorite. The fish wasn't perfectly fried by a long shot, but the sauce was very good. I'm not sure why it says that the sauce is "curry like" on the menu, but it was a bit spicy, and the basil added fragrance. I love spicy!   Ok, let me tell you about this dish that hubby ordered. He has a history of ordering bad dishes. This was the Pa Nang Curry with Beef. It was like scooping a spoonful of peanut butter into my mouth. My mom said it was "so weird" in Vietnamese. It was.  Lots of photos and full review on my blog.

5enNM_qMt7zp9Z1x46NmDw.text: chicken pad thai was delicious   combination fried rice was yummy but a little oily  fried chicken wings was really crunchy but there was too much batter and it didn't really have a taste...you're supposed to use the dip but I didn't like it because it was too sweet  squid salad was so good, but a little spicy for a 7/10 spicy rating  tofu vegetarian curry was not good, it wasn't very flavorful  mango sticky rice was the best I've ever had  stir fry lo mein noodles with seafood was yummy   --  overall, if you're in the mood for greasy Thai food, this is awesome for $10-$15 a plate

1D2AIBVCYlQu51_oS4QIbg.text: A cornerstone of Chinatown in Las #Vegas Kung Fu Plaza ofers a chinese/thai menu with delivery offered in the nearby vicinity.  NOT a big fan of asian cuisine since its all rice,noodles and strange meats I tend to stay away but I played it safe with an appetizer combo,BBQ Pork fried rice and wor wonton  soup. Delivered to my door in 25 minutes for under $30!!  The fried rice was good but nothing special-very little pork and the rice was just ok. NO crunchy noodles for the Wor WonTon Soup when I requested them was a big downer:( The soup was really good however.  The appetizers were ok I could have ordered a dozen of the wings and been better off however!! The other stuff was forgettable even looking at the photo I cant rememeber what it was:(  Alot better places to try in Chinatown but you live you learn.

N8pqQ0mw5h6NJR19tHkglA.text: This place is pretty freaking good. Totally took me by surprise. I came for dinner and I will usually order pad see ew but since I was with a large group we decided to eat family style. Lucky me!  We ordered: Beef sate' Tom yum goong Tom kaa chicken Mint chicken Pork plik king Curry catfish of some sort Red beef curry I was very impressed with all the above dishes. In fact I came back the next day just to try the pad see ew, and that was also very good. Well balanced flavors with just enough kick for this westerner to get a good idea of what they are working with.  The Thai iced tea was also prepared very well and had way too much milk just the way I like it.  The only thing that was lacking was the interior was a bit dated. But im not here to eat the painting on the wall. Also the service was not as attentive as I would have liked. We had to wave down the waiter numerous times. And lastly the food is a bit more expensive than I expected.   But the food is very good. Kung fu may not sound like an authentic Thai food restaurant but damn the food is pretty good. So ignore the name and concentrate on the food. Positive note for next time: Looks like they have a full bar.  Food: A Service: C Price: B Overall: Solid B+  Now go eat and be merry!!!

GBzoiw1GVMdqsEwLCbyfiQ.text: We wanted to get rid of all the late night alcohol taste now so we can start fresh and drink some more later =). What can cleanse your palate better than a steamy bowl of spicy tom yum soup? Our Thai friend told us about this place and we were surprised how good the food was. My second time eating here and the business name still throws me off. Pretty authentic Thai dishes, which reminds me of a few spots in Thai Town, Krung Tedd and Hollywood Thai.   The waiter let us know up front that it's easier for them to add additional spicy than to remove it. We understand dude, haha, we can handle it.  Favorite: Tom Yum Soup - chicken or shrimp Crispy Pork with Basil and Chili Papaya Salad  Food - 4.5 stars Service - 4 stars: we had to flag someone down for more rice then later for our check. Parking - the parking lot stretches along Spring Mtn Restroom - 3 stars Wait - came during lunch time and were seated right away

iZ2ZKKORXWZDfyYpMlJ6DA.text: This place is like our Thai Food home. We have a party of 5 at least, and we visit them about once a month or more. Have always liked their food. Service depends on who you get as your server. But it's not like they are really bad. We once wanted one of our dishes kinda customized and the server helped us do it, and we had a great deep fried Calamari in butter sauce. Amazing!!! The food is always great, nothing to complain there. If you love Thai food and want a good authentic taste, this is a sure hot point!!!!

PI1B0XPtW_M0-gvHSOCcCg.text: simply the best chinese food we have found in las vegas area

5XICjU7Dvyy1UXav-iaDFg.text: I wasn't feelin' Thai food but after a weekend in Vegas, the one dollar sign was what attracted me most.  We had a group of 11 and the restaurant was able to seat all of us at one huge, round table.  We decided to order separately (instead of family style) and I shared with two others.  Between us three, we ordered:  -Tom Yum Soup (with Chicken): I specifically ordered "spicy", on a scale of 1-10....10!  It turned out, this Thai joint ain't no joke.  They really hit you with the hotness!  The spiciness I was fine with...but it was too overpowering and left the soup flavorless.  Next time, I'd probably order a 7.  I definitely recommend the Tom Yum Soup here because they give you an abundance of meat and mushrooms! -Pad See Ew (with Shrimp):  was decent, but they give you so much shrimp and it's such a good price that you can't not order this.  Our leftovers hopped on the car ride back to San Diego with us and we had it for a delicious dinner.  Two meals for the price of one?  I like.  Great tasting leftovers?  I love!

SRyP9vKn9_GwjlzvM2w7CQ.text: Food is good, portions are little, word of advice if you are going in a party of 4 or more ordering entrees each be direct and tell them you want your own rice in its own bowl. They will charge for extras and give you less rice altogether in a bigger bowl. Each entree comes with 1 cup of rice and charges for more if asked. Rice isn't that much more but $1.50 per extra cup but if you were to get your 1 cup in the first place you most likely wouldn't need a second cup. Overall food is ok.

5E3-Cadp-3sJdAUAQN4T4w.text: Had the lunch special orange chicken. It was really good. Came with one chicken wing, fried rice, egg drop soup and a veggie roll. The portion was just right for lunch.

fEsGStHoNnbGnzWvpG8iRg.text: A great place for lunch if you have a couple of hours to spare. This restaurant offers the best lunch specials for $5.99 which includes soup, a chicken wing and egg roll, rice and your entree...what else can you ask for? The staff is very friendly and are always keeping an eye on your table to make sure your glass is always full and your table is cleared of dirty dishes.  You can also try this place for dinner as they have quite an extensive Chinese and Thai food menu. However, if want to order off the regular menu, please make sure you bring someone with you because all the dishes are big enough to share.

7uIshutkzoUUuiZBsF9woQ.text: What a selection to pick from on the massive menu!  I usually call ahead for pick up, we like the General Tso's chicken and fried rice.  Always super quick and priced well.

ZK2kRTVW7F1ZA0sw1Ky3lQ.text: The food is sooooooo good, however their service isn't. Be prepared to wait... For a long time for any help. Lunch specials are only on weekdays. The chop chicken chili is my favorite, spicy level 8... Anything below isn't very spicy. The Mongolian beef spicy level 8 is also really good, as well as their Thai Teas. For quality of food though and variety this place is one of the best.

EbGklVDv-FOb7dj-c9bgsg.text: Enjoyed the Mongolian Beef based on a friends recommendation and was not disappointed.  Service was so outstanding the water in our glasses appeared full the whole meal.  Business has been around for 42 years and now I know why.  The owner greeted us halfway thru the meal and couldn't believe it was my first time to visit her establishment.  She informed me all dishes are made to order with an option on every dish of 1 to 10 on how spicy you like it.  You can definitely taste the difference in the pride and quality of the food and service.  Will be back again!!

S2YiYyqfsPRT_6o9I8759Q.text: Girlfriend and I decided to dine in since the Vietnamese place within the plaza was sporting an hour long wait, we might as well have just waited.   We enter and it's pretty busy, but no line at the door so it seemed like we were going to get decent service.  Damn man. We got seated and we were promptly brought water however we waited about fifteen minutes for someone to come by to take our drink and food order. After about twenty, a server finally came over and took everything at once.   After another fifteen minutes, still no drinks so I got up and asked where they were, and as soon as she brought the food is when we got our drinks. The food was decent, however we had to get up, travel to a dirty table, and get our own soy sauce. Also the portions were pretty small. I ordered the general tso chicken and she had the bbq pork wonton soup.  The food like I said, was decent. It's just the service was so awful I couldn't take it, I honestly considered just walking out. There were only about 4 servers on the floor and obviously they were very overwhelmed. The bussers were amazing though, they really hustled their asses off.   Next time hopefully the management staffs up for higher volume because I know this place has been in business for a long time and has great potential. Perhaps on a slower day we will check them out again if we are in the area.

kpsnYIypPPt4IqHOqbvzBw.text: Been eating here for how many years now. The food taste has always been consistent. The service though is kinda bad now. Not sure if the day we went to eat here they were short handed but we've been standing by the door, and workers were just passing us by. Not even acknowledging us. We still order take out most of the time here when craving for Thai food. 4 stars because I still love their food.

hBH9clPPLm257ZNQxFMFxA.text: Service was great and restaurant was clean. I ordered the usual dishes we get from the Thai spots. I must say the orange chicken was amazing, with fresh pineapple, orange and carrots. 3 of us ate for $35 and literally a short wait. I'll definitely be back when returning to Viva Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outrageously tasty Orange chicken.

wSTmZfhv3-ZqJA_6xBwUxQ.text: Only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because the food was good other than that, this was the worst service. Came here at 3pm and didn't get food until 45 mins later. There was no one there so it was not busy one bit. Our appetizers didn't come out first so we sat there starving the whole time and when we asked someone to check on our food, she never did. Our server was no where to be found. The pad Thai I ordered with a spicy level of 4 had no spice in it at all! Decided to ask for chili instead of waiting longer for them to remake it. I suggest ordering take out if you decide to eat from here. Not worth the wait and being put in a bad mood because the service is so shitty.

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only 2 people here and service was awful
Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There was no excuse as to why the service was so bad other than the fact that the servers did not care.

q_a23HYURg59Kfz2FngLSQ.text: It's been years since I've last eaten here. I took my Mom for a little lunch date. If you're vegan, they a wonderful variety of delicious dishes for you. The flavor was amazing. My go to is always the papaya salad, I always get it Laos style, a little spicy & they didn't not disappoint. When I go to other Thai restaurants, it's either too sweet, sour or salty. But, this one was just right. I would definitely recommend you give it a try !

kQG3ICzn-cDDj9m7cItvxQ.text: Hello,  Since I been in Vegas, my family has been coming here for almost 17 years. This time we came 06/16/2019, boy was it bad. First when we enter the restaurant nobody sat use. There was nobody there so it should of been fast. So we sat our selves and after 5 minutes my son got us our menu's. Then after 10 minutes, another couple came in and was seated and given menu's and ordered their drinks. So the same waitress came to us. Asked us are we ready to order. I said finally we can. It been ten minutes for you to get to us. She said it's ok if you can wait. My wife was no it not ok. This is the first time I had experienced this bad service here. I was already mad about it. Then when me, my and my two younger kids ran out of drinks nobody was refilling it. So, I got the waitress next to us and asked to refill my drink. When she came back and ask her to refill my sons. When she came back from that. I  asked her to refill my two kids drinks.  After we where done eating our meal. We asked for four boxs. So this lady start to put the food into our to go boxs and spilling our leftovers all over in from of me. I said I guess you are not getting any tip. Now the food we order was good. But for all of the services problems. I will not be recommending this place. Food is good but other places that good too.

a1WK9R85cITwRrNHaz7w_w.text: Food is the same. But what's different on today's visit was their AC seemed not to be working well. It is already scorching hot outside, the inside does not need to be freezing but at least cool enough for the customers.

abJkr6PMXU-vwfCPocZJVQ.text: Another China town local hot spot! I've gone here several times now and have always had a positive experience. The people who work here are not only friendly but usually quick about coming back to the table to check on you or clear plates. I've also never had to wait and the ambiance is a little more intimate than some of the other places nearby, such as Pho Kim Long (not that I have anything against that place).   As for the food, the portions are usually pretty big so I always recommend getting a few things and sharing "family style." One of my favorite dishes is the Chicken Satay. The sauce has a sweet flavor as well as the cucumber salad that comes with it. Delicious! Don't worry, if you aren't a fan of sweets or are trying to eat healthy they have plenty of tasty options such as a big plate of steamed vegetables! The menu is huge so there's definitely an option for everyone. Enjoy!

gw3wVgMUD2ip5CxPH-UptQ.text: If you read any reviews I leave you will quickly notice that I am a tough critic... I usually make it a point to warn people about bad restaurants and places to shop. But this place is WOW!  I have been by the restaurant but not inside (yet!). However, every-time I am in the area we get $100s of delivery. I must say everything is 5 STARS... the speed the food temperature the crispy and rich textures and fresh flavors are all there. Utensils dressings condiments taste homemade the packaging is handled with care and attention to details - the delivery driver is always positive and polite. We ordered here for Christmas for the whole family and they even threw in some surprise gifts for us.  I have nothing but positive things to say about this place and have shared it with most of my friends and family when we are nearby.  Thank you for great service KUNG FU THAI! Keep it up, see you again soon!

gnra-F2IxIntmWpL3XvyMg.text: We ordered the fried rice and the a spicy noodle I forgot the name it was very delicious.

VQaWGusSfNkgF7z6ZH716w.text: I went to visit China town off the strip and  found this Thai & Chinese combination restaurant.  The ambiance is a very rustic old Chinese setting. Service was pretty good, quick and servers follow up quickly. I ordered their lunch special Sweet and Sour Chicken it was not bad, but not really that good either. The price is great for what you get soup, chicken wing(was excellent btw) egg roll, rice and main entree for $7.50. For a quick lunch this place is ok. I'd actually give them a 3 1/2 stars but thats not an option.

nZUdwOWTPYMP6bJdqNkcDQ.text: The food here is always pretty good but I usually order it to go. The service isnt very good, it takes them too long to come take your order and even longer to bring the check and the staff isn't all that friendly.  I usually order the Tom yum soup, its probably my favorite dish.

3lRZ1bGPdQIcJkJ6IJDh0A.text: The food was excellent  The service was good  The prices are very affordable  I recommend you get off the Vegas Strip and visit a local restaurant. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends.

Service was slow, but it was also Mother's Day and they were busy. The food came fast after they got our order. They were all alright. OkGaIGhBYd_8q2pB_xs75g.text: My husband & I came here after a weekend of fun of Vegas. This was our last stop before a long drive home. We had their lunch special and it was an exceptional price, delicious food and excellent service. We didn't wait very much, which helped, since we were starving. Its about a mile away from the end of the strip, but definitely worth the drive.

lIcMIHCf1W6rQF-0-Kwo2w.text: This is my THAI go to spot!! We've been coming here for over 2 years and have never had a bad experience. Food is always delicious and fresh! We are regulars so the staff know what we want as soon as we walk in!  Chicken Fried Rice, Tom Yum Chicken Soup ( no spicey) , and Kung pao Chicken all under $40 and it feeds 4 people.  They also have a Coconut Tom Yum soup, I'm not a fan of it, but my friends love it! I wish they'd close later, being that they are in China town many places are open late, if wish they stayed open later! Definitely a place to check if your ever craving Thai!
