ztuQPoT_kyNkCNgt5k4dLA.text: This place has THE best Thai food in Nevada and California!  Everything here is done just to my liking.  The chefs just must be trained well.  My favorites:  pad thai with prawns; ong choy; minced chicken with garlic and basil (it's called mint, I think, but it's basil); Tom Yum soup; green papaya salad (though I like to order it with less sauce and salt, sometimes it's too saucy and salty).  This family-owned restaurant is run by a nice family and Mrs. Wang always says hi to me when she sees me.  I sure am missing this place because I haven't found a Thai place I like in the Bay Area yet.

Lpehirf1iu-a4VCakfF7CA.text: I can only rate the Thai part of the menu, which was good. Nothing that stood out as spectacular, but good. Be warned that their idea of "medium" spice is pretty spicy! We heard others at the table next to us saying the same thing.

TYb_wUnjm9AAi7rDow2C4w.text: My Fav Thai/Chinese restaurant in Vegas! Such a variety of food to choose from. There's even a vegetarian menu. Tofu Satae is my favorite appetizer. It comes with toast & a cucumber salad.

-A0-1UfzPOT8BMM3p3RTqA.text: We live in California, so we don't get to eat at this restaurant often. When ever we in Las Vegas, we make sure we stop by at least once before we come home.  We loved the Boat Noodle, Beef salad they the best

cPVa13usTurkkU_zospNng.text: Pretty good food at decent prices and relatively large portions. Been to Kung Fu several times and would definitely go back. Go give this place a try it isn't the best but it is pretty good and cheap.

e9jMLe4hSGBcS2c0CnGRSw.text: I have gone to this Thai restaurant on almost everyone of my Vegas trips, which have been plenty. You have not had Thai pho until you've had it here. Very authentic. They never disappoint me on any of the dishes I've ordered. This last time I was there I didnt see my normal waiter, I'm not sure whether it's changed hands or not. I ordered to go and the food was a little different, still good tough, plus I didnt see the usual waiter in there that remembers me the 2-3 trips a year that I'm there. Regardless still one of my fav Thai restaurants.

hCif3Jqb5wcKS61qvywGqQ.text: Edit:  I don't like this place anymore!  Last experience- the shrimp pad thai was really blah, had no shrimp in it so I had to ask for some, and came with fried rice which I didn't even want (and so less pad thai).  Also service was really slow for lunch.  It's such a huge room too, you just don't get the kind of personal service that you can get somewhere else, like Prommares.

wQVnQVGHR0FU2oE2w7bllA.text: I've eaten here twice, and the first time I thought that I really liked it, but that must have been because I was still intoxicated...It is Vegas after all! On my second time back here, I had the duck noodle soup and tom yum soup again, and DAMN were they OILY. I felt like I was just drinking luke warm oil. The pad thai and the curry I had we're just okay. I don't think I'll be coming back here, I didn't feel so good after eating here... Look elsewhere and don't let other drunken people convince you it's good.

HyJ5VrCNnGhNK3f_QO80jg.text: Thai and Chinese. . . had the minced beef soup, fish cakes, pad see ew and pineapple fried rice.  Huge portions and a nice break from the buffetts or the super pricey casino restaurants.  The decor can use some improvement however the food satisifed my craving for Thai in Vegas.

aO9gHHsxLLAgIsUQOCqmzw.text: Been here a few times while in town.  Usually get the typical Thai dishes when I come here w friends.  The papya salad, lad nah seafood, half an order of duck and chinese broccoli.  Looking forward to trying other things on their menu, but so far...so yummy!

Mr__b46DPwNUzfxfi7_P1A.text: Usually get good service, but not all the time. I sat there 15 minutes today at lunch with my wife and watched 3 tables come in after us, and all order. Meanwhile we sat there with water and no menu's, and no orders taken from us (drinks or food). We had enough after table 4 came in and ordered. We just left, having only tried the water (and still no one noticed us)! There was only 5-7 tables in the whole place at the time!

8y6cvnK8fimluRU_kWvwIQ.text: With a previous night of drunken debauchery in Sin City - Vegas we leave our beautiful suite at Palazzo and look for some good sober-up yet cold-weather warming food. Votes in - and THAI food it is! But where? So I remember heading out to Chinatown in a prior visit to Vegas a couple months back at Kung Fu! CHEAP, GOOD, and did I mention...GOOD! So 15 minutes later we're there and were seated promptly. Luckily, it was already after lunchtime  so we didn't encounter any wait time.  We all chose to order dishes and share the portions. Tom Yum (HOT - of course), Pad Thai, some beef salad, and shrimp fried rice!  The guys were digging the food but like myself, they agreed the service was aiiiiight! Could have been better (hence the 4 stars). SO - if you're in vegas and have a hankerin' for some Thai/Chinese (good decent and reminiscent of SGV style) hit Kung Fu up! It'll make you say...."HAAAAY YA!" LOL!

-kZRG9eSwvZMSbRuFnz24g.text: My friends and i always come here on our trips to vegas. It's almost a tradition. You can get great food at decent prices.  We don't like to eat all our meals by the strip.  It gets way too pricey.  We usually order the chop chicken with basil and the crispy pork. It's very similar to stuff i can find in LA if i want a taste of home, but different enough that i still find it special.

XoOwxAKyJgcdmuAyDkYkPw.text: Was looking for some good chinese to feed a hungry crew after a convention in Vegas.  The hotel recommended Kung Fu so we figured ok we'll give them a try.  WOW!  They were so friendly on the phone, very helpful with directions.  The food was great and everyone was really satisfied at the end of the meal.  They were very accomodating with plates, forks, napkins, and even provided serving spoons which was really nice.  Why not 5 stars?  I had called about 45 minutes ahead.  When we arrived to pick up the food at the agreed upon time, it quickly became apparant that they hadn't even started preparing it yet.  I think they didn't believe we wer going to actually show up.  So we had to wait about 30 minutes, which was kind of a drag.  Other than that, great experience and I would definitely recommend this place, and go back if the opportunity presents itself on a future trip to Vegas.

m4jjvM0l93hhwdGMUxbQ0A.text: Note: This is a review on my take-out only experiences with this restaurant. (4 in total)  Kung Fu Plaza brands itself as a Chinese-Thai eatery, but my experience has been that its Chinese dishes do not taste authentic at all.   The chicken noodle soup is extremely oily, to the point of being inedible. I had ordered this for a sick friend, and was quite unhappy about its quality. The wonton soup is much better, but nothing above the ordinary. The hot and sour soup is nowhere near the regular Szechuan version that you would expect - this one is orangey-yellow. The chow mein is passable, but your best bet is probably the thai curries, which are quite tasty, and as a plus, taste good as leftovers.  What I do like about them is their cheerful and quick service.

uvaNrwOpaoIVmcC6_avayw.text: This restaurant was recommended by a Vietnamese gal who worked in a nail salon...we wanted Chinese food so we tried it.  The food was great, service very good and a very ethnic feel to it...many Asians eating there so we felt that was a good recommendation too.  It was great and we'll go back.

jFDD1wdaRcV7Kz34VmH3Ig.text: After driving around in search of a Chinese restaurant, we decided on this place. This place is hood!! It's extra ghetto inside with the worst service ever. I really can't complain though when the dishes are soo cheap. The food just wasn't good. In fact, I would say it's pretty disgusting. I ordered a broccoli and chicken dish, and the chicken wasn't fresh at all. I was actually scared to eat the meat!! Everything inside was sticky, dusty and dirty. They definitely need a makeover with the decor, food and service.

3J67IHJ6WiNdrQHYjPem5A.text: Me and my husband were staying at stratosphere, and i was craving chinese food and unfortunately, stratosphere did not serve chinese food .  I was looking thru the las vegas phone book and found them, I was skeptic but tried it anyways because they delivered. The food was good. My husband and I liked the shrimp fried rice and their pad se-ew was yummy.

CrFkgSMKFzQcAcdT5k9spA.text: Having a craving for Thai food in Vegas once again, my friend recommended yet another she was familiar with. So far, I think you can't really go wrong as pretty much all the Asian restaurants I've been brought to has yet to disappoint me. This place was no different.  It's one of the typical informal Asian restaurants you'll find in Chinatown....dated decor and nothing 5 star about it. That's fine as these places are frequented for the food and not the decor. Not to say there isn't any atmosphere as there's hodge podge of Thai and Chinese antiques and motifs.  Like most Asian restaurants, it's probably best to go in larger groups as there are so many dishes to try and the portions are quite generous. Since it was just my friend and I, we just ordered the fish cakes, Pad See Ew (fried flat rice noodles) and the Pad Wan Sen (fried clear noodles). The flat rice noodles was pretty good, but just a bit sweet for my taste. I had actually ordered the fried clear noodles which were quite delicious. However, I had just had this this dish at another Thai restaurant a few days ago, and the other restaurant's taste edges out this one a bit in terms of taste quality. Still good though, and a good sized plate of noodles. The fish cakes were not too bad either, but for some reason parts of it were dry or hard to the chew.   For a good Thai and Chinese restaurant both in one, and not too far from the strip, then this is definitely a place I'd come to again. Service was good (likely because it wasn't a busy time of day), good sized portions, and the food was worth the money. The other Thai restaurant I really enjoyed was a good 4-5 miles from the strip in a suburban strip mall, and probably a bit too far from the strip to venture out to, unless you have a car and GPS. This place is convenient.

3G2BE0KKV7fZIOo2agSyuQ.text: Delicious and timely but I ended up sick the next day! Watch out on the seafood options.

Zdq18NcBcMmODRRza9ntUA.text: Fast service and food. Decent prices.   Ordered the crispy pork and chinese broccoli, fried catfish, beef dish, and tom yum soup. They were all good, standard food.

They finally let me use it and what's funny is that nothing was unclean and also after making a slight scene one of their workers suddenly decided to roll a mop bucket toward the restrooms at that time.  Unsure what all that was about it but I suggest any and all of Vegas and visitors to never patronize this place.

Df_1IwTuN9VlCLloP7IQ2A.text: Cant deny food is amazing service is horrible!  Always a wait even when slow n called in they'll say 15 when really 30 for to go takes forever for someone to acknowledge but price is good and food I'd great when correct

mkvUpi4rNtM9ly1JeLyjOQ.text: Food was excellent and the delivery was fast.  Definitely will order again.  If you like Chinese food this is the place to get it from.  The reviews on the general chicken were spot on.

ulDsZn7sDB3bG_uLn8msMg.text: I like this place. Service is fast and the food is good. They have a great variety of Asian styles. I like their lunch specials which are really cheap and you get a lot for what you pay for. I come here twice a month.

vMrlgzuzwtEFVWvDODyoag.text: I have been to Thailand and i have tried everything from street foods to gourmet dining and bizzare foods. If you want to try the favorites like yellow curry, gree, red or Panang, pad thai, pad prik, pad se ew or thai chicken, spicy catfish basil...... These guys have it all and it is the closest tasty thai cultural food you can eat if you miss it back home in Thailand. Staff is friendly, a little slow on service at times since some servers are not always at their side to serve their tables but the food is exceptional and still brings me back. I usually take mine to go. Kung Fu also serves chinese so yes you will also find duck in the menu.

Pgu16EfQCap4qpdVvyZkvA.text: There were plenty of seating, nice decorations, and service was fast.  The reason why I took off a star is the portion size are a little on the small side. Between the 7 of us, we ordered about 5 different dishes with extra rice and usually at most places, it's enough but not here.  The pad thai, green curry, and papaya salad were delicious. I was satisfied with the taste of the food. My taste buds were giving me high fives. I believe this is primarily a Thai restaurant so get Thai dishes and NOT the Chinese. One of the stir-fry dishes we ordered was meh.

XB0C27Kp1myBJ_JIEvKWVA.text: Got to say we love this place. Every time we are in Vegas we have to stop by. You really can't go wrong with their food.  We ALWAYS get the Tom Yum seafood combo soup, Pad see Ew, beef salad, and sweet and sour pork.    Sweet and sour pork is different. They deep fry the pork and give you a side dipping sauce. Deliciousness!

yZ44EVjluBCwnjJAXVPsoQ.text: Solid three stars over all, although 2/3 of he dishes we had were closer to four stars.  We had a 1/4 of duck, crispy spicy catfish and a Thai shrimp salad.  More than enough food for two, with leftovers  to take home.  The catfish dish was great, and the salad very good.  We ordered them at a 5/10 spice level which was a moderate and very manageable spice level.  The duck was not bad, it was somewhat more of a steamed than roast duck although the skin was crispy, possibly tasted steamed because it was set in a watery cabbage base, and the homemade sauce they had for the duck was excellent.  The duck did definitely need the sauce because it lacked flavor otherwise.  This dish was over all more of a three than a four because the duck didn't taste out of this world fresh, but then neither did it taste old and freezer burn like the duck you might get at many Asian restaurants.  (Good duck is hard to come by at any restaurant, since it is typically frozen.)  We also had a nice large pot of tea, more than enough for two.  Service was a little spotty, at times they were right there, at other times such as when we needed extra napkins, was hard to flag anyone down.  Restaurant was fairly busy on a Thursday night.  Over all an enjoyable experience at reasonable prices, and we would go back.

FG1s0enUffHMK3Nt5fbWeA.text: We have been going this restaurant for couple years. Most the time we order same things  few days ago we went there took my friend from out of states ( he said worst Chinese) The food was awful  Stir fry Chinese broccoli leaf was over cooked  Orange shrimps was so sweet like eating dessert shrimp lol  Papaya salad was no taste ( can't taste the lime etc) Singaporean noodle was soggy, they didn't charge that dish after all  And we got female server wasn't friendlier like guys server. I think we're not going back to that restaurant anymore. Several good Chinese and Thai in Vegas so far.

sjSrNeZ2QcmLdu6Wx5_EGA.text: Literally the best orange chicken I have ever had yet! The combination of orange and pineapple that the sauce has just gives the orange chicken a nice sweet and tangy taste!! It's delicious!!! The service was great we were greeted by 3 different waiters, which I personally liked because everyone attended to us precisely. This is my second time dining at the establishment. My first time was through take out and the food stayed perfectly delicious the entire car ride home. I will definitely come back for more!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Chicken  Combination Pad Thai

bP-khL0B_0q-fMbRBasK6Q.text: Where to begin... first off, I haven't been to Kung Fu for a while because of the last bad experiences with them. This place was my favorite place to eat thai food but their customer service hit rock bottom.  Me and my family came in and dined in on Saturday, June 8, 2019 around 8:30 p.m. with five people including myself. We sat the left side, the bar side. We ordered many dishes, they were: - Thai Coffee - Beef Pad See Ew - Chicken Pad Thai - Small Shrimp Fried Rice - Chicken Satay - Beef Papaya Salad - Chicken Green Curry  I was absolutely shocked the cleanliness of the table was dirty before we sat. I had to ask our server to clean the table before our food comes because it was sticky. Seriously! Who wants a sticky table right?  All the foods were very delicious, no complaints on that. But the service was bad. We had to ask many servers for napkins and yet no napkins. Even asked one of the manager, didn't even dare get it. One of us had to grab the napkins from their pantry.  If you want good thai cuisine with good service and cares about their customers, especially if they are a LOCAL, I recommend to eat somewhere. I have been a local for over 20 years in Las Vegas and this used to be my favorite thai place to eat and have a good Thai dining experience. All well, there's more places I can explore.

h_ehEbNS4c645AqRoDu5dg.text: I LOVE this place . It is a regular for our big family dinners . The staff is great . They are always nice , fast and efficient. The portion sizes are big and the prices are good . Our regular order consists of bbq pork fried rice , Shrimp Tom Yum soup and Thai fried chicken wings . The food never ever disappoints . The fried rice is always perfect ! The Tom yum soup is hands down the best Tom soup in town . Last but not least , the Thai fried chicken wings are extra crispy and served with some delicious sweet chili sauce . Oh and don't forget the  Thai iced tea .... so yummy ! Please do yourself a favor and come here . You will not be disappointed .

L4Nc3v9M8gokN7cW5otUOA.text: My coworker suggested this place for lunch, and I was pleasantly surprised. It's got some nice decor, but the atmosphere is calm with soothing music. It is not frenetic during lunch like many places in Chinatown. The menu is MASSIVE and includes options from both Thai and Chinese cuisine. Also, good deal on lunch specials. I ended up trying their panang curry with chicken. Very flavorful, but be warned: very spicy! In general, panang curry paste tends to be mixed with chili so it usually runs hotter than other curries. But I can usually handle it. I added no extra spice, and my mouth was burning! So, naturally, I needed to cool off with some mango & sticky rice for dessert. That was delicious! All in all, cool, chill place. A bit slow on service, but otherwise they are very nice and go the extra mile to pack your food to go.

1QntmS9WE2KQ2DjZDI4S8Q.text: I love Thai food! So I tried this place that my friend been talking so much about. It's tucked away on the left side of the building on the corner of Valley View and Spring Mountain in Chinatown. It's a good size restaurant with a lot of tables and we were seated fairly quickly. Our waitress wasn't very friendly and we just got seated and didn't get a chance to look at the menu and she wanted our order already. She came back in a few minutes and I had questions about an entree and she really couldn't answer my questions. Other wait staff was really good in their service. So we ordered Fried Shrimp Rolls| Panang Yellow Chicken Curry w/ Zucchini| Jumbo Shrimp w/ Mixed Vegetables| Larb w/ Chicken. For dessert we had the Thai style Mango with sweet sticky rice and coconut cream which was really good. My favorite was the Panang curry chicken. Everything else was good.

3nq3WgcqcgvuKrfGfPfXyA.text: First time I've been back in about 2 years and things have gone SERIOUSLY down hill... I have been coming to this place for years, It offers a "Chinese" Menu and a Thai Menu... My mom ordered off the "Chinese" Menu which is totally what I call "Mall Chinese" think Panda Express (It has always been like this) and I ordered off the Thai Menu which used to offer some of the most traditional Bangkok Style Thai Food in Las Vegas....OH MAN SOOOO BAD!!!! Mom's Jumbo Prawns in Lobster Sauce came with 6 SMALL shrimp and Piles of Green Peppers and Carrots... My Deep Fried Tofu with Black Mushrooms bizarrely and inexplicably came with a HUGE pile of carrots on top (Did they get an amazing deal on cheap carrots this week???) and ABSOLUTELY NO FLAVOR...Luckily there was soy sauce on the table... Having read some of the other reviews from people who have been coming here for years and have had a similar experience it is sadly obvious that this establishment has had a change of philosophy (and of Chef!) and has decided to survive for the time being on their reputation while completely sacrificing the quality of their food...I for one will never be back...

Nx6jKm524BhtZffteyeKrA.text: I'm going to keep this review short, yet precise...we (3 of us)were seated quickly, got our waters, placed our food order (waitress was nice & helpful), then it all went downhill: 1.  Had to flag down someone to refill water several times 2.  Waited 40 minutes for our entrees.  Watched other parties who arrived after us get their food. We flagged down someone to check on our food and they said it's coming.  My husband was so pissed after the 3rd "it's coming" that he got up walked over to a waitress in asked for the check to pay for our apps.  As he's headed back to the table (smoke spewing from his nostrils upset) our food food mysteriously appears.  He tells them he doesn't want it and explains why.  The waiter has the nerve to say "we were holding these until you finished your apps before bringing out the main dishes!"  We had wontons and egg rolls for apps, it doesn't take 40 min. to eat those, plus he lied!  The  food was piping hot so they weren't holding anything.  The wait staff isn't coordinated at all.  They're all over the place around there.  3.  The food: glass noodles with chicken #189: I asked for spicy, it was bland but decent flavor.  I would order again when this place get their act together!  Drunken noodles #184:  not enough noodles.  Get rid of the bed of lettuce on the bottom of the plate.  What's the point? To absorb the obsessive amount of liquid is my theory.  Flavor was okay, but no spice...we requested spicy! Jumbo shrimp fried rice: bland, flavorless, and they forgot the spice AGAIN!  Disappointing especially after a 40 minute wait! 4. Payment:  we give the waitress (a different one again) the credit card.  She asked for an ID, no problem.  She doesn't walk towards the register, instead she stands next to our table and stares down.  She stares at the credit card way too long!!!I finally asked her if something was wrong.  She said she's just checking the name.  It doesn't take 5 minutes to check if the names are the same.  Don't stare at someone's card here in Vegas like that.  Looked like she was trying to memorize the credit card #!!  Would I go back? No, not any time soon.  This is the 2nd time I've had terrible service here.  I was forgiving the 1st time.  The menu has 1000 items (no exaggeration), maybe the should slash the menu and focus more on the customer service and over dining experience.

Rq-aOV--vrjhL44zGQgq7w.text: Broccoli with crispy pork! Yaaaaaas! Oh my the pad Thai is decent...it's missing True Pad Thai flavor and wrong noodles ... I've had  better in Cali.

0xZpA9Ya74JXvDucAh8URw.text: Drove around for half hour trying to find a spot to eat because all the popular spots were still closed and was skeptical because of the rating BUT DAMN. This place is pretty good and they have a $7.50 lunch special that is more than worth it. Definitely worth checking out when in Vegas. The food on the strip is way over priced

BN0fvzGjpnCEXZMIV8INYA.text: Sooo... I'm new to the neighborhood and I'm on a mission to try all the Asian restaurants near me.. this is the 2nd one and I was definitely anticipating it, but actually ended up a little disappointed.  The pictures I've attached look way better than how the food tasted.   First off, the service here was great!!  I ordered take out and the phone service and in restaurant service was exceptional!    Once home, my friend and I had the same thoughts about the food... 1. Tom Kha Shrimp soup was too spicy!!  Also, another veggie or two would have been better.. it was a lot of soup with just 9 shrimp and some mushrooms.  And the tails left of the shrimp make it a pain to eat easily.  2. Orange Chicken was not good.. it is very heavily breaded and seemed like it had been fried in old grease...the sauce was very liquidy and had a weird flavor.  3.  Bok Choy Chicken tasted alright, but was also very liquidy... it basically shrunk down due to the heat, so it was a small portion floating in water.  4. Combination Chow Mein was the best thing of the group.. the cabbage is very flavorful and putting together noodle, cabbage, pork kinda created the perfect bite!  5. Egg Rolls have absolutely no flavor at all... like none... nada.  Overall, for the price... I won't be going back.  The 1st place I've tried in the neighborhood was better and I'm guessing I'll run across others that appeal to me more.  And maybe I just tried this place on a bad night, because other reviews seem to love it... I dunno.. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VOUWuBVl1R8KltoOFxNnPQ.text: I came in with a friend who recommended this restaurant. It has to be the best Thai food I've ever had.

aSC54P10NeN4mqArmX3qsw.text: They have good salted fish fired rice, pad Thai and Thai hot pot. HOWEVER, the restaurant temperature is like 85-90F compare to outside 105F.   You would get wet by sitting starting 30 mins, I can't believe the owner's trying to save electricity cost  I could have given 4 stars but 1. Losing 1 star for unpleasant temperature inside the restaurant 2. The dinner towel is SO DIRTY so we asked for paper napkins!!  Be aware coming to this restaurant as the above :)

nDOyv6i_9nRfn_HKx8IPVg.text: Best Pad Thai I've ever had including the one from Thailand!! The interior was dim and seemed bit old, but both food and service were outstanding. I loved how staff were having pleasant conversations with customers like old friends here and there and exchanging hand shakes.  The portion was big enough for us to take away half. If you want an authentic Thai experience, I recommend this place!

zgvuHVZ6rO5xUMG0bIeBkA.text: I came here on the recommendation of a friend. The menu had a large selection. I ordered a Thai iced tea, pad thai, and pineapple fried rice. The environment looked all right, you could tell it was kind of old. First things first, the Thai tea was like any other place, lot of ice not enough tea. For the Pad Thai, it felt like whoever was cooking it did not stir it enough to mix the sauce and noodles. Then there was the pineapple fried rice which was too oily for my own taste. I did not try the other items on the menu, they might be better. I will definitely not be coming back even though prices are low, the menu is huge and the service was ok. There are better Thai restaurants in Las Vegas. With Vegas becoming more and more of a food hot spot, I hope the restaurant adapts to the more important concepts of presentation, cleanliness and building a specialty.

3AUtoQK7Z6LDYm_k83hi2Q.text: What a HUGE menu to choose from.  If you like Chinese Food and they don't have your favorite dish on the menu you must be into 'specialty dishes.'  The portions were perfect.  The food tasted great! The service (just after lunch) was attentive.  We will definitely be back here to try more of the menu.

3cde9U9Qb3xYXqSRoCoxVQ.text: Best Chinese restaurant in vegas!   I'm a local and have tried tons and tons of Chinese restaurants to only be disappointed.   This restaurant is amazing and has a little something for everyone. The service amazing and very quick!   I love a place where you don't have to ask for refills they keep them coming!!  Very traditional tasting food!   I'm addicted already and can't wait to go back!   Would recommend everyone giving this place a try you won't be disappointed!!!

Q67zdOiPoUs-BHElIMbUyw.text: Parking is outrageous. You can never find any spots in the plaza.   When you drive by this restaurant, you might think it is deserted since the inside looks VERY dark. BUT don't be mistaken. The inside is lowly lit and is usually packed with people.  Thai and Chinese food all in one place? What more could you ask for? I was surprised by how friendly and understanding the waiters were.   It was SO windy and freezing cold outside. The woman noticed how frenzy-looking we looked and made us feel as comfortable as possible at our table.  The dishes are less expensive than most Thai places. Be careful when you order the Papaya Salad! It is SUPER spicy. I couldn't eat anything else  for awhile after eating that first. Everything tasted PERFECT. Wish they served more on the plates though.   You don't often get dessert at restaurants without having to pay. Turns out, you get FORTUNE COOKIES. Also, we forgot to sign our receipt, and a man came running out of the restaurant to tell us that. That's how dedicated you know these staff members are.

xVEMAQfIPKBcz3KR_rb9DA.text: Best spicy catfish in town, pud prig king is a bomb and the best part is ice water is soo good,  (waiter said 4 filters filtration)

wQmpwUxdBaZ9xpeL4lc-mA.text: This place has great food, and decent service.  But it was deaaaaaaad, at 9pm on a Friday.  It is a medium sized restaurant (maybe 20-30 tables?), and about 60% of the tables were unoccupied.    I'm sorry, but when the restaurant is so empty, you can't help but wonder whether you made a good choice, even if the food tastes wonderful.  Maybe we just picked an off day.

nRm6WSZW8joKtw1tTGe75g.text: After reading the good reviews I decided to give it a try.  Nice ornament and decoration... that is the only thing I like about this place.  I ordered from the Thai side of the menu, but very very plain, so plain that I don't even remember what I ordered.

F4Sc2tV4rRMRuSCfONoqRg.text: Been going to this little hole in the wall for years. Ongchoi with crispy pork a must try. Stuffed chicken wing iv not had better in town. Feels like a mom and pop joint. In this case looks can be deceiving dont judge this book by its cover. Thai food the right way.

ZXbJUtNnShY8XaZS7qmM1g.text: Very disappointing.  This restaurant's Thai food was excellent four years ago, but has been going down steadily since then.  Now much of their Thai food tastes like bad Chinese food.  (I've traveled extensively in both countries, and I know the difference.)  Today their Thai seafood mint combo was barely edible, and their Thai mixed vegetables was hardly better.  Noodle salad was only average.  My wife, who is Chinese, said the Thai food tasted like bad Americanized Chinese food - so salty she had to eat it with a lot of rice and three glasses of water (which saltiness is not typical of True authentic Thai).  It's a shame this formerly excellent restaurant has careened downhill.

ZVTwjO_WPQu-CNg4f05YGA.text: The food was well prepared and fresh. Service was slow enough that it almost cost them a star.

pXzVEoiWUIonJ_st3dBiFQ.text: Tried this place for the first time tonight based on the other yelp reviews. I am so disappointed because I was expecting their menu to have basic chinese dishes like crispy house noodles, crispy duck, honey walnut shrimp, and bbq pork. Everything I wanted was not available or was altered from what I was used to. We ended up ordering chicken chow mein, kung fu duck and orange chicken. The chow mein was oily and reminded me of the chow mein you get at the fast food mall food court. The duck was good, wished that it was crispy. The orange chicken was overcooked and somewhat burnt. It contained mostly batter. A problem we had was that we ordered the duck quarter size because it was just my husband and I and they ended up giving us the half size. We thought it was big but we were hungry and no one came to check on us for us to let them know. We never realized it was half until we got the check and we already ate half so we just paid for it without complaining because it took them almost ten minutes to grab our payment. This is definitely a place I will not be coming back fo chinese again.

fAj3sCYvpoNJAsZtbfpGHw.text: Had a Tom type of soup with coconut milk that was really fantastic.   Tried #31 which was very good glass noodle dish with a dressing and meat shrimp and scallops. The chinese dish we tried was more bland but very good. The help was nice and service was pretty quick for our late lunch. I'd go back and recommend to a friend.

2Jqwrqwk6zJgN_oLLDHBZQ.text: Yes, this place is as good as it gets. All our friends come in from out of state and always want to come back to Kung Fu's for their wonderful food. Always a great food experience. The staff is exceptionally attentive. A must try!

bKkeAgdMrUOwQUj1hqtzdw.text: The name doesn't sound like a good/authentic Thai place. But I have to admit this place served the best Thai I had ever had. I had tried Thai in many places such as Toronto, London (UK), Malaysia, Hong Kong, Singapore - this is by far the best Thai!! We ordered Mango salad, Tom Yum Soup and Pineapple Fried Rice. We ended up finishing everything on the table! I will go back to Vegas one day just for this restaurant!

5CITGyqqqaJBdGBw2JJVXQ.text: No romantic dinner or lunch.Great place for Pad Thai,chicken fried rice,sweet&sour soup,curry dishes.TOM YUM soup is perfect.I spent about 5 years around Thailand...This is good food.Place looks old,but very clean.You can tell by the cleanliness of the restroom.

ND7HZlxk0zvNofxiwp9owg.text: Food a solid 4 stars, leaning higher.  Excellent tom yum seafood, fried chicken wings, and a plethora of vegetarian entrees with great variety.  Service a bit slack, and DANGER! the bar is *terrible* (we were served a watery margarita and an undrinkable bloody mary) so stick to bottled beer!

q9s6USNAOXpmxEJdKSJ4Pg.text: Awesome authentic Thai food!!  We tried several dishes and every single dish was excellent!!  Every time I'm in Vegas and craving some Chinese or Thai food this place really is able to satisfy my craving. We also ordered for delivery one of the times and they delivered to our hotel on the strip for only $5 delivery charge.  They even deliver it to the door step of your hotel room!  Sooo worth it especially when the cab ride back and forth to our hotel is like $20.

LakhxMmEquRI-8IsgKi3rQ.text: I live in NLV and was in the area. I figured Chinese food in Chinatown had to be good.  There was a lot of people waiting outside but when we went in to ask how long the wait was we were told a few minutes.  We got lucky because everyone else who came in after us were ignored.  We were seated about 15 minutes later then ignored.  Someone came up with menus after we were seated for about 5 minutes then no one came back.  The people around us who had been seated after us had water and their orders taken.  I finally grabbed a busboy and asked him to get me a waiter.  The waiter finally showed up and we ordered appetizers as well as dinner.  My daughter ordered soup for dinner which even though it was obvious that's all she was getting,  they brought it with the drinks then the appetizers came after about 30 minutes then our dinner almost immediately.  I had the Mongolian beef which was small but the meat was good.  I think the food would have been better if I didn't have such a bad taste in my mouth from the service - or lack thereof.

QjRB0Adx6I9axWrew1MTOw.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat. The food is so good. Everything you order is great. The menu is huge. I like to order the Thai fried chicken wings that come with a sweet chili sauce. The pad Thai is always a winner. Tom yum goong, chicken chili mints and fresh egg foo young are sure to make you happy. I also love their Thai tea, it's the bomb. Service is good also, they pack up your leftovers for you to. It's a pretty popular place. Try it out and you will not be disappointed.

KAooQP-pF6aiak0YphNMKw.text: Don't ever try their wonton noodles , it tasted exactly like the instant wonton noodles except that it was worse.

wOaY67SNTU4FnIP_BALlRA.text: I always order the beef with brown sauce. Very yummy! And their combination fried rice is also very yummy!!!

3M0drw29J1WniSygInk7Ew.text: Came here around 9 and it was sorta empty on a Saturday night or maybe people were celebrating chinese new year?  Anyways, service was slow when there was only 4 tables that were being served.   Ordered the medium tom yum soup with big flat noodles ( loved it!!!!)  Beef fried rice- the beef taste burnt but the fried rice was good.  Last- tofu with basil.  Soggy and was drenched in too much garlic sauce!  (not that great!)  I've been here 3x and the more I come here, the worst the food gets!  It's better to come here for the soup only!

sy-r6XtE5XvokZZY63MrKA.text: Awesome $6.00 lunch specials. I was a little disappointed when I found there was no garlic and papper chicken but was quickly amazed at how delicious the chopped chicken was. They give you a lot of food so you won't leave hungry!!

tTBgNhfAnwrm5vLuKjiBng.text: This place is a hit or miss, I have to admit, because it's a 50-50 chance of liking a dish if I order blindly off the vegetarian menu. But when I visit Chinatown, I know I'm having lunch here. Why, you ask? For the veggie pad thai, of course! It's the best! The service is good. I dream about you, veggie pad thai... in the night, and during the day. mmm. And for about 6.99 for a plate of pad thai, it doesn't break my bank! The tom yum soup is also to die for. oh, be still, my hungry heart. :)

C8GEGXoo2PfMC7ykiSQqQg.text: QUICK : INEXPENSIVE : GOOD PORTIONS  i've eaten at kung fu's on several occasions, usually with the bf's family cuz they enjoy the asian style restaurants more so than the vegas buffets.  kung fu's offers a vegetarian menu which is convenient for those non meat eaters. and for those who like it spicy, there's a range of spiciness from nothing to flaming hot. i like kick to my food and mild was good. if you like it hella spicy then go for it, but they aren't jokin' around.  the waiters are really friendly, helpful when ordering and give feed back about dishes/portions if you ask.  theres a lunch time menu... seems like a good bargain, but the individual plates are good too, especially if you wanna go family style. there's not a lot of people on a normal basis, but there is a good crowd.  suggestions: tom yum soup (vegetarian and non-vegetarian) - both great duck soup - good size for a 1 person meal papaya salad (vegetarian/mild) - good kick, they do give more cabbage than i would like (i HATE cabbage) vegetarian egg rolls - ok, comes with rice and i didnt really enjoy their version of sweet and sour sauce (kinda oily texture to it) pad see ewe - nothing special, same as any other place  i can't recall the other things that was ordered cuz everyone pretty much picks like 5 dishes each and we all share... yes we are pigs...   for 2 people we spent $40, BUT we had left overs for another meal for 20 people we spent well over several hundered $$$$$ but like i said, we are OINKERS....

pTlWQBDegIwcoL7hQ8D7_g.text: Ate here on my second night in Vegas.  I was going to eat at the plaza next to this one, the one with the Monkey King statue, but felt we have the best Chinese food in L.A., so it'll be a waste eating Chinese food in LV....  I should have stuck with my same reasoning for this place.   The soup was decent, the Pa Nang curry was no good, they added peanut butter to the sauce, and the meat/veggies looked so plain.    Next time when you visit Vegas, stick with what they're known for, buffets and oyster bars.

8jRX1d14XjZJz4vLcqwLJQ.text: Being new to Las Vegas, the search is on for certain restaurants that are "musts" while I'm here.  A good Chinese joint is crtical, and the mission has been accomplished. They've got a very good lunch special for $5.55 (described above).  I recommend the BBQ Pork Appetizer. It's a little different than I've had before, coming covered with a honey sauce, but it's very good. Sweet & Sour Chicken is good, fried rice is solid. It's going to be a weekly stop for me.

eNFqJpN5hJ9PgewXV2GqgA.text: Not sure what those who gave this place more stars ate but their food was way below mediocre. I tried the Pad Thai and Garlic Chicken with rice and didnt like either. Both lacked flavor and tasted like Rubber. Not sure what the environment in there is like as i ordered in. Definitely not ordering/going there again.

n54d7Eigs1G9eeypIfPpqw.text: I used to work close to here and their lunch specials are amazing. So is their chicken pad Thai. I never would have gone here if a coworker hadn't told me about it.

JdTyiu2S7a5VIAKjpv744A.text: Their food was absolutely delicious. The only reason i didn't give the 5th star was that it TOOK OVER AN HOUR TO DELIVER and we are about 10 minutes away. I ordered the Bean Sprouts and Jumbo Shrimp with jasmine rice and my coworker ordered the lunch special Orange Chicken and Fried rice. No complaints here and i will order again.

yC2fef3j1DguEZ8z1S23Iw.text: This place is the best Thai/Chinese food place on Valley View Rd! We went here with a group and could not believe how extensive the menu was. We each ordered a plate and shared it. There was even plenty enough to share with even more people. The service was great and attentive. They even have a bar inside. This place is open until 1am.

aBJowAfxCb6_aVlllF1A6A.text: Ended up in this disaster after one of our usual places was full of a tour group. It took around 10 minutes for anyone to come to the table to take our order after being sat. Little did we know this was the beginning of a pattern.My coworkers and I ordered off of the lunch menu (which for the price looks pretty good, I guess that is what gains them the one mandatory star above). Then the waiting game it took a very long time to get the food. The lunch special comes with egg and flour soup which we received first. It was bland and not very good, had to add soy sauce to it to make it even palatable. About 30 plus minutes later we received our entrees. The food was underwhelming at best. I had the Kung Pao chicken with fried rice, egg roll and Thai fried chicken wing. The chicken wing and egg roll were not too bad, but the rest was sub par and not very good. I believe I could have gotten a better meal at an Asian fast food restaurant. Then it took close to 15 minutes to get our check, followed by another long wait to get it back. It caused one of my coworkers to miss a meeting. Not sure how this place has made it as long as it has.

k11BHgGxuzDET9EjFU_BZw.text: We got sat down right away and place an order for 6 entree.  3 came out within 15 minutes, next 2 was 20 minutes after and my husband dish came out last (20 additional minutes) and it was wrong.  We informed the waiter and they told us that is the way they cook general chicken.  It had pineapple and tasted like sweet n sour chicken.  I have never been to a place that puts pineapple in the general chicken!   To top it off, there was a group of 15 folks standing around our table just waiting for tables to be cleared to be sitted. (Half of their crowd were sitted and the other half waiting).   It was dis-organized and other table was getting upset as well.  One table found a roach crawling on the table and yelled it out.  We were very irratated and asked for a check.  My husband didn't get to eat at all and nor did the waiter got us any refill on our drink.  Food was not authentic at all (yes I'm Asian), poor service, and very dis organized! I travel around the world just to try different Thai restaurant and this is not one to ever recommend or return too.  Best authentic this food in Vegas is by far Lotus of Siem!!

FFeDiHf2ajdVK-Zz254_uA.text: Been there 3 times. Each time was really good. (Got it to go each time). First time I got pork chow mein. Really enjoyed it. Other two times I got Mongolian beef. You get to choose how spicy you want it from 1-10. First time I got a 5, then I got an 8 the second time. Going back to 5! Planning on going back!

YqtuTy2eWufF1CUpCnbHYg.text: Good flavors, decent portions, shrimp was rubbery though.  Great place for large parties, very accommodating.

u3TB9es8BaNXds-dI9iaRA.text: Definitely NOT a good experience. Our waitress was horrible. We ordered wine right off the bat...it never arrived and the woman had the audacity to tell us we hadn't ordered it by showing us her chicken scratch on a notepad. As if we would have any clue what her cryptic symbols meant. Anyhow, to top it off, our order arrived in waves. Half of the party was finished eating before other orders arrived. The waitress told us (again by showing the notepad) that we hadn't ordered the meal that was forgotten. Strange, we all recalled the order details. Regardless, another member of the staff magically got the order to appear. Sodas were never refilled, the place was a huge disappointment. We took our kids there to practice their mandarin and couldn't find anyone that spoke the language. Why are you in chinatown??? Chinese buffets in malls would be better options. Don't be fooled by the overall decent star rating!!! Oh yeah, and the only hot sauce they could find was mustard. HUH???

9p4tWkm-JNsmDhkS6bM1XQ.text: There was a little mom and pop Thai restaurant in my hometown of Houston that had the absolute best Pad Thai Chicken. They closed a couple of years ago and I have been on the hunt ever since for that same experience. I have found it here! And when I ask for extra spicy they never disappoint. A good compliment is the Hot and Sour Tofu soup. I have tried a couple of other dishes as has my wife and they are all good. A must if you love Thai food.

cxyuzLX0PFXnti3_Lts7Sw.text: Ordered from this place based on recommendation from the front desk at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club. Delivery charge was only $4.00 which beats taking a cab ride to and from the hotel.  We looked at the website and ordered most of the favorites.  We liked the Tom Kha soup, Fried Chicken WIngs and the Chicken Chowmein.  They all tasted good and authentic. We didn't care for the Wonton soup, Mongolian Beef, Eggrolls or Pad Thai.  The Pad Thai was very average and noodles were clumped up together. The Steamed Vegatables with dipping sauce was ok and there was about 8 different vegetables in it.  I would definitely order from here again picking the right dishes.

u1XAOxFISDYC39ZwTFbcxg.text: Good food, waiter not that attentive.  It's more Thai restaurant than Chinese......

iHimgvoqgM0dm7yZLx9XJg.text: I love Kung Fu, great food served promptly, great service, calming atmosphere, and a huge menu to choose from...it works for me every time.

GprOTSxn7J_3KC6hTB92Qw.text: I was here a few days ago and I shared five dishes, and only one of the dishes disappointed me.  It was the "orange chicken".  The orange chicken was heavily battered and there was very little orange glaze on it.  So if I were you, I would avoid the orange chicken at all costs!

FSrXeUbbc7kE1LcoCm4vlA.text: Adequate service, they could have tried to be at least more attentive. I even asked for those 4 chili sauces from one of the waiters and I still didn't even get it when my table and I finished our food. And we had to seat ourselves in because they weren't even paying attention to is near the entrance. But I must say, I've tried Thai restaurants from both California and Nevada and this place has good food, the dishes here are so perfectly seasoned, there is no too sweet, too plain, or too salty or not enough saltiness. Probably coming back again when I visit Las Vegas.

8591D0zBVghVM4ROxXCY6A.text: This place is great! My boyfriend had just recently come back from a trip to Asia, so he was craving some thai food one night. We decided we would order from here, after reading some reviews. We ordered the pad thai, fried rice, and the BBQ pork soup. We were initially impressed because we live about 20-30 minutes from this place (depending on the traffic) and they delivered with no problem! When the food came, we were even more impressed. The rice, soup, and pad thai were delicious and came in very generous portions. The BBQ pork soup was available at any spiciness you desired, on a scale of 1-10. We love spicy food, but we were nervous to go too spicy, so we ordered a 4. Well.... a 4 is HOT, very very HOT... but delicious! the flavor was great, but I would definitely recommend not going too high with the spiciness!

Zr-j1jC-pUAtCkgD6tJZpw.text: Love it! my fav is the Thai beef salad.......yum. Anything you order is delish.

oRvIJthjOKvMnMjs7HFt8A.text: I wish I could attach a picture is what my dish looked like.  I order from here ALOT and never have been as dissatisfied as I am tonight.  I ordered beef and green beans.  Usually plenty of meat. I got a bowl full of green beans and 7 small pieces of beef. I call and they  put the chef to ask how many pieces he put.  Really?   Very disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 7 little bit of meat.  In a bowl full of green beans!

APpylCfZHqrG6uBJ2RB5sQ.text: My review probably shouldn't count as I keep it simple with my order and have been eating the exact same thing since 2004. Lemon Chicken and Vegetable Chow Mein. This place can get pack and when it does some of the waiters  can forget you exist. One time we were seated and waited patiently for 20-25mins and no one ever came back to ask us for drinks or take our order so we ended up leaving. I do love this place. And so does my husband. But every time we've been lately the service sucks. Not consistent at all.

ieyTFbAoZSWjgLPWVoGfJA.text: I stop here every time I go to Las Vegas. Best Thai around & consistent all the time.

B0AecX6CEjAD7bPHKIheaw.text: Ordered for pickup through the website. Immediately after I was finished I get a phone call asking if I can be there in 20 minutes to pickup the order. As I'm pulling up to the restaurant I get another call asking if I was on my way. I tell them I'm pulling in. I walk in, tell a server I was here for a pickup order, he said he was going to go get it, 10 minutes later, nothing. So I take a play out of their book and call them, tell them I'm standing up front, she says "oh, okay, we'll bring it out to you". 15 minutes later, nothing, so here I am 25 minutes later standing here writing a review and still no order. If you're going to be so adamant about me picking up my order, maybe you should have the order completed in the first place. Overpriced, mediocre food with terrible service.

Ycb4LT_dnA0VdcnxiKDC1A.text: In love with this fantastic place almost 3 years and I cannot found something better!

aI090fGdczgiQ8oA62U1oQ.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant that I've ever ate at in the United states. It's better than all the Thai places that I've had in california, and trust me I've had a lot. I love their spicy shrimp salad, pad Woon sen, and Tom yum soup. Everything is so flavorful and amazing. I'm also in love with their Thai iced coffee. I can't find another place that makes their drinks as good as this place. I wish this place was in oc so I could go every week. However since it's in vegas, I always make a stop here when I go to vegas. Love this place and I would highly recommend it to everyone. Nice servers and workers as well.

j-LZKPsRDQLezZmCvinclg.text: We ordered for delivery online which was very convenient.  We were all pleased and happy with our meal.  There was more than enough food.  The food came within an hour.  I highly recommend this restaurant!!!

h_Ye5zELcA263XPXsrIDcw.text: First timer here and I have to say I am pleasantly surprised! We ordered chicken pad see ew and the sweet green curry with chicken.   The pad see ew was so good, I really liked how some of the noodles had a crunch to them because they were stir fried and not over cooked. And the curry was pretty amazing. Don't order if you can't take spice because the order comes precooked with spices so I ordered little to no spice and it had a kick to it but I didn't mind, still tasted awesome.   At first the dishes looked so plain and unattractive, not like other Thai restaurants but once I tried the food I was blown away!   I guess that's how you know a restaurants Chefs and ingredients are amazing, when the dishes look so plain but have amazing flavor! Not drenched in typical sauce packets like Thai house or lucky Thai. I'm really happy I tried this place out.

1bPoI2NsfEjNPUwGuPf0Fw.text: They delivered our food fast and it was delicious. It's hands down one of the best places to eat Chinese food.

9B5BRrprRtl_oJNY70mr-Q.text: We have been to numerous Thai restaurants.  This restaurant by far is the best tasting food than any Thai restaurant that we have ever been to. The Pad Thai is absolutely unique and delicious.  The Kung Pao chicken is also the best I have ever tasted in any Thai restaurant. Here is a lady that is a server here and her name is Jen. She is outstanding when it comes to remembering your order and bringing your food out exceptionally fast. The place is always packed with people it's very clean and they run a great operation. I highly recommend it to anybody that enjoys Thai food

c1E1Ng_bPtLcBBnzdS3jWQ.text: Very good lunch, service, and atmosphere. Thai food is one of my faves and this place was outstanding. Took my vegas buddy here while in town  and he was very happy with the quality and service. I'll make this a stop any time I'm in town .

qiABawNd2BSEWkluCjNv9Q.text: I love coming here! Been here many times. This is where I come for my Thai/Chinese fix!  The restaurant is on the corner of Spring Mountain and Valley View Blvd. You'll find parking in the strip plaza. It does get busy though!  It's very nicely decorated inside. There is plenty of seating, the booths are pretty big but if you need something for a larger party then there are plenty of tables to go around.  Restrooms are typically ok.  There is a full bar but I have never really seen too many people sit there.  FREE Wi-Fi.  Customer service is usually fast and efficient. The waiters are very friendly and knowledgable when you ask a question about the menu or a dish.  The food is to die for! Always fresh and hot when it comes out. My favorite dish is the Mongolian Beef/ Chicken. It's topped with some fried noodles that totally make the dish! My husband likes many of the dishes so he does not have one is particular. We usually get an order of potstickers but they are deep fried and are too crunchy for my tastes.  Give this place a try! You will get hooked!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian Chicken!

orOX1yAcB2Qjn3EUCV4BUA.text: Totally reminded me of east coast style chinese food.  Very glad to find this.    Service was ok, not the best.

og4aM_D_i8_2nyfAFT_VVA.text: Was staying in Vegas for the weekend and wanted some Chinese food. Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try? Glad I did! Food was very delicious and tasty, service was good!

qO-8ETqx9N7pdA5vkUCQSw.text: I work at the SLS Hotel & Casino and my co-worker and I ordered food from here for delivery. Between the two of us, we ordered the chicken fried rice, chicken pad siew-ew, and the pad woon sen. I would have added pictures to this review, but I was so hungry when the food got here I completely forgot to take pictures, ha! The process to order online was seamless and, for an Asian food restuarant, in my opinion, ahead of the game in comparison to other restaurants (kungfuplaza.com). Their website is very clean and well laid out. It lists out all of their food items, descriptions of the foods, as well as pictures. When you go to check-out you fill in all of your information and it offers places to add comments should there be any special requests, option to add tip, as well as an option to pick when you want your food delivered (in case you were ordering for later and would not have time to put an order in or for future deliveries). I was sent an emailed receipt detailing all of the tidbits I added on to my order including my instructions on where to drop off and which number to call upon arrival and a breakdown of the receipt. I don't usually get impressed by a site or receipt so it says a lot when I say I was very impressed by this. Upon arrival, the driver called to let me know he was five minutes away and where he would be. The food was fresh and was still piping hot when I took it back to the office. It was very flavorful and they gave us so much for the price! Thanks, Kung Fu! We will be ordering again.

rJlY2MxWsF0e-wJcJjGOag.text: The place definitely is a little hole in the wall, definitely not a fancy date place. We decided to try this place since Pho Kim Long was packed, when we sat down I looked over the Yelp reviews and my stomach started to sink...  to the point where I was thinking of walking out, but I decided to stick it out. The calamari came out first, suffice to say DO NOT ORDER that, it was horrible. It was all flour and the squid was rubbery. But thankfully all the other dishes I ordered was ok. My husband loved his pork and garlic dish, the pad see ew beef was good, the Mongolian beef was good too. For me it wasn't fantastically amazing, but for someone who was super hungry, it was good enough. Will I want or crave to go back? Probably not but my husband really loved his pork and garlic so if he begs, I probably will. As for service, it was ok, ambience soso at least my seats weren't torn. Cleanliness ok as well. My overall rating for this place is average, and my advice is just try to avoid the horrible dishes and zone in on the ones that are good.

vaqR1xlCiwCbQ4U9PE9LPg.text: Excellent! We ordered delivery. They were very nice on the phone and the driver was also very courteous and even called to confirm our address. The food was outstanding! I ordered the Chopped Ckn & Chili & Mint #502 it was absolutely delicious. I love spicy, got this on a heat scale of 7. It was perfect. Not too much that I couldn't taste it. The meat was so tender and the basil was a great addition. My hubby ordered Mongolian Pork, heat 7. Also, incredible flavor. We also ordered Crab Rangoon. Loved the dipping sauces. Super yummy. Can't wait to go back. This will be our new go-to for delivery night.

DcxQtNxdtqI-Z3zNrbd5ng.text: I hate being lied to.  The food there is good; not any better than any Thai place in town and a little worse than Komol and Lotus of Siam, but OK.  The service is sub-standard, but not glaringly so.  The wait times for food is unusually long; perhaps because they are trying to get you to drink more.  But they lie.  First off, never ever ever order order for pick up.  They will wait for you to show up to begin making it so you do not cheat them by a no show.  They will lie to you when you get there and say it "almost done" and immediately run you card, and then you will wait between 30-40 minutes for the food.  If you call and get them to promise they will make it and it will be waiting hot, they will still lie, and say they will.  And they will not.  This happened to me 4 times before I gave up on them, as they are the closest Thai place to my home and therefor a logical choice if we want a quick dinner.  Then we went to do deliveries at our home from them, as they we the only Thai place that we could find that delivered.  A guy came for several times, we paid a good tip and there were no issues, and then, out of the blue, the person answered the phone told us they they could not deliver to our area, it was "too far."  When we pointed out to them that they had delivered several times before, the person on the phone informed us categorically that they had never delivered to that area and accused us of lying.  We shrugged, figured we had someone new or crazy or what not, ordered someplace else and moved on.  A few weeks later we tried to order again, a different person answered the phone and again categorically informed us they had never delivered to the area where our home was located.  A change in policy because we were too far away . . . fine.  But it doesn't sit with me well how easy and enthusiastically they lie.  Their food ain't bad, but it is not worth putting up with their service or their lying.

NdgmXmk-atxKukLQqRWOCw.text: This was me and my boyfriends first time eating here! I tried Thai food and he stuck to Chinese. I ordered Pork Thai and broccoli (not the actually name) and it was great. The house's sauce was a bit sweet, and it kind of over powered the dish; that's why I give this review a 4/5. There was just too much sauce!  Overall, the food was delicious and we'll probably be back! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai style pork! My first time trying Thai!

tEUeOHW8n8NTXjq-n5H0Hw.text: You can't go wrong with their wanton soup, pork  fried rice, seafood chow mein, and Thai BBQ chicken! Well at least, that's according to my friends and I. :)  Went here late Friday night after having gone to First Friday at the Arts District. Been craving for some Chinese food so we originally planned of going to this Golden Flower in Henderson, but unfortunately it's closed when we arrived there. Since that was already past 930p, most of the Chinese buffets we know were already closed. So we had this genius idea of going back downtown until we brought ourselves to Chinatown. That was quite a drive I'll say so talk about starving. Lol  We basically just acted on impulse and eat wherever our eyes set on first. And this was it! We absolutely liked the food, the restau's ambiance, and its all-cool-and-smiling staff. :)  If you're around the area, you must try this dining place out sometime!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ej7u-RuM8VOpHmEacZo5eQ.text: Where do i begin with this place.....i usually critique the food and the food only, despite the bad service im rating this place completely on the food alone. I ordered the orange chicken lunch special with fried rice for $6.75 And an appetizer sampler. First of all the "chicken" was heavily battered. upon further investigation ( me taking apart the breading ) i realized that the chicken is not breaded in house. Its the cheapest mechanically separated frozen garbage ive ever seen. This meal was worse then the chinese food station at the palace station buffet. With an overly sweet sauce dedicated to hiding the "flavor" of this so called version of meat. I was truly disappointed. I envision an owner that cares more about food cost percentages then he does about the quality of the food. Batter your own chicken! Chicken is cheap. Very disappointed! Will never visit this establishment again

saigaT5czMdJyZgDK-oxqA.text: This is the best tasting thai food in town hands down!!!! I always order the chopped chicken chili and mints so goood with a jumbo thai ice tea. Place is usually busy and at times the service is slow but well worth it to grub in some bomb thai food.

nMWeasgDzPHXj0uAovs57Q.text: Not my fave.  My thing is rare beef soup and spicy, but everything  was sweet.  My moms dish, my sons dish, all things ypu would not expect.  Attentive staff and  relatively  clean.  There was a security  guard watching over the alley so parking was convenient.

f9u74tFwqYgCUTaZDH3g-Q.text: Needed delivered food due to a knee injury and was looking for a soup high in collagen so my first thought was something Asian. A cab driver had just recommended this place 3 days before. They have Beef Tendon Soup so I knew that would be perfect (I'd never had it). When I saw online ordering- whoohoo! No language/accent barriers with ordering . I also got Jumbo Shrimp Curry and Tom Yum Mixed Seafood Soup, and my daughter got Orange chicken and egg roll. What a great meal and the delivery time was fast. It exceeded  my expectations and I absolutely loved the curry, and the soup was also very good. We'll definitely be repeat customers.

vGejThErlDWxDh0MffRuHw.text: Haven't been here much since they remodeled which is quite awhile ago but will probably try again soon. Was a great place to get both Thai and Chinese food.

ESgWu1KeUYMHJY224H8rdQ.text: Always get the Mongolian beef spicy #7. You tend to get better service if you have someone asian in your group.

F0vdatZ5ousqMzRfXN0-ew.text: The food was delicious and flavorful. The service could be a little better. I would definitely go here again. Tried to go for dinner on Sunday but it was too crowded and there was no parking.  I went back on Monday for lunch when it was less crowded and got in quickly.

BUsUZNNR-UT8hh75kvBUQg.text: They weren't very good 1-1/2yrs ago when I visited Vegas and ate there but maybe better now.

y6h9g7WauULchrWW1bqK0Q.text: This is a Thai and Chinese Restaurant, but I never order Chinese food here because I'm Chinese and well, I just don't want to be disappointed.  Their Thai food is excellent though!  I always order the same three dishes:  the fried chicken wings, the pork salad, and the mint chicken.  So if you want really really good food, order these three items!  The fried chicken wings have almost never failed me, except maybe once or twice in 5 years.  I love how crunchy it is on the outside and how moist it is in the inside.  They don't seem to put much spices or salt on it, and it's just delicious the way it is.  The pork salad is also really good, and it's kind of sour, sweet, and savory.  The mint chicken is also to die for.  There's just something about it that is better than any other versions of mint/basil chicken I have ever had at Thai restaurants.  Give me some of that with the jasmine rice and I'm good to go.  Their service is not always the best, but servers are always polite and fast.  I've never had a problem with a long wait.  Of all Thai places I've tried, this is still my favorite!  Maybe because I LOVE me some good crunchy and crispy chicken wings and this is as good as it gets!

3Do9DWzyRlfoV_pX37yaOQ.text: Nasty made me sick, go somewhere else plenty of good choices here in Las Vegas....BEWARE

DuGWK5UWt_F8T9_uHJsc1A.text: I have to say this is my favorite Chinese food spot in Vegas. I always order the sweet and sour shrimp with my meal and it is always fantastic. The last time I went, I went with my son. He ordered the whole fried catfish and you should of seen when the waiter sat it down in front of him. He almost jumped out his skin.   But kids aside, ordering whole catfish when they don't know what to expect and aren't listening to the adults tell them it is a whole catfish the food is always great and the service matches it. Oh, the catfish was fantastic with the chili sauce being delightfully unique.

ZW1ikdHqC6wRp95F90qneQ.text: First timer. It was good compared to China a go go. Fresh food but pricey for the portions. Loved the Chicken Laarb, Tom yum soup and definitely recommend the sweet n sour pork!

AmHNBle6MTti6-8k-I7H2w.text: Met some friends for dinner. By the time I had got there, they had already ordered dinner. It was no more than maybe five minutes and the first dish was already coming out. We started with the Seafood Tom Yum Soup. The light tangy soup was not a hit with everyone. The broth was filled with mussels, shrimp, squid, fish filet, and mushrooms. From that point on, the food came out in rapid secession. The Combination Pad Thai was lacking flavor compared to the Pork Pad See Ew. Now that we have eaten every animal on land and sea we got an order of Sauteed Chinese Broccoli.   The service is quick and attentive, Our water glasses were always full and dirty dishes were taken away quickly. The food is a safe bet. Another reason why we are always back here.

nZhappKPEwFRTHCjdsRDIA.text: I'm really picky with a place that mixes Chinese with Thai. Their pad thai doesn't cut it for me, but their Pad See Ew is as legit as the best Thai places. Therefore I like this place. You might have to do some hit or miss tests before you find what suits you.

BWBXvgCheRw-Kw4SZ2eceQ.text: This is one the best restaurants ever!!! No only is the food good but the service is great! Staff is very polite and restaurant is very nice and clean! My favorite dish is the orange chicken! I definitely recommend this place to everyone!!!!

5wZTU0MlPIY2Wr-VtL7izw.text: 40mins later and still waiting for my order! My first time here and I'm never coming back..

eTUm5idQ7qcM718epPVcvg.text: Food was really good as always. But we realized this place decrease the portions of food and it's now changing fine dining prices. Well... I don't think the atmosphere and service deserves the price increase. Let me know if you ever come up with a 50% off offer and we might consider.

JcFHHNmQlELTuUpDVX-qFA.text: After a busy week in Vegas, and simply not feeling great, I decided to order for delivery, and I am glad I did. I ordered the Chicken Satae and the Chicken, Garlic and Pepper, and both were very good.  I had lunch in China Town yesterday and was very disappointed. It turns out I just went to the wrong place. I will definitely come back to this place the very next time I'm in Vegas.  Delivery time was prompt too.

ytyhUxoQegvKZE8WenYuZA.text: Some of the best Thai food in town. Service is friendly, however; does not qualify for speedy. Worth the trip to Chinatown-great Tom Yum!

8EIv-vsiALQS7PmmdUyaYg.text: Excellent service. Best Chinese/Thai restaurant in town. Highly recommended.

G9rdmVyIf1FikWz015Xleg.text: With all the great reviews on here I was really excited to try it. I was so disappointed. We walked in and it was if we were non existent. No hello.. No eye contact. We stood there and wondered do we seat ourselves? Finally someone seats us.. I think it took 10 minutes for a server to get to our table. He was indifferent and kind of ignored is the rest of the night.  Now the food.. Ugh. I ordered egg flower soup .. It was so thick I couldn't stomach it. Mongolian beef was okay .. Very small portion and I don't eat that much. Egg foo young looked gross on the plate. It tasted okay.. I mean it's only eggs. It just wasn't that great like I thought it would be.

BQudU7oqD-a5uWCqVJh3QQ.text: First time dining here yesterday and our experience was pretty off the charts. Service was quick and friendly. I recommend getting the Combination Pad Thai, Orange Chicken, & Garlic Sauce Chinese Broccoli! Tasty food for a reasonable price.

bYkuLmOg-UDI_JgVI918mw.text: This place has great food. The Mongolian beef, orange chicken, and pot stickers are all great choices. The service is decent. I've been to worse.  Over all it's a good choice

C8O55nvh0hOw7e-feVNtzQ.text: Delivery was fast thats the only reason for the 2 stars, food was about a 1.  Pad thai seemed like the noodles were cooked yesterday, the veggies seemed like most came from a can and what was fresh was brown and wilting, the soup seemed way to sour, like it was about to turn. What a waste of 30$$

YsSBJVcbMLoNiaIPniITbg.text: If you order papaya salad, watch out - it's VERY spicy hot, and they'd only tell you that there are 2 choices - mild and spicy.  We ordered "mild" which was sooooooo spicy hot that it brought tears to my eyes (plse note I can take spicy very well). I talked to the server, who then said "oh, you should have ordered a non-spicy one". And refused to take it back.  So they expect the customers to do their job???? What the heck are the customers supposed to know that they offer a non-spicy, in addition to "mild", and "spicy"??? The POOREST customer service we have ever seen!  Eat here at your own risk!

A3KlOrP5D0n6O_nNNiWMog.text: First off I'd like to preface this review by saying that I've being going here for at least the past 6 years. Service has always been just alright, but you would think since I come I'm in quite a bit, that'd would have at least changed. Nope. I also want to say that by far, they have my FAVORITE Tom Yum and Yum Woonsen. Order it every time. No other restaurant makes it as good as they do. But to the docking of stars. My husband no longer wants to dine here after basically being ignored one visit. We were barely acknowledged, just enough so that we finally got to place an order after being seated for 20 minutes ( again, we know what we want and just wasn't approached prior to this.) When we got our food, I was willing to dismiss the lack of service in the beginning, because the food is just so dang good and  I had an ok history with them. Buuuut, we weren't even on their radar during the meal. Our waters were not once refilled (or offered), no one asked how our meal was, or even if we would like anything else. Nothing. My husband was furious. We talked to them about how we felt neglected from the awful service, and their decision? Give us 10% off. Um. Ok. We are very reasonable people and are pretty polite, even if it comes down to complaining. Had we had a large bill, 10% would have been sufficient. But for two meals, they basically covered tax. Poor customer service recovery, in my opinion, especially for someone that has frequented there often.  Really disappointed.

SWmIOM4PF43N6-NocgNCVQ.text: Gave this place a second try, and it still failed. The server was unfriendly, and the service was both slow and ingenuine. The red curry was watery and lacked any taste, and the Ton Yum soup was beyond miserable. As for management presence? None. Will NEVER return....

OloTnVM6YqgMcgC3N5l4oQ.text: Been going here for years. Great authentic Thai food! My favorite dish to order here is Pad Thai, they use slightly thinner noodles....what a difference!  If you like Thai food then go here! Only downside to this place is sometimes you receive less than stellar service, but that doesn't stop me from going.

0KzYE6O90rUQo3_HbQZQ1g.text: Ordered $60 in food online for delivery and was called 15 minutes later and told it was too far.  They said they only deliver 3 miles out and I'm 5.  The website says it will not allow the order if they won't service your zip code and it had no problem accepting the order.  I'm a little disappointed that I didn't get the opportunity to try this place, the food looked good but got bit by their broken website and/or unwritten policy.

DcyPRYCgK0BZVXd8MGR7-A.text: This place is awesome ! The servers get to you quickly, they're always so friendly and helpful. If you've never been here for sure try the Tom Yum soup with shrimp, it has me hooked ! I've tried several different items on the menu and it's all been so tasty. The portioning is very good for the price. One item can easily be split between 2 people. Definitely recommend it

4KqnmvHnwPL2snbjHbq8zw.text: Worst service I wouldn't even give it one star it used to be the best place but I won't be a regular customer anymore

pFFh9XTwYPSn-IrWg0RpuQ.text: Terrible service. You will wait forever. Half of staff will avoid eye contact. Some of them quite rude and need good training from someone who really know "customer service" badly.

YsgWOQYTpIGRJZbT0kK73A.text: You know that place youre looking for in Vegas that reminds you of home? This is it! Ive never had anything bad, they deliver almost anywhere in Vegas it seems, and pricing is pretty reasonable for the amount of food you get. The chicken fried rice is my favorite!  I recommend this to everyone who asks.

6RrmnzDbUcKtLExdcTfpYQ.text: The worst service ever. Waiter started arguing with me after he brought the wrong soup and told me that I got what I ordered. Then he just walked away. Then he came back telling me again that this I what I ordered, this time he took the soup and walked away telling me of in Chinese. Another waiter came to our table and recognized me from his prior restaurant and says hi and that he wanted to apologize for for his behavior. The new waiter even remembered what I use to ordered at his restaurant. He brought me my favorite soup and told me about Thor curries and that next time we come in to order the green curry, because it is the same as the one I use to order at his old restaurant. Food is mediocre and the service is horrible. Don't know if I will be back ever.

EDjGvZ-8dkA7Ac-o4GlVag.text: I didn't feel well today and was craving Chinese food. I just moved to Las Vegas and I'm not the most familiar with where things are so I ordered delivery from the first place that came up on Google, Kung fu. After ordering my food with the delivery fee and automatic 15% tip to the driver, a woman called to confirm my order. She asked what my cross streets were and realized I'm on the other side of town but she said it was okay. An hour later, our food arrived and I was greeted by my deliver driver. He was an older Asian man who proceeded to complain and moan about my delivery to no end. I pretty much closed the door on him. I felt like I was being scolded by my father or something. He complained about things I couldn't control like the fact that my complex is too dark for him to see the building and he complained about how he had to drive SO far (not even 20 minutes). When I apologized for the inconvenience I had caused him he just repeated how far I made him drive. I will never give this restaurant my business again because of that driver. The food also was not worth the price or the frustration.

RP1En4bkEcIPNolcJpfzpQ.text: The food here is mediocre, but it is pretty cheap.   I've gone here about three times and from what I can remember I've had pad thai, tom yum soup, chow mein, a chicken dish, a duck dish, and a beef dish. All of the dishes were satisfactory, nothing more.   The staff isn't very friendly. I have never being greeted here, or given a nice goodbye.   It's a nice place to go if you want a lot of food for a low price and aren't too concerned about service.  *You can also view the comment that was left on this review to get a further understanding of the people that work there:  -Only I would know how many times I've gone to this restaurant, so for this person to say, " I'm sure you've been here more, you just forgot a few other times we were together," is just a little absurd. And after asking my boyfriend, it turns out I've only gone here TWO times.     -"You'll probably have to get use to having great tasting Thai and Chinese food." Excuse me? I'll probably have to GET USE TO having this stuff? As if I haven't gone to other Thai and Chinese restaurants before. I didn't even mention the fact that it was Chinese and Thai in my review, so i don't see what that has to do with anything.   -"see for yourself. The Tourism Authority of Thailand delegates to the DEMA show dined with us three out of the four days they were here in Vegas." Umm, is that suppose to mean something to me? Showing me some link isn't going to change my taste buds.   I gave this restaurant two stars for a reason. The food is mediocre and the service is lacking, but that doesn't mean I hated it.  I've left far worse reviews at other places.
