BmTYsCuv0_2TrB9ainGeuw.text: Been ordering from This place since they opened and they have been going downhill over the years. Tonight they lost us. Waited over 25 minutes for potstickers. Knowing that service in Chinatown sucks we order a beer and chatted. Pot stickers came out steamed. Waited another 10 minutes for the 1 server on the floor to notice me waiving my hand. Nightmare. Comes over and started yelling that we ordered steamed. Never order steamed potstickers in my life but then again what server yells at you that you did. And no offense but with their language barrier how am I the one that is mistaken??? Went to walk out and he said "beer is $8.25" which we didn't even finish. So many good options have opened in Chinatown over the last 20 plus years. Save your money. These people suck and I will never step foot in their restaurant again. Yelp should let you give 0 stars.

YiXkRaNpYxSXDPowkHI2hA.text: This was such a delightful, hidden gem in Chinatown. I've lived in Vegas for 13 years, and I just recently discovered this restaurant thanks to my cousin who visits annually from California (and apparently has been coming to Kung Fu Thai every year for the last 5 years... TFTI).   Trying to find parking sucks since it's located in the same strip mall as Pho Kim Long, Lee's Sandwiches, etc. However, since Kung Fu Thai is located more towards the side of the building, on the corner of Spring Mountain & Valley View, I was later advised that there's more parking in an alley-ish on Valley View (*Will be more concise & update next time I go).   I got there around 3 on a weekday, and it was PACKED, and it grew even busier the closer it got to dinner time. So I can only imagine how crazy busy it can get actually during dinner and/or on the weekends. I would advise to go early.   The food is amazing & it's served "family-style." Unless you're like me & my family and eat A LOT in one sitting, then you could probably keep one entree order all to yourself (or three).

DnkfFjWctrbPKwH8QzAOWw.text: We ordered Vegetable Chowmein and Panang Tofu.  Panang Tofu was really delicious with amazing flavours of grounded peanuts and coconut. Chowmein was okayish. Would give it a try only for the Panang Tofu.

9SAQd8gJ50jhaA3Op_PNEA.text: Great food, great staff  A place to enjoy family during dinner.   Plenty of options to enjoy, good imported beer and a selection of wine

uH8Y33AaMpmIQ916mY9h6g.text: Kung Fu is my go-to Thai place in Vegas whenever I feel a craving for some Thai food. I feel like whenever I take a bite of their food, this is what Thai food should taste like. Their Chinese food is pretty good too, although it may not be as authentic as a normal Chinese place, they serve some good Chinese food here as well.  I've been coming to this place with my family for a number of years now. I always love coming to this place for the food and I enjoy chatting with some of the waiters. It's friendly for family, and large parties if necessary.   My favorite things to eat from here are the pad thai, pad se ew, and general Tso's chicken. Kung Fu gets pad thai correctly and cooks their pad se ew well and both have flavor. Their general Tso's chicken is sweet and has a slightly spicy flavor to it and this is best eaten at the restaurant so it is still crispy when you eat it! I have ordered their curry, vegetable dishes, tom kha soup, and I enjoy them all!  Don't be scared to try this place, it will not disappoint. A lot of people enjoy coming here and you will soon find out why.

CQkq1v_RYA5OoW0wr3RV8A.text: Must have passed this place a million and one times over the last ten years since I came to town and never stopped in. Heard good things about it and fellow colleagues always go, so today me and Ellen F. decide to check it out.   Located on the southwest corner in the strip mall on Valley View and Spring Mountain, can't miss it with a name like Kung Fu on the outside. We were seated right away, place wasn't too busy so a waiter took our drink orders promptly.   The place looks old school but don't care about that, has a lot of Thai decor with elephants and pictures of the motherland. I get the feeling this place is geared more toward Thai than Chinese but who knows. If you want pad Thai don't fall for the trap and order it from the menu as they offer it as a lunch special for $6.95 Mon-Fri 11am-3pm. I fell for this and ordered the combo pad Thai with an order of rice, it was huge!! Enough for two people.   I doubt the lunch portion is as big but still much cheaper and comes with soup or an egg roll. The pad Thai was very good, along with the rice, the quantity was more than enough and the bill was reasonable. We will be returning during lunch hours to take full advantage of the specials. If your looking for a cheap meal in Chinatown with no frills it's worth a stop.

nGvrepR0FhLPyhhM0lov7g.text: A gem in Vegas' Chinatown. General Tso's chicken was the best I've tasted: tender on the inside, crunchy on the outside. The rest were great as well.

7WM5kwsA4BG8_66jz1KzcA.text: Very accommodating! Our daughter made reservations for her friends for Homecoming and they had no problems with all 20 kids(plus all the driving parents!)  being at the restaurant. The food was good. We got steamed potstickers (will do fried next time) Mongolian beef (oh my gosh the sauce is awesome!) and cashew chicken (just sweet enough to be perfect!). Service was great for a Saturday night with an almost full house! Our waitress was quite attentive and we didn't ever have to worry about refills. Prices were reasonable for the area. We will be back!

O8CLdrX4WjM2VR3B2lPBEg.text: My experience with Kung Fu Thai was very dissapointment.  I went there and signed my name on the waiting list.  They told us it would take about 10 minutes waiting time.  After about 20 minutes waiting, I went and check the list, my name was next to be call.  Out of a sudden a group of people walk in and they get seat right away.  I asked why is that and the server said that group have more people.  What the heck, they only have two more people than I am.  I got so mad and about to walk out.  Same thing happened again when a group of 10 people walk in and they get the table right away.  I looked around and it seem all the tables were full and it would take us another 30 minutes to wait.  I decided to try the Pho Saigon and we got seat right away.  I will never come back to Kung Fu Thai again.

Aa30JOaRL2yB4dYf1fBreg.text: I am from California and occasionally fly in to visit Las Vegas since I have family here . I had come here around 3-4 times and had no problem with the food or the service . However , yesterday I came with a large group of around 10 people and ordered 2 seafood soups . I was brought a large bowl with VERY little seafood and lots and lots of broth. How much did I pay for it ? $30 something dollars ! I am sure that they transferred a 1 portion seafood soup onto a larger bowl and called it a day . I thought this place was honest and had integrity but apparently not . After yesterday, I don't think I'm ever coming back to this place . The food taste is above average but their integrity and portion size is not . Also ! Just keep in mind that they automatically charge gratuity on your bill.

38-hrAQ_hE2jLwZBNCJnBg.text: Bad service, act like you're not even there even after you've been waiting for 30+ minutes. Servers walk around as if they don't see you. Would not recommend unless you have 2 hours to spare.

j8VpMfBZwMsL70qaMzxtXg.text: Have been going to this place since I was a kid!  The food is consistent and very flavorful with mostly Thai dishes and some Chinese dishes mixed into the menu.  Staples include the pad Thai, curries and salads that are great family style.  They've recently renovated the restaurant so it doesn't look as run down as it used to be which shows how long this place has been around.  Tom yum soup is served in a nice flaming pot to keep the soup hot and is very flavorful.  Only issue with the food is sometimes they use too much grease and oil in their dishes so I recommend saying light oil!

LKjnnj4SaXwpfVA0673ktA.text: Been here many times, and its always a good meal. Place does get busy, its usually 3/4 full at least everytime I've gone here. My Thai friend loves the food here so it gets high marks for the Thai food.  I usually get Pad See Ew and crab rangoon.....I'm such a lame thai food person. I've also had cashew chicken. They do it really well here though. Service has always been spot on, never had any issues. Just a good solid place to eat, and prices are moderate.   The only issue would be how busy it is, and with the center tables it can get loud, so its not a place for a romantic quiet meal.

o1d2z47p9_oyu9JMs6nnnA.text: Great food large portion. Price is good for the amount you get. I would recommend this place if you are in the mood for Thai or Chinese

sJO1650cNHZ_Z5XoKoI7sg.text: After hearing lots of chatter, I finally made it to Kung Fu to give it a try.  I discovered a large menu and quite the assortment of Chinese and Thai dishes.  Located at Valley View and Spring Mountain, you're close to one end of Chinatown.  For those who haven't ventured down Spring Mountain Road to see and sample the amazing assortment of Asian shops and restaurants, this may be a good place to start?  Three of us went in for lunch.  The restaurant was dark inside, almost under-lit, giving me the impression that they don't want folks looking around too closely.  It wasn't obvious, but it made me wonder if the place was dirty or not in good repair.  I couldn't tell.  Even thought there were only a few other customers at tables, it took a minute for someone from the staff to realize we had walked in the door.  Even so, the greeting was friendly and once noticed, we were quickly seated, drinks were put on the table and our orders were quickly placed.  I ordered Beef and Green Beans off the Thai menu.  The food came out hot and tasted fine, and by fine I mean it was okay.  My honest impression was that the menu is large enough that many of what could be unique flavors for specific dishes may be blending together or lost for the cooks.  There were no unique Thai flavors in the dish I ordered and actually had to go back and look to be sure I ordered a Thai dish and not a Chinese dish.  Drinks were refilled regularly, there were no issues paying, and we were on our way after lunch without any unnecessary delay.  Was it great?  No.  Was it bad?  No.  Would I go back?  Sure, if someone I was with wanted to eat there.  If you're in this part of town, I think this is probably a safe place to grab a sit-down meal that's going to be consistently good, but with all the other options very near by, I'm sure you can find restaurants with a more tailored approach to the specific dish or dishes you're after.  One final note:  the shopping center where Kung Fu is located can be busy.  It's not a problem, but depending on your luck with parking spots, be prepared to park down the storefront quite a ways if you're there at lunchtime.

cU2mTwmh-D8fs1Hc9-CzUw.text: We had tom yum shrimp soup, hot and sour soup, pot stickers, smoked pork salad, pad thai and half roasted duck.    Great service. But it was not too busy when we arrived.    This is a family place and they have been in business since the 70s.  Their take out business is booming and famous with locals.  Ask valets at the area hotels if they know kung fu thai food...  Highly recommend the pad thai and roasted duck.    The menu is huge, dozens of items and large vegetarian menu.    Authentic and delicious thai food at a reaonable price.  Its a bigger operation than ''mom and pop'' , you can bring larger parties there with no fear of overwhelming the kitchen.    Highly recommend.

A6PpYhM0Syz0M4m8p7cSQg.text: The food was the bomb! not to spicy , good tasting food! very reasonable too! Highly recommend!

zZsQCqHGxU6u1T2Ano_zog.text: We have been coming here as a family for ten years, my husband and his family has been coming here since they opened. I've celebrated about 4 birthdays here, and many special occasions. It consistently wins Best of Las Vegas, and it doesn't disappoint. It has an extensive menu of authentic Thai and Chinese items. Enough to satisfy the novice, or foodie in your group. When the tour buses from Asia stop in it can get crowded, and it's even busy during the week. The floor is large, and can accommodate large parties. If you're in Vegas and haven't been here you need to stop in. And if you're staying in the strip it's just across the freeway from the strip in the China Town corridor.

rWMWLPUcqe67qG6NdIzCkw.text: One of my favorite places for Thai food. Prices are reasonable, and the food is great! The restaurant is medium sized, and I haven't had to wait to be seated for a table yet. The servers have always been very helpful and attentive when I've come.   They have my favorite panang curry (10/10 spicy oh yes!) and pad see ew (beef or tofu). My friends say that they have the best Thai Iced Tea here, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast duck egg noodle soup!

d61rQt1BpH4Ezi3t3_BpMg.text: I have ordered from here a few times.  They have fast delivery and I love their Mongolian Beef!!! Decent price too.

5-FGjJ9Px2o6LvFJkJYxrA.text: Yum! I had the pleasure of trying this place out when a couple of my coworkers decided to order some take out! The shrimp and pad Thai was my option of entree! I also ordered the fried wontons which I wish I would've got more clarification that they weren't the ones with the cream cheese because i was slightly disappointed once they arrived. For future reference I was told to order the crab ragoons if I wanted the cream cheese. I dinged them for a few stars because the delivery driver took over 2hrs for the order to arrive and then the customer service I received over the phone was horrible. The food is what would get me to return if I ever do!

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wontons were awful
Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo shrimp pad Thai

Fu young was too loaded with cabbage!  Sweet sour shrimp barely had shrimp.  The rock hard pieces were over fried.  We were forgotten most of the time.  I had to keep standing up and waving to the servers for drink refills.  We will not go back again.

The atmosphere and decor is old but the service is pretty good, I like spicy foods so I ordered our dishes to be a 8 out of 10 on their spice level, however it was not that spicy but for some weird reason it was sweet! NUaBsblq0Y01ORvFzsD9KQ.text: I love the food, but I never come here because the service is slow and terrible. I tried to get food for pick up to be quicker, so I ordered 20 minutes in advance. They said it would be done in 20 minutes. An hour later I got my food. Ridiculous.

CCFeW6ud-VwYCgtag-Yk6A.text: Here now.. very very bad service. Don't come! Food ok.. bad service! Slow... I had to give it star other wise I wouldn't have!

sscbz2jHia8fhOMg7lXQgg.text: My husband and I always eat here. Love this place. The closest to my moms cooking. Sunny (one of the staff members) is always so kind/nice to us! Our usual Thai spot. Food is awesome if you know what to order.

h_IwTAxB65UCNV_rJJ6ahA.text: I am a regular here their seafood soup is great. they are open 24 seven that's the best I strongly recommend the food and customer service.

9aM2CXL9GtIex52TjIoIuA.text: Best of Vegas hands down. Service is top Of the top and the food is even better. I found this place one time my car was broke down I was taking the bus. I was on the corner dying of heat in the middle of July at mid day. Guy comes out with with a cup of water after noticing me sitting there rotting in the sun. I took my family over there as a result of their kindness and believe me when I tell you the food is insane ! The fried rice !!! The general  tsao chicken !!!!!!!!!!!! Everything is off the hook and straight up your just nuts if you haven't been there !!!

ZikmDNro8Vsmv8xYa4kjtw.text: Spent Christmas Evening here :-) food was awesome!! The wait was pretty long but we expected it since it was Christmas. Anyway it was defiantly worth the wait. The staff was great, they were all running around trying to accommodate everyone as best as they could. The food came out fairly quick and I was really pleased with what we ordered. The Angus beef salad was my favorite :-) so yes we will definitely be back soon to try all the other items on the menu.

s8Om5PKOKEUTYWuBZawt0A.text: Horrible service, worse then a fast food joint that is slammed as f* and has a 16 year old working the window. jz75ZFnhldhu_1HbKBWJeA.text: Terrible service! When we complained to the owner he apologized but that was not sufficient as we thought our service would improve....NOPE

Nc95hIi06B319CfkDz6pTw.text: Don't go here unless you want horrible service!!!!  Last night's experience will NEVER make me go back to this place.  First they took like 20 minutes to come to our table to take our order, and that's after asking to other servers to see if we are going to get served.  They brought one of the items way before the other items arrives in which it got really cold.  Then since our server never came to check on us I went ahead and got up to ask an available buser for a spice rack and she completely snapped at me and put her hand up like as if she was shutting me up!  Unbelievable!! So once we finished our unpleasant meal I spoke to the manager about her rude buser and all she said was she will talk to her, the manager didn't care to accommodate for the bad experience and all she was worried about was if the food was good, not caring about the service or experience we received.  So with that said I will NOT step into this establishment again or even recommend anyone I know. This place is NOT WORTH YOUR TIME & MONEY!!

6DKZKK7RGvVrTfBTZLMRqA.text: Best thai food in town. Almost as good as moms cooking! Food is fast but sometimes appetizers come after main course, that's why only 4 stars.excuse the half eaten plates...

bjqfXT6C6YnjMZ45wNRsRg.text: We ordered carryout for a party of 6. After waiting 45 minutes for delivery it still hadn't arrived and after 30 more minutes and numerous calls to the restaurant and driver our food finally arrived. The food was phenomenal but it would've been nice to be compensated for the wait time or at least them called us to say sorry driver was lost instead of us having to find out what the hold up was. If our food was delivered timely we would've given 5 stars. It was that good!

Ww5QBAj2_bnydpsClbCdnQ.text: One of our favorite places to eat in Las Vegas, hands down. It's bit of a drive from where we live, but worth the trip every time. I haven't ordered a dish here that I didn't like.   The menu is massive and little overwhelming if you don't know what you want to eat. They offer both Chinese and Thai dishes. My husband and I always have a dilemma when ordering because we want to try new things but also want to order the dishes we love. Hubby always orders way too much food to insure he gets a great lunch the next day.  Recommended dishes:  Pa-nang Chicken- thick curry with coconut milk Tom Kha Chicken - Lemongrass soup with coconut milk Pad See Ew - Wide rice noodles in a garlic sauce Mongolian Beef- you all know what this is...

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3QUWBxCeSTcHOejZUycKmg.text: The food and service is always on point. I always have to stop here when I come in town. Their food is always consistent, great quality and comes out quick. There isn't one thing on the menu that I haven't tired and did not like. I want to pack Kung Fu in a box and take it home with me! There food is very reasonable price as well.

6doX75SFB-3FX2h_LGeqcw.text: Last day of vegas behind heading to the airport. We have 5 different dish. Panang curry, combination fried rice, garlic chicken, wanton soup and Pai Thai. First this is the first Thai restaurant that don't serve yellow curry. We heard from the other group said the same thing as well. All the food was below average in my opinion. The panang curry doesn't have any curry favor, it was made by the peanut butter. The combination fried rice has too much moisture in it. Garlic chicken little too favorful, but if eat it with rice. It will be fine. Pai Thai was kinda disappointing. It lacks favor and it doesn't taste like Pai Thai. It tastes like Chow mein instead. Let's talk about good points for this restaurant. The service from the staff is good and the food come out quickly. The price and food portion is average. Overall, due to the below average of food I probably won't come back.

QeDWZEyo6W_HYEXW1Eh2Wg.text: family friendly. accommodated every size of family. nostalgic food and comforting atmosphere. taking a bite of the pork jerky felt like your grandmother hand feeding you your favorite meal as a child. her blowing on it before every bite, and preparing more after every bite. it was a picture perfect family meal, the meal just didn't stay on the plate long enough for me to take a picture

FhsuYoVRNkurxImIJslK-w.text: Great food, growing up around Chinese food, I can say this is so much like home flavors. Love it.

ZJVe_3CNVr0-vkLXjmj6CQ.text: Service was bad, and one of the dishes, Pineapple Fried Rice, was horrible.  Their Thai BBQ chicken was on the dry side.  The flat noodles, that they use for Pad See Ew, were on the thick thick side.    The Pineapple Fried Rice was just soggy.  It didn't even seem that it was fried because of all the water or stock they added.  It was almost to the verge of porridge territory.  I was surprised at the prices too, about $10 a dish, for the quality and quantity they serve (meaning small portion).  Their menu is extensive. They specialize in Thai, and Chinese food.  I would rather go to the strip and pay and eat Americanized Chinese food.

Ct_-kH6tb6aVnfuemaxfEg.text: This is a nice restaurant. My family always come here for Thai food whenever we are in vegas.   From all the times we have came here, this place is amazing. Its Thai food is very similar to actual Thai food. I can't comment on chinese food though.  My only complaint is that they put one dish down at a time instead of putting down all the dishes at the same time.

oBpEPXal504QBt2KZ60d8A.text: We had the Shrimp Egg Foo Young, Shrimp Pad Thai and Laarb Chicken.  All were excellent.

I6TXSKO1ctCF7J6YuMQEKg.text: The food was great! I ordered the papaya duck salad in which the duck was strong and very flavorful.  Then I ordered the Tum Tum seafood soup,  I got a number 5 in which was very spicy.  Had to drink lots of water.  I would recommend that you get a 3 if you lie medium spicy foods lol

K1xj19xiG3nSLH7G98RlVg.text: I've seen a lot of reviews here... Complaining about the service... I think most of you need to chill a bit... Could the service be a tad better... Yeah it could... But the food totally makes up for it... English is a slight problem for some of the Workers... But it's a Chinese restaurant... Duh... Please don't listen to these negative reviews... You Only will be missing a great dining experience.... Huge menu even better preparation... My only complaint is I ate too much.... I usually bring food home... But the flavors were unique and wonderful.... Can't wait to go back.... It will be a while since I live in Los Angeles.... This place would do great there...

Combination FR and BBQ Chow Mein, i rather eat my parents)  3. water was refilled quite fast   4. the name of the restaurant? kinda silly  5. thai dishes were better than their chinese dishes  6. menu was large enough to feed a whole country  7. lastly, a couple sitting to the right of us were singing to each other.. my group of 9 were disturbed

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad See Ew

B6B0Pq4YFlZM1LjYnisLvQ.text: I'm Thai & I have no idea what Kung Fu has to do with Thai. Kung Fu is clearly Chinese so as for the name of the restaurant it should be Thai & Kung Fu Chinese Restaurant.   Thai Food: 3/5 It was okay not much to rage about. I ordered a yellow chicken curry. Usually curry comes in a semi-thick sauce but they was plan soupy. The rice we ordered for our curry ended up being over cooked and dry. Even though the curry sauce wasn't as thick as I'm used to it was still delicious. Not as spicy as I wanted it but It was an "Americanized 10" not Thai 10 on the scale of spicy.   Chinese Food: 2/5  I'm not much of a Chinese food eater because I've noticed a lot of Chinese dishes are super oil and greasy. BUT We ordered some kind of stir fried Mongolian Beef dish. It was definitely a Chinese dish because the sauce was oily you could see the oil bubbles.   Service: 3/5 The service was good even during busy hours. The place was a bit of mess though. There was rice and pea's ever where, but I just brushed it off because there were children running around. This place seems family ordinate but it was also loud.

N9q1_-Zh8T9jqBxP7Km0OQ.text: I work at a casino on the strip and this is the only place my co-workers and I could find that would deliver. The food is pretty good, there's no complaint there. The only complaint that I have is when we place an order over the phone. There are two people that we've noticed who take the orders, one is male the other is female. Every time we order from the male, the orders are always correct. When we order from the female, every time, the order is incorrect. Everytime. When we've called back to have them correct the mistake, she will sit there and argue with us. We've decided not to order from them again. Too bad. They've just lost steady business.

hIttgcRPAuEtRg-Uq_NK-g.text: Visiting Vegas and decided to try this spot ...service is great and their food was delicious!!! Came back 2nd night in a row for dinner. Had the War Wonton soup and chicken fried rice. ....Loved it!!!!

-j-MWBjXbaC5S4NaSlUYeA.text: The best Pa Nang Chicken Curry ive ever had!!! Off the strip, cheap, and amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pa Nang Chicken Curry- amazing!!

ptS3EYYjRFiYXhni1bbe0A.text: I love this place! Food is always amazing, staff is always super attentive.  Great price! One of my favorite Thai restaurant! Only reason why I gave 4 stars is because it has been open for awhile remodeling is a must!

T_iL1qXe3GVyjTasrZUFtQ.text: The wait to get in wasn't too bad. Once we were seated, we were quickly given water and ignored for the next twenty minutes. He waiter finally came and apologized for the wait. The drinks and food were really good. The pad Thai was great. I tried the mekhong, a Thai liquor, and liked it a lot. Their wine is vastly overpriced,  but it usually is when you go out anywhere. They let you add your own spice level at the table, which is much better than having to guess which number you would want. Overall, I would recommend this place.

SnTsBuxF-avWhCdw53ZwWw.text: Second time here, food came out very fast on a Saturday afternoon lunch time, pretty dang tasty overall, had a Pa-nang curry, pineapple fried rice, Mongolian beef, chicken pad Thai. We ordered everything spicy, yet still wanted more heat! If you like your Thai dishes spicy, order it at an 11 (out of 10). Maybe you'll get lucky and get that heat we missed out on.

i00OajT3rT8k0qpptlojwA.text: I really like this place. When we first moved here, we looked for a Thai place, and we couldn't believe how many were here! And most of them were within a city block of one another. So, naturally, we had to try each one. And, they were all pretty good. But this place was better. The Tom Yum Gai (chicken lemongrass soup) was the best by far. If you get the two-person portion, it's enough for three or four. After the soup, my wife is done, but I get a plate of Thai Bok Choy (Chinese cabbage cooked Thai style). Very fresh and the flavor really shines. The fact that they combine Thai and Chinese foods on their menu, is really smart. I've gone there for lunch, early dinner, late dinner, Christmas Eve, and Christmas day, and they're always almost full, but I've never had to wait for a table. It's a pretty sizable place. I don't drink, but you can't miss the huge bar on the right side of the dining room. Service is good, prices are reasonable. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!

LoomcKiax15aRSsX1a8IzA.text: Not enough superlatives - Best Thai food outside of Thailand.  Since our two weeks in Thailand several years ago we have constantly been sampling Thai food both at home and during our travels. This is unquestionably the best Thai food we have had in the USA.   It was recommended by a staff member at our hotel. This plus reading TA reviews convinced me that this should be the place for our first evening's meal in Las Vegas. We ate there three of the four nights of our stay.   I enjoyed the sweet and sour Thai style chicken so much I ordered it 3 times. We also shared beef with mixed vegetables and Pad Thai chicken.  We'll most certainly return on our next trip. It will be hard to choose an alternative restaurant as this place has set the bar so high. Our local Thai restaurant (which is fairly good) will have to suffice until next year.

B2NtWZiEQd7rQApWiCjOMA.text: I have been coming here for years and it is hands down my favorite Chinese and Thai restaurant in town. Hundreds of items to choose from and anything I've ever ordered has been delicious. Also, quite affordable.

V-af-OpYjGxIFK7Dzm7goA.text: Best general tsos chicken ive ever had. Service was good. My drink was refilled when i needed it to be. Couldnt ask for much more. Definitely visit this place if you want great chinese food

-AV4gB7_XVFIYJuzfmQJ9g.text: The garlic chicken is awesome. And the pad Thai is about the best ever.  We checked out the reviews and was do happy we did.

5rLXZQv5hY7CI4DNs74FIw.text: Always a good bet to come here if you're in the mood for reasonably priced Thai or Chinese food. Everything in the menu is delicious. I really recommend the 'beef jerky'. The place is consistently busy, which is always good sign.

UE3hC0yNAvEtFlx8zU4rig.text: Well I am not from Thailand or China to tell you if its authentic or not ,but I can sure tell you the food is good and flavorful. The Veg fried rice took me back to Mumbai in a flash for its resemblance to the street food.  A respite from the bland and overpriced food of The Strip  4 stars because I have been there just once

CsMDeRuKAZ5PosMruIsueg.text: I was in search of Shrimp Pad Thai and found this via google. Ordered placed for pick-up, ready in 15 mins...Great!   Parking was down a dimly lit drive thru/alley way. Got startled by what appeared to be a worker smoking in the corner; may I suggest you park on Spring Mt and walk around to Valley.   Upon entering the restaurant, the staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was inviting. I must say the dish was very tasty with a spicy level of 4.   The only complaint were the noodles were thinner than what I was used to, almost like angel hair pasta, and the shrimp were the tiny ones; I was a little disappointed, but yet it was still very tasty. You can order up for larger shrimp, but since it was my first time I wanted to experience the regular dish. If I had to eat here again, I would definitely order the larger shrimp next time.

7R7aBQ4xc4ZUrRZWahnL0w.text: Loved the chicken wings and vegetables with crispy pork. The General Tso's was a bit more sweet than spicy for my taste. Unlike other reviewers, our service was pretty decent. Definitely coming back to try something else.

0Ln1GnJur9O_LyzcskBXRw.text: As any other Thai or Chinese restaurant , the food is flavorful and aromatic with exotic spices.i have to admit some of the prices are high but definitely worth it. I love the seafood fried rice has spectacular quality seafood( scallops, fishball,squid, etc) I ordered the Tom yum with jumbo shrimp which was very good!
